Abilities: Level 0:  						Magic Shot,  						Raise Zombie,  						Lord of the Undead,  						Energy Control (2),  						Undead Regeneration 				Level 1:  						Hit Points +1 x4,  						Ranged Attack +1 x5,  						Resistance +1 x4,  						Ammo +1 x4,  						Energy Control +1 x7 				Level 2:  						Stamina +1 x3,  						Morale +2 x3,  						Magic Strike,  						Undead Summoning Power +1 x2 				Level 3:  						Counterattack +1 x3,  						Life Leech 25,  						Spellpower +1 x3 				Level 4:  						Ranged Defense +1 x3 				Level 5:  						Mass Curse 				Level 6:  						Attack +1 x3,  						Intrepid,  						Spell Duration +1 x2 				Level 7:  						Raise Ghoul 				Level 8:  						Stamina +2 x7,  						Defense +1 x2,  						Undead Summoning Power +2 x4 				Level 9:  						Hit Points +2 x6,  						Meditation +1,  						Mass Undead Restoration 				Level 10:  						Range +1 				Level 11:  						Ranged Attack +2 x5 				Level 12:  						Ice Immunity 				Level 13:  						Resistance +2 x2,  						Tireless 				Level 14:  						Ammo +2 x2,  						Willpower +1 x2 				Level 15:  						Raise Ghost 				Level 16:  						Life Leech +25,  						Thaumaturgy +1 				Level 18:  						Necromancer's Cry 				Level 19:  						Poison Immunity 				Level 20:  						Willpower +2
Description: Warlocks are adepts of necromancy and dark sorcery. They have spent many years learning the secrets of the dark arts, day by day probing the depths of forbidden magic. Warlocks are feared by everyone, from mere mortals to the very rulers who recruit them in their service. So great is the warlocks' power over the forces of Death that the enemies they defeat are not laid to rest. Instead, they rise from the dead to continue fighting at their slayer's side. Gaining experience in battle, warlocks greatly expand their arsenal of spells, learning more and more powerful spells of the school of Death. The best warriors have a chance to be transferred to an elite squad.

Name: Dragon
Abilities: Level 0:  						Flying,  						Magic Shot,  						Spell Immunity,  						Web Immunity,  						Entanglement Immunity 				Level 1:  						Hit Points +3 x4,  						Attack +1 x4,  						Ranged Defense +1 x5,  						Stamina +2 x5 				Level 2:  						Counterattack +1 x5,  						Defense +1 x5,  						Ranged Attack +2 x3 				Level 3:  						Intimidation +1 x3 				Level 5:  						Health +1 x3,  						Ammo +2 x3 				Level 6:  						Resistance +1 x3 				Level 9:  						Strength +1 x4,  						Morale +2 x2 				Level 11:  						Attack +2 x2 				Level 12:  						Stamina +3 x3 				Level 13:  						Hit Points +4 x3,  						Range +1 x2 				Level 14:  						Health +2 x3,  						Counterattack +2 x3,  						Ranged Attack +3 x3 				Level 15:  						Explosive Weapon 				Level 16:  						Attack +3 x2,  						Armor +1 				Level 17:  						Ranged Defense +2 x2 				Level 19:  						Willpower +1 				Level 20:  						Defense +2
Description: Few creatures in the world of mortals are more powerful than dragons. These enormous ancient creatures lead a secluded life, rarely leaving their lairs. In the course of their unbelievably long lives, they collect hoards of valuable weapons and armor left by the knights daring to challenge them.  In combat, dragons know no equals. Their scales are incredibly tough, and all dragons are immune to magic.  This ancient creature is so strong that a single one is easily capable of crushing an entire army. For the egg to be turned into a unit for a hero's party it is necessary to build a Reliquarium.

Name: Treant
Abilities: Level 0:  						Roots,  						First Aid +3,  						First Aid +6,  						Siege (8),  						Forest Knowledge +4,  						Entanglement Immunity,  						Immunity to Bleeding 				Level 1:  						Hit Points +3 x4,  						Attack +1 x4,  						Ranged Defense +1 x5,  						Stamina +2 x5 				Level 2:  						Counterattack +1 x5,  						Defense +1 x5,  						Entangling Shot 				Level 3:  						Morale +2 x2 				Level 4:  						First Aid +1 x4 				Level 5:  						Health +1 x3,  						Siege +2 x4 				Level 6:  						Resistance +1 x3 				Level 7:  						Poison Immunity 				Level 8:  						Stunning Blow +1 				Level 9:  						Strength +1 x4 				Level 11:  						Attack +2 x2 				Level 12:  						Stamina +3 x3 				Level 13:  						Hit Points +4 x3,  						Range +1 [Entangling Shot] 				Level 14:  						Health +2 x3,  						Counterattack +2 x3 				Level 16:  						Attack +3 x2,  						Armor +1 				Level 17:  						Ranged Defense +2 x2 				Level 20:  						Defense +2
Description: Researchers name these strange creatures resembling walking trees «Treants». They name themselves differently however: «Ents». They are an ancient race inhabiting Eador's oldest forests. They are the guardians of the woods and keepers of ancient knowledge. Elves respect ents and often ask them for advice. Other races are wary of treants, mainly because these beings are hostile towards anyone who harms forests. The bark-skin of treants is incredibly strong, and their arms possess immense power. In combat, ents entangle enemies with their roots, rendering them unable to move. Treants can put their roots down into the ground at any time, drinking its restorative sap to heal their wounds. For the acorn to be turned into a unit for a hero's party it is necessary to build Stonehenge.

Name: Hydra
Abilities: Level 0:  						Poison Attack (2),  						Attack All Enemies,  						Regeneration (4),  						Swamp Knowledge +2 x4,  						Web Immunity,  						Entanglement Immunity 				Level 1:  						Hit Points +3 x4,  						Attack +1 x4,  						Ranged Defense +1 x5,  						Stamina +2 x5 				Level 2:  						Counterattack +1 x5,  						Defense +1 x5 				Level 3:  						Morale +2 x2 				Level 4:  						Regeneration +1 x5 				Level 5:  						Health +1 x3,  						Poison +1 x4 				Level 6:  						Resistance +1 x3 				Level 9:  						Strength +1 x4,  						Poison Flesh (2) 				Level 11:  						Attack +2 x2 				Level 12:  						Stamina +3 x3 				Level 13:  						Hit Points +4 x3 				Level 14:  						Health +2 x3,  						Counterattack +2 x3 				Level 16:  						Attack +3 x2,  						Armor +1 				Level 17:  						Ranged Defense +2 x2 				Level 20:  						Defense +2
Description: A multiheaded poisonous creature lurking in the deep pools of Eador's swamps. The hydras are sometimes called «swamp dragons», for they are almost equal to the dragons in power. Hydras are too lazy to leave their lairs often, they feed on the creatures careless enough to wander into the bogs. However, hunger may drive a hydra out of its lair. A hungry hydra is most dangerous, leaving behind a trail of its victims' gnawed bones, feeding on any living creatures, from goblins to trolls. In combat, a hydra can attack all enemies surrounding it at once. The hydra's bite is poisonous and they are able to regenerate and heal their wounds. For the egg to be turned into a unit for a hero's party it is necessary to build the Monstrologists Guild.

Name: Cyclops
Abilities: Level 0:  						Trample (10),  						Hills Knowledge +1 x2 				Level 1:  						Hit Points +3 x4,  						Attack +1 x4,  						Ranged Defense +1 x5,  						Stamina +2 x5 				Level 2:  						Counterattack +1 x5,  						Defense +1 x5,  						Trample +2 x5 				Level 5:  						Health +1 x3 				Level 6:  						Resistance +1 x3 				Level 7:  						Web Immunity 				Level 9:  						Strength +1 x4,  						Morale +2 x2 				Level 11:  						Attack +2 x2,  						Hills Knowledge +2 				Level 12:  						Stamina +3 x3 				Level 13:  						Hit Points +4 x3 				Level 14:  						Health +2 x3,  						Counterattack +2 x3 				Level 16:  						Attack +3 x2,  						Armor +1 				Level 17:  						Ranged Defense +2 x2 				Level 20:  						Defense +2
Description: These fierce one-eyed titans dwelling in the hills of Eador are by far the smartest among all the giants. Often cyclopes manage to subdue giants and ogres. Sometimes they even enslave orcish tribes, forcing the orcs to provide them with food. Their ill temper and enormous strength make cyclopes extremely dangerous. In combat, a cyclops relies on his incredible power, often stomping small or injured enemies to death.

Name: Vampire
Abilities: Level 0:  						Flying,  						Bloodsucker (50),  						Lesser Undead 				Level 1:  						Hit Points +2 x5,  						Defense +1 x4 				Level 2:  						Attack +1 x5,  						Resistance +1 x4 				Level 3:  						Hit Points +3 x5,  						Counterattack +1 x4,  						Ranged Defense +1 x5 				Level 4:  						Bloodsucker +25 x3 				Level 9:  						Gaseous Form 				Level 10:  						Agility 				Level 12:  						Attack +2 x5 				Level 14:  						Resistance +2 x3 				Level 15:  						Counterattack +2 x2 				Level 16:  						Defense +2 x2
Description: Vampires are rightfully considered the most dangerous among the undead. These winged creatures hide in their crypts during the day and fly out to search for flesh blood at night. They say that whoever is bitten by a vampire soon becomes a winged blood-drinker himself. Most likely, these rumors aren't true, otherwise the number of vampires in Eador would be much greater. Holy water, garlic, holy symbols, and aspen stakes aren't as effective against vampires as legends claim. The surest way to lay a vampire to rest is by chopping it into pieces. That's easier said than done however, since vampires are incredibly strong and fast. Besides, they restore their health in combat by feeding on their enemies' blood. Like the rest of the undead, they feel no pain and know no fatigue or fear.

Name: Devil
Abilities: Level 0:  						Magic Shot,  						Armorpiercing Strike,  						Soul Stealing (5),  						Intimidation (3),  						Fire Immunity,  						Warp 				Level 1:  						Hit Points +3 x4,  						Attack +1 x4,  						Ranged Defense +1 x5,  						Stamina +2 x5,  						Soul Stealing (3) x4 				Level 2:  						Counterattack +1 x5,  						Defense +1 x5,  						Ranged Attack +2 x5 				Level 3:  						Morale +2 x2,  						Resistance +1 x3 				Level 4:  						Chaos Surge 				Level 5:  						Health +1 x3 				Level 7:  						Dark Dominion 1 x2 				Level 8:  						Ammo +1 x3 				Level 9:  						Strength +1 x4,  						Summoning Power +4 x2 				Level 11:  						Attack +2 x2,  						Cursed Armor 				Level 12:  						Stamina +3 x3,  						Resistance +2 x3 				Level 13:  						Hit Points +4 x3 				Level 14:  						Health +2 x3,  						Counterattack +2 x3 				Level 16:  						Attack +3 x2,  						Armor +1,  						Lord of Demons 				Level 17:  						Ranged Defense +2 x2 				Level 20:  						Defense +2
Description: Devils rightfully occupy the top rank in the hierarchy of Chaos spawn. Endowed with their own will, self-awareness, and intellect, the devils lead the armies of Chaos. Other spawns of Chaos obey them without question. Devils surpass their lesser counterparts not just in intellect, but in physical strength as well. In combat devils can shoot lightning and instantly move around the battlefield. Another aspect that makes the devils so dangerous is their ability to devour the souls of defeated enemies, thus regenerating their own health.

Name: Giant
Abilities: Level 0:  						Siege (6),  						Collect Ammo,  						Hills Knowledge +1 x2 				Level 1:  						Hit Points +3 x4,  						Attack +1 x4,  						Ranged Defense +1 x5,  						Stamina +2 x5,  						Armor Piercing Shot 				Level 2:  						Counterattack +1 x5,  						Defense +1 x5,  						Ranged Attack +2 x5 				Level 3:  						Morale +2 x2,  						Siege +2 x6 				Level 5:  						Health +1 x3 				Level 6:  						Resistance +1 x3 				Level 9:  						Strength +1 x4 				Level 10:  						Web Immunity 				Level 11:  						Attack +2 x2 				Level 12:  						Stamina +3 x3 				Level 13:  						Hit Points +4 x3,  						Hills Knowledge +2 				Level 14:  						Health +2 x3,  						Counterattack +2 x3 				Level 16:  						Attack +3 x2,  						Armor +1 				Level 17:  						Ranged Defense +2 x2,  						Ranged Attack +3 x2 				Level 20:  						Defense +2
Description: The giants are by far the largest among the colossal clans of Eador. They are strong enough to attack other races, even cyclopes and ogres, and walk away unpunished. Hurboch, the strong and incredibly wise Lord of Giants, was the first among them. Using his strength and knowledge, Hurboch formed military alliances with cyclopes and ogres to fight back their common enemies and commit atrocities in the newly conquered lands. In combat, giants hurl huge rocks at their enemies from a safe distance. This ingenious tactic is said to be invented by Hurboch himself - making him the wisest of all giants, indeed.

Name: Medusa
Abilities: Level 0:  						Petrification (6),  						Poison Attack (2),  						Swamp Knowledge +2 x3 				Level 1:  						Hit Points +2 x6,  						Morale +2 x2,  						Resistance +1 x2,  						Hex 				Level 2:  						Stamina +2 x6,  						Attack +1 x4,  						Defense +1 x4,  						Ammo +1 x4 				Level 3:  						Counterattack +1 x4,  						Ranged Defense +1 x4,  						Petrification +1 x5 				Level 4:  						Regeneration +1 x5,  						Poison +1 x5 				Level 5:  						Strength +1 x4 				Level 7:  						Health +1 x4 				Level 10:  						Range +1,  						Hex +2 				Level 11:  						Resistance +2 x3 				Level 13:  						Morale +3 x2 				Level 14:  						Attack +2 x2 				Level 15:  						Counterattack +2 x2,  						Speed +1 				Level 17:  						Hit Points +3 x2,  						Ranged Defense +2 				Level 18:  						Stamina +3,  						Defense +2 				Level 20:  						Health +2,  						Strength +2
Description: The medusas are among the most ancient creatures of Eador. No mortal in history was ever able to perceive what drives these snake-women. It is known they tend to live in the swamplands, creating their own «gardens of stone» by turning anyone who has the misfortune of wandering into their domain to stone. Apart from their petrifying gaze, medusas are dangerous because the snakes these creatures have for hair are poisonous. Even if an enemy manages to get up close and personal with a medusa without becoming rock-solid, he will most likely be killed by the deadly venom of her «hair». For the egg to be turned into a unit for a hero's party it is necessary to build the Trappers Guild.

Name: Giant Slug
Abilities: Level 0:  						Poison Shot (2),  						Poison Flesh (2) x5,  						Poison Immunity,  						Swamp Knowledge +4,  						Vitality 30 				Level 1:  						Hit Points +1,  						Attack +1 x5,  						Defense +1 x4,  						Damage Weapon (3) 				Level 2:  						Stamina +1,  						Counterattack +1 x5,  						Ranged Defense +1 x4,  						Ranged Attack +1 x5 				Level 3:  						Hit Points +2 x5,  						Morale +2 x3,  						Resistance +1 x4,  						Ammo +1 x5,  						Damage Armor 				Level 4:  						Stamina +2 x5,  						Necrophagy x2 				Level 5:  						Poison Shot +1 x4 				Level 7:  						Strength +1 x6,  						Poison +1 x3 				Level 11:  						Range +1 				Level 16:  						Attack +2 x2 				Level 17:  						Hit Points +3 x2,  						Defense +2 				Level 18:  						Stamina +3,  						Morale +3,  						Ranged Defense +2 				Level 19:  						Resistance +2 				Level 20:  						Strength +2,  						Ranged Attack +2
Description: Giant slugs prefer humid areas, such as swamps and town sewers. They feed on any organic substance, so any living creature is but a supplement for their diet. The slug's ability to spit poison poses a great threat to its enemies. When it comes to melee, slugs aren't that easily defeated either. These creatures are so dangerous that a mere touch of their slimy flesh is enough to cause poisoning. For the eggs to be turned into a unit for a hero's party it is necessary to build the Swamp Trappers Guild.

Name: Lizardman
Similar units: Beater, Whisperer, Bog Warrior, Bog Champion, Hisser
Ways to get: Lizardmen Quarter (building), #1439 (event), #1907 (event), fortifications in the province of the race Lizardmen, mercenary hiring
Abilities: Level 0:  						Regeneration +1 x5,  						Swamp Knowledge +2 x3,  						Lizardman 1 				Level 1:  						Hit Points +1 x2,  						Stamina +1 x3,  						Attack +1 x5,  						Counterattack +1 x5 				Level 2:  						Ranged Defense +1 x6,  						Morale +2 x3,  						Defense +1 x5 				Level 3:  						Hit Points +2 x7,  						Forced March 				Level 4:  						Recuperation +1 x4 				Level 5:  						Parry (2) 				Level 6:  						Resistance +1 x5 				Level 8:  						Stamina +2 x3 				Level 9:  						Swamp Rage +1 x2 				Level 10:  						Health +1 x3 				Level 12:  						Crippling Strike (2),  						Parry +2 x2 				Level 16:  						Attack +2 x2,  						Willpower +1 x2 				Level 17:  						Hit Points +3 x2,  						Strength +1 x2 				Level 18:  						Stamina +3
Description: Lizardman warriors are known for their great vitality: their natural regeneration allows them to heal the most terrible wounds very quickly. Although their bone spears, turtle carapace shields and seashell armor are a far cry from quality equipment, a lizardman's great strength and agility more than make up for the lack of good gear. Another note-worthy Lizardman trait is their tremendous discipline, which allows them to act as one, and protect their weaker members. It's especially hard to defeat lizardmen in the swamps, for the boggy marsh is their natural habitat.

Name: Phoenix
Abilities: Level 0:  						Flying,  						Magic Strike,  						Reincarnation,  						Phoenix,  						Scorching (2) 				Level 1:  						Hit Points +2 x4,  						Attack +1 x4,  						Ranged Defense +1 x5,  						Stamina +1 x5 				Level 2:  						Counterattack +1 x5,  						Defense +1 x5,  						Resistance +2 x7 				Level 3:  						Morale +2 x2,  						Willpower +1 x3 				Level 4:  						Scorching +1 x4 				Level 5:  						Health +1 x3 				Level 9:  						Strength +1 x4 				Level 10:  						Poison Immunity 				Level 11:  						Attack +2 x2 				Level 12:  						Stamina +2 x3 				Level 13:  						Hit Points +3 x3 				Level 14:  						Health +2 x3,  						Counterattack +2 x3 				Level 15:  						Willpower +2 x2 				Level 16:  						Attack +3 x2,  						Armor +1 				Level 17:  						Ranged Defense +2 x2 				Level 20:  						Defense +2,  						Strength +2
Description: A mysterious bird that dwells in the world of pure flame but, unlike the ordinary elemental spirits, possesses self-awareness. Phoenixes are most well-known for their ability to rise from their ashes after they have died. Very few mages can get hold of such a powerful ally, and even they are unable to secure a phoenix' help for long. Phoenixes cannot live in the physical plane and are constantly yearning to return to their native fiery element. The only exception are phoenixes born in the physical plane. Such cases are rare however. Not many people know how to acquire a phoenix egg from the fiery plane, and those who do are not willing to share their knowledge with others. For the egg to be turned into a unit for a hero's party it is necessary to build the Monstrologists Guild.

Name: Stone Golem
Abilities: Level 0:  						Golem,  						Damage Weapon (3),  						Stunning Blow +1 x4,  						Spell Immunity,  						Vitality 30 				Level 1:  						Hit Points +3 x4,  						Attack +1 x4,  						Ranged Defense +1 x5 				Level 2:  						Counterattack +1 x5,  						Defense +1 x5 				Level 4:  						Armor +1 x5 				Level 6:  						Resistance +1 x3 				Level 8:  						Crushing Blow 				Level 9:  						Strength +1 x4 				Level 10:  						Vitality +20 				Level 11:  						Attack +2 x2 				Level 13:  						Hit Points +4 x3 				Level 14:  						Counterattack +2 x3 				Level 16:  						Attack +3 x2 				Level 17:  						Ranged Defense +2 x2 				Level 18:  						Armor +2 x2 				Level 20:  						Defense +2
Description: The magic of creating stone golems dates back to ancient times. The enchanters of the past had most likely learned the secret of this spell from the Ancients themselves. Since then the spell was gradually improved and perfected. The golem's low speed is more than compensated for by its natural protection. The vulnerability to magic used to be considered a battle golem's primary shortcoming. However, recently the mages from the Arcania Academy succeeded in creating golems who are immune to magical spells. Unfortunately, virtually all magical energy is used to sustain the anti-magic shield, leaving golems still vulnerable to the simpler magical attacks. For the ingot to be turned into a unit for a hero's party it is necessary to build the Artifact Master.

Name: Witcher
Abilities: Level 0:  						First Strike,  						Precise Strike 2,  						Witcher's Signs 				Level 1:  						Hit Points +1 x7,  						Attack +1 x6,  						Defense +1 x5,  						Counterattack +1 x5 				Level 2:  						Attack +2 x2,  						Ranged Defense +1 x5,  						Precise Strike +1 x7 				Level 3:  						Health +1 x4,  						Strength +1 x5,  						Stamina +1 x3 				Level 5:  						Resistance +1,  						Armor +1 x3,  						Forest Knowledge +1 				Level 6:  						Regeneration +1 x5,  						Yrden Sign 				Level 7:  						Morale +2 x3 				Level 8:  						Stamina +2 x2 				Level 9:  						Hills Knowledge +1 				Level 10:  						Agility,  						Resistance +2 				Level 12:  						Willpower +1 x2,  						Axii Sign 				Level 13:  						Hit Points +2 x3 				Level 14:  						Swamp Knowledge +1 				Level 15:  						Ammo +1,  						Counterattack +2 x2,  						Web Immunity 				Level 20:  						Poison Immunity,  						Ranged Defense +2,  						Defense +2,  						Vigilance
Description: Witchers are monster slayers for hire. The first Witcher Brotherhood was established during a time of colonization in the wild. This shelter was strategically placed to avoid interruptions during the process of creating future witchers. The creation of a witcher is an arduous task, beginning as the potential witcher reaches the age of ten. The youth must endure a series of dangerous tasks on his path: only one out of ten candidates survive this perilous period. A witcher must metamorph his muscle and skeletal structure to endure the combat stress involved. The most important phase of a witcher's creation is the acquired talents of alchemy by ingesting plant extracts and mixtures which manipulate the composition of blood, metabolism and genetic infrastructure. From all of this endurance, the witcher becomes immune to poisons, diseases and various magical afflictions. In addition, a witcher bears a set of highly efficient magical abilities, known as signs.

Name: Cleaver
Ways to get: Orcish Barracks (building), fortifications in the province of the race Orcs
Abilities: Level 0:  						First Strike,  						Pike Wall,  						Orcish Fury,  						Vitality +20 x3,  						Heavy Armor 2,  						Keep Running! 				Level 1:  						Hit Points +2 x5,  						Stamina +1 x4,  						Counterattack +1 x4 				Level 2:  						Attack +1 x2,  						Orcish Fury +1 x5 				Level 3:  						Morale +2 x2,  						Defense +1 x4 				Level 4:  						Ranged Defense +1 x3,  						Forced March 				Level 5:  						Hills Knowledge +1 x2 				Level 6:  						Resistance +1 x3 				Level 7:  						Damage Weapon (3) 				Level 8:  						Stamina +2 x3 				Level 10:  						Health +1 x2,  						Recuperation +1 x2 				Level 11:  						Hit Points +3 x5 				Level 12:  						Damage Armor 				Level 14:  						Strength +1 x3 				Level 16:  						Armor +1 x3 				Level 18:  						Stamina +3
Description: When Orcs met mounted units for the first time, the Shamans had to think long and hard to find an effective counter. Unlike Humans, Orcs sneer at weapons that require strategy and discipline for effective use, but are unwieldy in a duel. Thus, the Orcish version of the bardiche was born. Orcish leaders were hard-pressed to explain the new weapon's ins and outs, but it was even harder to convince soldiers to give up their shield. In the end, they were successful by presenting the Shamans' creation as an over-sized two-handed axe with an unusual style. Having accepted their new weapon, those who wield them proudly call themselves "Cleavers". To compensate for lack of shield, they wear very heavy armor, even by Orcish standards, and use anvils for jewlery. These fighters are incredibly powerful.

Name: Death Touched
Ways to get: Call of Darkness (ritual), Altar of Death (site)
Abilities: Level 0:  						Magic Shot,  						Lesser Undead,  						Energy Control (2),  						Undead Regeneration,  						Death Touched,  						Lord of the Dead 				Level 1:  						Hit Points +1 x6,  						Resistance +1 x4,  						Ammo +1 x7,  						Raise Skeleton 				Level 2:  						Magic Strike,  						Ranged Defense +2 				Level 3:  						Ranged Attack +1 x4,  						Counterattack +1 x3,  						Attack +1 x4 				Level 4:  						Ranged Defense +1 x5,  						Energy Control +1 x6 				Level 5:  						Raise Ghoul,  						Spell Duration +1 x2 				Level 6:  						Counterattack +2,  						Defense +1 x3,  						Soul Trap 				Level 8:  						Hex,  						Eternal Slave 				Level 9:  						Meditation +1,  						Intimidating Shot +1 x2 				Level 10:  						Spellpower +1 				Level 12:  						Attack +2 				Level 13:  						Hit Points +2 x4,  						Control Undead,  						Life Leech 50 				Level 14:  						Resistance +2 x2,  						Intimidation +1,  						Hex +2 				Level 16:  						Defense +2 				Level 17:  						Thaumaturgy +1 				Level 18:  						Ranged Attack +2,  						Ammo +2 				Level 20:  						Life Drain
Description: Some magicians, fearing imminent death, often try to avoid this by empowering their bodies with immortality, a ritual known as the Eternal Night - the path of lichdom. They must gather the necessary rare ingredients for this crude, dangerous procedure. The slightest error in the creation of the phylactery or an overdose of one particular ingredient in the alchemical brews, and the magician will die an excruciating, irreversible death. Notes pertaining to the path of lichdom have no solidification that the ritual will guarantee success. One must also be a truly powerful spellcaster - a trait that many failed magicians misunderstand about themselves. Instead those failed magicians become what is known as a death touched. While death touched are much more vulnerable than their aspired manifestation, they still retain the power they contained in life. Thus they can expand on what they would have lost as a dying mortal. Their magical abilities are much more inferior to those of a full lich. Nevertheless, the transformation did not diminish the power they held when they lived, thus it is very dangerous to disturb the peace of a dead wizard, whether intentionally or accidentally. And the long, practically eternal life, to which they so aspired, allows them to patiently hone their magic skills and learn powerful new spells.

Name: Dracolich
Abilities: Level 0:  						Flying,  						Lesser Undead,  						Necrophagy +10,  						Necrophagy +5 x4,  						Intimidation +2,  						Web Immunity,  						Entanglement Immunity 				Level 1:  						Hit Points +4 x10,  						Attack +1 x6,  						Ranged Defense +1 x7,  						Intimidation +1 x4 				Level 2:  						Counterattack +1 x6,  						Defense +1 x6,  						Resistance +1 x10 				Level 6:  						Crippling Strike (2) 				Level 10:  						Strength +1 x2 				Level 12:  						Armor +1 x2 				Level 13:  						Attack +2 x4 				Level 14:  						Counterattack +2 x4,  						Defense +2 x4 				Level 15:  						Ranged Defense +2 x3 				Level 17:  						Strength +2 				Level 19:  						Armor +2
Description: Everyone knows that a dragon is one of the most dangerous enemies. When a dragon is conjured from death to undeath, their sheer power only increases. This being, known as a dracolich, is the most authoritative undead creation. The dracolich is obsessed with only one desire - to destroy all living beings and to devour their remains. Its durable ivory frame makes this creature hard to hit with melee weapons and arrows. In addition to its rough carapace, it possesses superior magic resistance. Like the rest of the undead, the dracolich knows no pain, fear or fatigue, and is immune to poisons. For the phylactery to be turned into a unit for a hero's party it is necessary to build the Tower of Necromancy.

Name: Behemoth
Abilities: Level 0:  						Armorpiercing Strike,  						Damage Armor,  						Crippling Strike (2),  						Intimidation (3),  						Vitality 30,  						Web Immunity 				Level 1:  						Hit Points +3 x4,  						Attack +1 x4,  						Ranged Defense +1 x5,  						Stamina +2 x5 				Level 2:  						Counterattack +1 x5,  						Defense +1 x5 				Level 3:  						Morale +2 x2 				Level 5:  						Health +1 x3 				Level 6:  						Resistance +1 x3 				Level 9:  						Strength +1 x4,  						Vitality +20 				Level 11:  						Attack +2 x2 				Level 12:  						Stamina +3 x3 				Level 13:  						Hit Points +4 x3 				Level 14:  						Health +2 x3,  						Counterattack +2 x3 				Level 16:  						Attack +3 x2,  						Armor +1 				Level 17:  						Ranged Defense +2 x2 				Level 20:  						Defense +2
Description: The behemoth is a mighty creature of barbarian folklore. Legends from the tribes describe this creature as having been sent down by the Skyfather when their people were banished from civilization. During this time, many shamans prayed for counsel and made sacrifices. One night, when a powerful shaman brought himself to the sacrificial altar, the sky lit with a bright flash as lightning struck the ground, and in the midst of that sudden natural phenomenon, the behemoth appeared. It was because of this magnificent creature's desire to defend the tribes from colonists that they were able to avoid their inevitable doom. They brought it gifts, fed it prisoners and otherwise worshiped it. It was surprising that the bloodthirsty monster didn't touch the barbarians themselves, except when some idiot inadvertently entered its lair. The behemoth is a fearful creature to those who manage to enrage it. It possesses excellent health and is literally able to tear apart any creature, thanks to its huge claws, which are hard as diamond and almost two feet in length. A kick from the behemoth can shatter a man's bones into dust. Fortunately, the monster's sheer size and lack of protection can lead to its defeat, if there are enough attackers swarming it. For a Soul Stone to be turned into a unit for a hero's party, a Blooming Lane is required.

Name: Hunter
Similar units: Goblin, Wolf Rider, Trapper, Beast Master
Ways to get: Mud (building), fortifications in the province of the race Goblins
Abilities: Level 0:  						Swamp Knowledge +2 x3,  						Panic 				Level 1:  						Hit Points +1 x7,  						Attack +1 x6,  						Stamina +1 x7 				Level 2:  						Counterattack +1 x6,  						Ranged Attack +1 x4,  						Poison Shot +1 x5 				Level 3:  						Defense +1 x3,  						Ammo +1 x4 				Level 6:  						Ranged Defense +1 x3 				Level 10:  						Resistance +1 				Level 13:  						Double Shot 				Level 14:  						Stamina +2 x2,  						Precise Shot +1 x2 				Level 15:  						Hit Points +2 x3 				Level 16:  						Ranged Attack +2 x2 				Level 18:  						Health +1 x2 				Level 19:  						Strength +1 				Level 20:  						Attack +2,  						Morale +2
Description: Life in Goblin society is usually dangerous, so missile weapons and the skills to shoot them provide a significant advantage to those who favor the safety of the rear over the battlefront. Goblin-Hunters roam the swamps, hunting down animals that pose no real threat, and often become bodyguards for wealthier peers. They consider themselves smarter and more cunning than other Goblins, who didn't hone ranged skills, as they have higher odds of surviving battle, due to the distance from the enemy. Should they encounter a foe in melee, however, they instantly lose that confidence. Despite their average marksmanship, Goblin-Hunters can still provide some support in small squads of thieves - with missile cover, ambushes and raids are easier and safer, especially in swamps, where all Goblins feel at home. Hunters don't rely too much on their shooting abilities, preferring to coat their arrow tips with various poisons. The best arrows they have are made from the fallen poisonous teeth of the Ericuba.

Name: Swordmaster
Abilities: Level 0:  						Parry (2),  						Armorpiercing Strike,  						Recuperation +1 x3,  						First Aid +1,  						Evasion Strategy,  						Heavy Armor 1 				Level 1:  						Hit Points +2 x4,  						Attack +1 x4,  						Defense +1 x3,  						Morale +2 x5 				Level 2:  						Stamina +2 x4,  						Counterattack +1 x5,  						Ranged Defense +1 x2,  						Parry +2 x3 				Level 3:  						Resistance +1 x3 				Level 5:  						Health +1 x3,  						Armor +1 x3 				Level 6:  						First Strike 				Level 8:  						Smite Evil +1 				Level 9:  						Strength +1 x4 				Level 11:  						Attack +2 x2,  						Ranged Defense +2 x2,  						Morale +3 x5 				Level 12:  						Stamina +3 x3,  						Willpower +1 x2 				Level 13:  						Hit Points +3 x3,  						Defense +2 x2 				Level 14:  						Health +2 x3,  						Counterattack +2 x3 				Level 15:  						Willpower +2 				Level 16:  						Attack +3 x2,  						Armor +2 x2
Description: Service in the Guard is subject to strict selection and rigorous training. Guards that have proven their skills in a trial for ownership of a two-handed sword, by successfully holding it for several minutes in a trial against a master without receiving wounds, are awarded the honorary title of "Swordmaster" and are promoted. Only born fighters are permitted to enter these rigorous trials before they can don their magnificent ironclad platemail - often forged with the rare, but resourceful mithril - and arm themselves with the sharpest weapons. In peacetime, a swordmaster continuously improves his combat skills, and in war they are used as a means to break the enemy's battle formations, turning the tide of battle. On a battlefield, swordmasters can withstand far more than the average man and can easily punch through a foe's defense. A lull in the fighting allows them to rejuvenate and treat wounds. Through intensive training, they can even run in their armor, despite the incredible difficulty. Their weapons, forged by the incomparable craftsmanship of their finest masters, can easily penetrate any armor.

Name: Dwarven Cannon
Abilities: Level 0:  						Armor Piercing Shot,  						Mechanical,  						Siege (8) x2,  						Crippling Shot (2),  						Siege Mode,  						Seismic Charge 				Level 1:  						Hit Points +2 x7,  						Ranged Attack +2 x5,  						Ranged Defense +2 x5 				Level 2:  						Resistance +1 x4,  						Explosive Shot,  						Fire Shot 				Level 4:  						Siege +4 x6 				Level 5:  						Ammo +1 x3 				Level 8:  						Defense +1 x3 				Level 10:  						Range +1 				Level 11:  						Ranged Attack +3 x4 				Level 15:  						Hit Points +3 x3 				Level 16:  						Hit Points +4
Description: Few people have ever heard of these unusual devices, and even fewer have ever personally witnessed what they are capable of. The monstrous dwarven Earthshakers are too heavy and too large to transport. But this masterpiece is something different. This war machine has the ability to move and although in this mode its shots are still terribly strong, when it actually stops and remains still, every shot brings death to all units adjacent to the target. For the contract to be turned into a unit for a hero's party it is necessary to build the Great Hall or the Mechanics Guild.

Name: Ranger
Abilities: Level 0:  						Double Shot,  						Precise Shot 2,  						Forest Knowledge +2 				Level 1:  						Counterattack +1 x3,  						Ammo +1 x3,  						Morale +2 x3 				Level 2:  						Ranger Shot,  						Attack +1 x4 				Level 3:  						Hit Points +1 x6,  						Ranged Attack +1 x4,  						Forager x4 				Level 4:  						Stamina +1 x6,  						Forest Knowledge +1 x2 				Level 5:  						Ranged Defense +1 x3,  						Precise Shot +1 x3 				Level 6:  						Defense +1 x2 				Level 7:  						Range +1 				Level 8:  						Resistance +1 x3 				Level 15:  						Hit Points +2 x2 				Level 16:  						Stamina +2 x3 				Level 17:  						Ammo +2 				Level 19:  						Hit Points +3,  						Ranged Attack +2
Description: Experienced archers often hunt while they are on patrol, honing their scavenging skills. Those who prove themselves to their captains are promoted to rangers. They are provided exemplary composite bows with steel-tipped arrows. Rangers perform solitary tasks, from delivering mail through wild heathland to monitoring the enemy for a few weeks. Rangers are less likely to travel in groups - instead proving their tactical worth by lurking in the shadows of the forests, waiting for the moment to execute their chosen prey.

Name: Ironclad
Abilities: Level 0:  						Parry (6),  						Forced March,  						Evasion Strategy,  						Shield Wall 3,  						Shield Bash (2),  						Keep Running! 				Level 1:  						Hit Points +2 x8,  						Ranged Defense +1 x3,  						Parry +2 x4 				Level 2:  						Attack +1 x4,  						Counterattack +1 x3,  						Stamina +1 x5 				Level 3:  						Morale +2 x3,  						Defense +1 x3 				Level 4:  						Resistance +1 x3 				Level 5:  						Shield Wall +1 x4 				Level 12:  						Stamina +2 x3 				Level 13:  						Morale +3 x2 				Level 14:  						Strength +1 x2 				Level 15:  						Willpower +1 x2,  						Armor +1 x2 				Level 16:  						Counterattack +2 				Level 17:  						Hit Points +4 x2 				Level 18:  						Stamina +3 x2,  						Attack +2,  						Ranged Defense +2 				Level 19:  						Defense +2
Description: Those of the swordsmen who have survived dozens of battles, defeated dozens of men and endured the loss of countless brothers-in-arms, will eventually be promoted to the ranks of the ironclad. These veterans are held in high esteem by their commander. They are equipped with shields and high quality armor. There's one thing about them you can be sure of: Ironclad do not falter when under enemy fire or in melee combat.

Name: Giant Eagle
Abilities: Level 0:  						Flying,  						Charge 				Level 1:  						Hit Points +1 x3,  						Attack +1 x5,  						Defense +1 x5 				Level 2:  						Stamina +1 x2,  						Counterattack +1 x5,  						Resistance +1 x4 				Level 3:  						Morale +2 x3,  						Ranged Defense +1 x5 				Level 4:  						Surge of Strength +1 				Level 6:  						Stamina +2 x5 				Level 7:  						Hit Points +2 x5 				Level 9:  						Health +1 x4 				Level 10:  						Agility 				Level 11:  						Necrophagy +5 				Level 16:  						Attack +2 x2 				Level 17:  						Strength +1 x2 				Level 18:  						Morale +3,  						Resistance +2 				Level 19:  						Ranged Defense +2 				Level 20:  						Health +2
Description: Huge birds that usually nest in the mountains. They can pose a serious threat in great flocks. Fast and strong, they are able to use their beaks and claws on creatures even larger than themselves.

Name: Wolf
Abilities: Level 0:  						Intimidation +1 x3,  						Forest Knowledge +2,  						Necrophagy +10,  						Wolf Pack 				Level 1:  						Stamina +1 x2,  						Morale +2 x4,  						Counterattack +2 x2 				Level 2:  						Hit Points +2 x3,  						Resistance +1 x3,  						Attack +2 x6 				Level 3:  						Hit Points +3 x4 				Level 4:  						Ranged Defense +2 				Level 5:  						Health +2 x2,  						Defense +2 x2,  						Recuperation +1 x5 				Level 6:  						Crippling Strike (2) 				Level 7:  						First Aid +1 x3 				Level 8:  						Forced March,  						Forest Knowledge +1 x2 				Level 9:  						Sinister Howl 				Level 10:  						Ranged Defense +1 				Level 11:  						Agility 				Level 12:  						Counterattack +1 x2 				Level 13:  						Hit Points +1 x3,  						Necrophagy +5 				Level 14:  						Ammo +1 x2 				Level 15:  						Attack +1 x2 				Level 18:  						Morale +3 				Level 20:  						Resistance +2
Description: A wolf, a plain wolf, a common forest predator. Wolves prefer fresh meat, but they are not picky about other kinds of nourishment. Although the wolf is not a particularly dangerous foe to engage by itself, a pack of them could easily overwhelm an unprepared victim.

Name: Sniper
Abilities: Level 0:  						Armor Piercing Shot,  						Forced March 				Level 1:  						Hit Points +1 x5,  						Stamina +1 x7,  						Resistance +1 x4 				Level 2:  						Defense +1 x3,  						Ranged Attack +1 x2 				Level 3:  						Morale +2 x3,  						Counterattack +1 x4 				Level 4:  						Ranged Defense +1 x3,  						Ammo +1 x3 				Level 6:  						Attack +1 x3 				Level 8:  						Ranged Attack +2 x5 				Level 9:  						Siege Mode 				Level 11:  						Hit Points +2 x5 				Level 14:  						Stamina +2 x2 				Level 15:  						Morale +3 				Level 16:  						Strength +1 				Level 17:  						Willpower +1 x2 				Level 18:  						Health +1 x2 				Level 20:  						Armor +1
Description: At the peak of a crossbowman's career, they are promoted to snipers by their commanding officer. Snipers are provided better equipment to take advantage of their honed skills, and they have a particular knack for putting an end to targets from a far distance.

Name: Berserker
Abilities: Level 0:  						Battle Frenzy (5),  						Stunning Blow +1,  						Bloodlust +1 x4 				Level 1:  						Hit Points +1,  						Morale +2 x3,  						Battle Frenzy +1 x10 				Level 2:  						Stamina +1 x3,  						Attack +1 x5 				Level 3:  						Hit Points +2 x5 				Level 4:  						Defense +1 x3,  						Counterattack +1 x2 				Level 8:  						Stamina +2 x4,  						Attack +2 				Level 10:  						Crippling Strike (2) 				Level 12:  						Ranged Defense +1 				Level 13:  						Hit Points +3 x3,  						Morale +3 x3 				Level 16:  						Health +1,  						Strength +1 				Level 18:  						Stamina +3 x2 				Level 19:  						Health +2 				Level 20:  						Strength +2
Description: A powerful warrior capable of going berserk in battle. These warriors enter battle wielding only a huge axe. In their berserker state of mind, they are oblivious to pain and fear. Berserkers with their unrivaled fighting skills often turn the tides of battle in their master's favor. Always at the front lines, where the most violent slashing occurs, these mighty men show the barbarians by example how to live and die as a true son of Heaven and Earth.

Name: Veteran Spearman
Abilities: Level 0:  						Heavy Ammo (3),  						Crippling Shot (2),  						Forced March 				Level 1:  						Hit Points +1 x5,  						Ammo +1 x3,  						Morale +2 x2 				Level 2:  						Stamina +1 x4,  						Ranged Attack +1 x3,  						Crippling Shot +1 x3 				Level 3:  						Counterattack +1 x5,  						Resistance +1 x2 				Level 4:  						Attack +1 x4 				Level 5:  						Ranged Defense +1 x3 				Level 6:  						Defense +1 x3 				Level 7:  						Range +1 				Level 10:  						Stamina +2 x3 				Level 11:  						Hit Points +2 x5 				Level 13:  						Morale +3 				Level 14:  						Ranged Attack +2 x2 				Level 16:  						Health +1 x2,  						Willpower +1 				Level 19:  						Willpower +2 				Level 20:  						Health +2,  						Strength +1
Description: These seasoned warriors often begin a battle by heaving their barbed pilums at their foes, causing puncturing wounds. Often veteran spearmen do not enter melee combat, but throw their projectiles at the enemy from behind their armored comrades. They are garbed in leather armor, reinforced with metal inserts, thus offering better protection against ranged weaponry.

Name: Witch Doctor
Abilities: Level 0:  						Magic Damage,  						Meditation +1 x2,  						Curse,  						Hex,  						Recovery,  						Spellpower +1 x5 				Level 1:  						Hit Points +1 x8,  						Resistance +1 x7,  						Morale +2 x3,  						Hex 				Level 2:  						Stamina +1 x8,  						Counterattack +1 x4 				Level 3:  						Ranged Defense +1 x2,  						Ammo +1 x4 				Level 4:  						Energy Control (2) 				Level 5:  						Ranged Attack +1 x4,  						Hex +2 x2 				Level 6:  						Attack +1 x3,  						Defense +1 x2 				Level 7:  						Energy Control +1 x2 				Level 12:  						Ranged Attack +2 x2 				Level 17:  						Hit Points +2 x2 				Level 18:  						Stamina +2,  						Range +1 				Level 20:  						Health +1,  						Willpower +1
Description: How shaman magic actually works has not been studied as well as the schools of other spellcasters. The shamans however have their own masters and experts on charms and potions, respectfully called "Witch Doctors". They are feared by other shamans and even some magicians don't consider it shameful to learn a thing or two from them. Witch Doctors are expert at healing and combat techniques based on the power of plants and minerals, but the real basis of their power is something else. These highly talented shamans are able to subdue small astral spirits and absorb them into their own body. Thus, the Witch Doctor extends his own life, and becomes more resistant to magical effects. Also his energy reserve is restored very quickly.

Name: Cutthroat
Abilities: Level 0:  						Agility,  						Dodge +2 x3,  						Poison Attack (3),  						Poison Shot (3),  						Precise Strike 2,  						Parry (4),  						Backstab +4 				Level 1:  						Hit Points +1 x4,  						Attack +1 x5,  						Ranged Defense +1 x6,  						Precise Strike +1 x7 				Level 2:  						Stamina +1 x3,  						Counterattack +1 x3,  						Resistance +1 x5,  						Poison Shot +1 x6 				Level 3:  						Ammo +1 x2,  						Mobility 				Level 4:  						Defense +1 x3,  						Backstab +2 x3 				Level 5:  						Ranged Attack +1 x4,  						Parry +1 x2 				Level 7:  						Morale +2 x2,  						Dagger Master 				Level 8:  						Stamina +2 x5,  						Poison +1 x4 				Level 9:  						Hit Points +2 x4 				Level 10:  						Armorpiercing Strike 				Level 11:  						Health +1 x4 				Level 14:  						Strength +1 x2 				Level 15:  						Attack +2 x3 				Level 20:  						Parry +2
Description: Despite their love of killing, some killers still find their way into active units, as cutthroats. Each commander with at least rudimentary tactical skills can understand the benefits of such fighters - fast and deadly, these cutthroats can spill blood. For a true master assassin it's not difficult to inflict a mortal wound on an enemy healer or poison a giant. A cutthroat would find good use in an army whose commander is not too worried about his reputation and is only interested in the death of his enemies.

Name: Cavalryman
Abilities: Level 0:  						Charge,  						Recuperation +2,  						Mobility 				Level 1:  						Stamina +1 x2,  						Attack +1 x4,  						Counterattack +1 x3 				Level 2:  						Hit Points +2 x10,  						Morale +3 x4 				Level 3:  						Ranged Defense +1 x4,  						Recuperation +1 x4 				Level 4:  						Resistance +1 x3 				Level 5:  						Stamina +2 x4 				Level 6:  						Defense +1 x3,  						Charge +1 				Level 7:  						Health +1 x4 				Level 10:  						Speed +1 x2 				Level 12:  						Counterattack +2 x3 				Level 13:  						Attack +2 x3 				Level 15:  						Willpower +1 x2
Description: A cavalryman is a skilled rider and experienced combatant who surpasses other mounted fighters. Commanding officers of a particular detachment will critically observe these riders, justifying expectations before deciding whether one is prepared for a unit transfer. Upon transfer, cavalrymen are provided superior equipment - a long, steel pike and reinforced chainmail for both the rider and his mount. A single cavalryman can turn the tide of a battle with the right execution of his charge. Even if the enemy was not cowed, cavalrymen are able to quickly regroup, recuperate and strike again.

Name: Valkyrie
Abilities: Level 0:  						Flying,  						Charge,  						First Aid +5,  						Recuperation +3,  						Magic Aura 2 				Level 1:  						Stamina +1 x2,  						Attack +1 x5,  						Morale +2 x3,  						Counterattack +1 x4 				Level 2:  						Hit Points +2 x10,  						Ranged Attack +1 x3,  						Defense +1 x6,  						Resistance +1 x2 				Level 3:  						First Aid +1 x3,  						Mobility 				Level 4:  						Ranged Defense +1 x3 				Level 5:  						Stamina +2 x4,  						Ammo +1 x3 				Level 7:  						Health +1 x4,  						Recuperation +1 x2 				Level 8:  						Smite Evil +1 x3 				Level 12:  						Speed +1 				Level 14:  						Willpower +1 x3 				Level 15:  						Morale +3 				Level 16:  						Attack +2 x2,  						Armor +2 				Level 17:  						Resistance +2,  						Counterattack +2 				Level 19:  						Ranged Attack +2 				Level 20:  						Range +1
Description: It takes a special sort of battle-hardened woman to tame a pegasus, for the winged creature prefers its independence over an ugly harness. These women who earn the trust of a particular pegasus are called valkyries - known by loremasters as "Virgins of Battle". These women are considered celestial, both in exotic beauty and unprecedented strength. Knowing full well that a pegasus is highly valued in an army, valkyries pledge themselves riding on a winged steed. As a rule, the period of such a service is not long by the standards of the valkyries - just a few years - but for mortals this is more than enough, and military commanders gladly take them in. In battle, valkyries are swift with their spear strokes. In addition to melee, valkyries have mastered the art of projecting their spears directly into the hearts of their enemies without error. Unfortunately, because of the altitude, their shooting range is not very long and their ammo supply is very limited.

Name: Bone Spearman
Abilities: Level 0:  						Lesser Undead,  						Intimidation +1 x2 				Level 1:  						Attack +1 x7,  						Ranged Defense +1 x8 				Level 2:  						Hit Points +1 x5,  						Resistance +1 x5,  						Defense +1 x4 				Level 3:  						Counterattack +1 x4,  						Ranged Attack +1 x3 				Level 5:  						Ammo +1 x3 				Level 6:  						Crippling Shot (2) 				Level 8:  						Hit Points +2 x3,  						Attack +2 				Level 9:  						Strength +1 				Level 10:  						Armor +1,  						Range +1 				Level 13:  						Heavy Ammo (3) 				Level 14:  						Ranged Attack +2 x2 				Level 15:  						Crippling Shot +1 				Level 20:  						Ranged Attack +3
Description: Skeletons that have the sense to attack from a distance are something to be feared. Possessing inhuman strength, the skeleton is able to project their spears quite far, making them terrifying instruments against unarmored individuals in the rear. Like all skeletons they are fragile, but hard to hit with ranged weaponry. Like any living corpse, it feels no pain and knows neither fatigue nor fear.

Name: Mummy
Abilities: Level 0:  						Regeneration +1 x2,  						Lesser Undead,  						Stunning Blow +1 x2,  						Hex,  						Cause Fever,  						Cause Putrefaction 				Level 1:  						Hit Points +1 x12,  						Attack +1 x4,  						Cause Putrefaction +2 x4 				Level 2:  						Hit Points +2 x8,  						Resistance +1 x3 				Level 3:  						Counterattack +1 x3 				Level 4:  						Defense +1 x3 				Level 6:  						Ranged Defense +1 x3 				Level 13:  						Strength +1 x2 				Level 15:  						Crippling Strike (2) 				Level 17:  						Attack +2 				Level 19:  						Counterattack +2 				Level 20:  						Crippling Strike +1
Description: While zombies are easily conceived creations of necromancy, some necromancers have an acute desire for something greater than its more durable, deadlier subjects. After an arduous ritual involving the infusion of magic, the necromancer can manifest an obedient servant: the mummy. Mummies are strong and hardy and have a high resistance to spells. This creature can curse an enemy, reducing its combat attributes. Magic disease causes considerable suffering, and healing the wounds inflicted by a mummy is almost impossible. Even if the enemy is strong, a mummy can always wait a while until the curse has done its work. Destroying this creature is quite difficult, so it's better not to get too close to it.

Name: Champion
Abilities: Level 0:  						Charge,  						Smite Evil +1,  						First Strike 				Level 1:  						Hit Points +2 x4,  						Attack +1 x4,  						Defense +1 x3,  						Morale +2 x2 				Level 2:  						Stamina +2 x4,  						Counterattack +1 x5,  						Ranged Defense +1 x3 				Level 4:  						Resistance +1 x3 				Level 5:  						Health +1 x3,  						Morale +3 x7 				Level 6:  						Armor +1 x3,  						Charge +1 x2 				Level 8:  						Speed +1 				Level 9:  						Strength +1 x4 				Level 10:  						Armorpiercing Strike 				Level 11:  						Attack +2 x2,  						Ranged Defense +2 x2 				Level 12:  						Stamina +3 x3,  						Willpower +1 x2 				Level 13:  						Hit Points +3 x3,  						Defense +2 x2 				Level 14:  						Health +2 x3,  						Counterattack +2 x3 				Level 15:  						Willpower +2 				Level 16:  						Attack +3 x2,  						Armor +2 x2 				Level 19:  						Ranged Defense +3
Description: Among the knights at grand tournaments, the winner will receive the title of champion and can continue his military service within a special unit. Only the most worthy, the most courageous, the most skilled - the elite among the knights - are serving in it. Champions are employed only by the most worthy of men and are often considered role models for young boys aspiring to becoming knights. They are noble, well-behaved and resilient. Like all horsemen, knights can use a mounted charge to inflict a crushing blow. Swift in combat, champions can seize the initiative and strike before an opponent can make a move. Their robust armor grants solid protection from most threats and their lawful, renowned presence leaves wicked individuals trembling in fear as they draw near.

Name: Cerberus
Abilities: Level 0:  						Crippling Strike (2),  						Mass Attack (2),  						Fire Immunity,  						Necrophagy +10 				Level 1:  						Hit Points +1 x2,  						Attack +1 x7,  						Ranged Defense +1 x6 				Level 2:  						Stamina +1,  						Counterattack +1 x3,  						Resistance +1 x5 				Level 4:  						Stamina +2 x7,  						Defense +1 x5,  						Petrification Immunity 				Level 5:  						Hit Points +2 x6 				Level 7:  						Morale +2 x2 				Level 8:  						Necrophagy +5 x2 				Level 11:  						Health +1 x4 				Level 14:  						Strength +1 x2 				Level 15:  						Attack +2 x3,  						Vigilance 				Level 19:  						Resistance +2
Description: A particularly large and ferocious hellhound can undergo a painful transformation over a stretch of existence. The sickening mutation leads the hellhound to acquire two additional heads, each being capable of tearing apart any fleshy morsel with their sharpened teeth. The terrible memory of this painful evolution fuels the cerberus with enough rage to enhance its already quickened speed. While one head gnaws at an enemy, the other two can seize portions of the victim, leading to devastating results.

Name: Succubus
Ways to get: Chaos Spawn (ritual), Gates of Abyss (site), Dark Pact (demonology)
Abilities: Level 0:  						Magic Shot,  						Hex,  						Fire Immunity 				Level 1:  						Hit Points +1 x7,  						Ranged Attack +1 x5,  						Counterattack +1 x5,  						Morale +2 x3 				Level 2:  						Stamina +1 x6,  						Resistance +1 x5,  						Defense +1 x5,  						Hex +2 x2 				Level 3:  						Ammo +1 x6,  						Attack +1 x5,  						Mind Control 				Level 4:  						Ranged Defense +1 x5,  						Energy Control +1 x3 				Level 5:  						Flaming Arrows +1 x3 				Level 6:  						Magic Strike 				Level 7:  						Fireblast 				Level 10:  						Range +1 				Level 11:  						Floating 				Level 12:  						Spellpower +1 x2 				Level 14:  						Stamina +2 x4 				Level 15:  						Hit Points +2 x3 				Level 16:  						Ranged Attack +2 x2 				Level 17:  						Resistance +2 x2
Description: Mostly a demon, a demon with a difference. A sub-class of the demonic plane, a succubus takes great pride and pleasure in her ability to charm other creatures with her alluring gaze and distorted beauty. Her power to dominate the mind of a victim makes her a resourceful instrument in battle. The only good news is that this uncanny ability requires lengthy and thoughtful training. Her charm is not the extent of her talents though, for the succubus is trained in sorcery and can project clusters of fire. A skilled succubus can arrange her temporary suitors in a line, destined to die in lust from her deceitful, burning passion.

Name: Wolf Rider
Ways to get: Creature Pens (building), fortifications in the province of the race Goblins, mercenary hiring
Abilities: Level 0:  						Charge,  						Web,  						Crippling Strike (2),  						Forest Knowledge +1 x2,  						Panic 				Level 1:  						Stamina +1 x2,  						Attack +1 x4,  						Counterattack +1 x4 				Level 2:  						Hit Points +1 x4,  						Defense +1 x5 				Level 3:  						Ranged Defense +1 x5,  						Necrophagy +5 				Level 4:  						Resistance +1 x3 				Level 5:  						Stamina +2 x4,  						Morale +2 x3 				Level 7:  						Health +1 x4 				Level 8:  						Ammo +1 x2,  						Charge +1 				Level 9:  						Web +1 				Level 10:  						Hit Points +2 x6 				Level 12:  						Counterattack +2 x3 				Level 13:  						Attack +2 x3 				Level 14:  						Range +1 				Level 15:  						Willpower +1 x2
Description: Goblins often ride huge wolves they breed - Wargs. These beasts are very smart, and it is no easy task to get them to accept a rider. However, the outcome is definitely worth the time and effort. Goblins who have tamed a Warg earn deep respect in their community. Wolf Riders make a good cavalry, fast and powerful. Riders carry a pair of hunting nets, and the Wargs' fangs can rip to shreds any enemy the Rider points to.

Name: Destroyer
Abilities: Level 0:  						Destroyer,  						Intimidation (3),  						Fire Immunity 				Level 1:  						Hit Points +2 x4,  						Attack +1 x4,  						Defense +1 x6,  						Morale +2 x3 				Level 2:  						Stamina +2 x4,  						Counterattack +1 x5,  						Resistance +1 x3,  						Siege +2 x5 				Level 3:  						Ranged Defense +1 x6 				Level 4:  						Strength +1 x5 				Level 5:  						Health +1 x3 				Level 8:  						Strength +2 x3 				Level 11:  						Attack +2 x2 				Level 12:  						Stamina +3 x3,  						Willpower +1 x2 				Level 13:  						Hit Points +3 x3 				Level 14:  						Health +2 x3,  						Counterattack +2 x3 				Level 16:  						Attack +3 x2 				Level 17:  						Speed +1 				Level 18:  						Resistance +2 				Level 19:  						Ranged Defense +2,  						Morale +3 				Level 20:  						Armor +2,  						Tireless
Description: The destroyer is a living siege machine from the demonic realm. Its thickened red carapace can withstand thrown boulders, and in return, it swings with massive claws, decimating whoever is unfortunate enough to stand before it into a pile of blood and viscera. The force of its strike is so great that it's rare to find armor that can soften that blow somewhat. The sheer scope and enormous strength of the destroyer is best observed during a siege. There are few walls able to withstand the creature's harrowing strikes as it tears apart chunks of stonework.

Name: Lord of Abyss
Abilities: Level 0:  						Magic Damage,  						Sacrifice,  						Fireblast,  						Fire Immunity,  						Flaming Weapon 				Level 1:  						Hit Points +2 x6,  						Attack +1 x4,  						Ranged Defense +1 x5,  						Stamina +2 x5,  						Dark Dominion 1 x3 				Level 2:  						Counterattack +1 x5,  						Defense +1 x5,  						Ranged Attack +3 x5,  						Warp 				Level 3:  						Morale +2 x2,  						Resistance +1 x3,  						Spellpower +1 x4 				Level 4:  						Ammo +1 x2,  						Suicide 				Level 5:  						Health +1 x3 				Level 6:  						Burning Attack +1 x3 				Level 7:  						Hellgates 				Level 8:  						Unholy Word,  						Flaming Arrows +1 x2 				Level 9:  						Strength +1 x4,  						Range +1 				Level 10:  						Submission 				Level 11:  						Attack +2 x2,  						Ammo +2 x2,  						Bane of Mortals 				Level 12:  						Stamina +3 x3,  						Resistance +2 x3 				Level 13:  						Hit Points +4 x3,  						Summon Demon 				Level 14:  						Health +2 x3,  						Counterattack +2 x3 				Level 16:  						Attack +3 x2,  						Armor +1,  						Thaumaturgy +1 				Level 17:  						Ranged Defense +2 x2,  						Ammo +3 x2 				Level 19:  						Armageddon 				Level 20:  						Defense +2,  						Chaos Distortion
Description: While demons are renowned for their overt aggression within the material realm, the Lord of Abyss prefers to operate from the shadows, watching and waiting for the opportunity to unleash Hell. While this creature's physical capabilities contend with those of the immortals, its preference in combat is that of infernal magic. This arsenal truly is a devastating sight to behold, for it has the potential to level entire cities and armies without much effort - its movement through teleportation hastens its ability to project large balls of fiery brimstone, making it the deadliest creature to face in single-combat within Eador. Be wary of these creatures!

Name: Spawn
Ways to get: Chaos Spawn (ritual), Gates of Abyss (site), Dark Pact (demonology)
Abilities: Level 0:  						Intimidation +1 x4,  						Fire Immunity 				Level 1:  						Hit Points +1 x6,  						Attack +1 x5,  						Resistance +1 x5 				Level 2:  						Stamina +1 x6,  						Ranged Defense +1 x3,  						Battle Frenzy +2 				Level 3:  						Counterattack +1 x4,  						Defense +1 x4 				Level 4:  						Morale +2 x3 				Level 6:  						Battle Frenzy +1 x4 				Level 13:  						Hit Points +2 x4 				Level 14:  						Stamina +2 x4 				Level 15:  						Counterattack +2 x2 				Level 16:  						Attack +2 x2 				Level 19:  						Defense +2 				Level 20:  						Ranged Defense +2
Description: The spawn is the result of a man's desire to unleash his inner-demon by entering a hellgate during a demonologist's ritual. And even though one needs at least some spark of magic to become a demonologist - a Chaos spellcaster - passing through the fires of hell one is stripped of any and all magical powers. Once that mortal returns through the hellgate, he has metamorphosed into a fleshy, bulging creature filled with one sole purpose: murder! Very tenacious in its actions, the spawn jumps upon its enemies with sharpened claws and hooked fangs. Its strength is fueled by its lustful frenzy.

Name: Bugbear
Ways to get: Orcish Quarter (building), fortifications in the province of the race Orcs, mercenary hiring
Abilities: Level 0:  						Pathfinder +1,  						Crippling Shot (2),  						Dodge +2 x3 				Level 1:  						Hit Points +1 x5,  						Attack +1 x6,  						Stamina +1 x7 				Level 2:  						Counterattack +1 x6,  						Ranged Attack +1 x3 				Level 3:  						Defense +1 x3,  						Ammo +1 x3 				Level 4:  						Range +1 				Level 5:  						Crippling Shot +1 x2 				Level 6:  						Ranged Defense +1 x3 				Level 8:  						Powerful Shot 				Level 10:  						Resistance +1 				Level 11:  						Hit Points +2 x5,  						Entanglement Immunity 				Level 12:  						Ranged Attack +2 x3 				Level 13:  						Recuperation +1 				Level 14:  						Stamina +2 x2 				Level 18:  						Health +1 x2 				Level 19:  						Strength +1 				Level 20:  						Attack +2,  						Morale +2
Description: Life in Orc tribes is harsh and ruthless for the weak. Constant wars, raids, and infighting have forced even female Orcs to be always ready to hunt for food, or even defend their lives and homes from intruders. Of course, female Orcs are not able to wear the same armor as male Orcs, or fight with heavy maces. Thus, they resort to bow and arrows, a weapon despised by true Orc warriors, who favor hand-to-hand combat. Nevertheless, tribe leaders know the usefulness of light-armed scouts, so-called Bugbears, always ready to support their fathers, husbands, and brothers with their arrows. Their bows are short and crude, but quite powerful, and their ability to sneak up on their prey makes them very dangerous on any terrain. From time to time, Bugbears perform surprise night raids, without any Orc warrior, to plunder defenseless Human villages, which is why their name has long been used to frighten young children.

Name: Ancient Ballista
Abilities: Level 0:  						Mechanical,  						Siege (4),  						Collect Ammo,  						Heavy Ammo (3) x2 				Level 1:  						Ranged Attack +1 x4,  						Resistance +1 x4 				Level 2:  						Hit Points +1 x3,  						Defense +1 x5,  						Ranged Defense +2 x4 				Level 3:  						Ammo +1 x4,  						Armor Piercing Shot 				Level 5:  						Siege +2 x3 				Level 8:  						Hit Points +2 x7 				Level 11:  						Range +1 				Level 13:  						Ranged Attack +2 x3 				Level 15:  						Siege +4 x2 				Level 18:  						Ammo +2
Description: Dwarves are ever ready to create siege engines for anyone who is willing to pay their price, but even the creations of these master craftsmen cannot compete with this particular ballista. These ancient machines were created before the Cataclysm and though rare, are still functional and dangerous. Like all machines, these ballistae of the Ancients, though far superior in strength to regular ones, are still relatively vulnerable to melee and magical attacks.

Name: Ancient Catapult
Abilities: Level 0:  						Collect Ammo,  						Mechanical,  						Siege (6),  						Armor Piercing Shot 				Level 1:  						Hit Points +2 x7,  						Ranged Attack +1 x5,  						Ranged Defense +2 x5 				Level 2:  						Defense +1 x3 				Level 3:  						Siege +2 x2 				Level 4:  						Resistance +1 x4 				Level 5:  						Ammo +1 x3 				Level 8:  						Range +1 				Level 9:  						Siege +4 x4 				Level 11:  						Ranged Attack +2 x4 				Level 15:  						Hit Points +3 x3 				Level 16:  						Defense +2 x2
Description: Everyone knows that only dwarves know how to make a good catapult. But few know that these great destructive devices, which cause so much excitement among soldiers - unless those soldiers are forced to attack fortifications protected by catapults, then the reaction is reversed - are just a pale remnant of the awe-inspiring siege engines of the Ancients, which were copied by the dwarves, apparently the first to discover them after the Cataclysm. It cannot be ruled out and is even quite likely that the reduced power of modern catapults are a deliberate design modification made by the dwarves, for everyone knows their scrupulous and meticulous attitude to all things mechanical, and it's highly doubtful that the dwarves somehow misunderstood something, or were incapable of reproducing it exactly the way they wanted. Nowadays these devices can only be found in the unexplored recesses of Eador. These Ancient Catapults are powerful and dangerous... but slow - and this is perhaps their only drawback.

Name: Runemaster
Ways to get: Master Halls (building), fortifications in the province of the race Dwarves
Abilities: Level 0:  						Poison Immunity,  						Fix (5),  						Hills Knowledge +2 x2,  						Rune of Decay 				Level 1:  						Hit Points +1 x2,  						Stamina +1 x4,  						Resistance +1 x5,  						Counterattack +1 x6,  						Morale +2 x4 				Level 2:  						Defense +1 x4,  						Attack +1 x6,  						Spell Duration +1 x3 				Level 3:  						Ranged Defense +1 x4,  						Ammo +1 x2,  						Rune of Restoration 				Level 4:  						Fix +1 x4 				Level 5:  						Hit Points +2 x5,  						Petrification Immunity 				Level 6:  						Rune of Renewal 				Level 8:  						Stamina +2 x3,  						Rune Shot 				Level 10:  						Health +1 x2 				Level 11:  						Rune of Power 				Level 14:  						Armor +1 x2 				Level 15:  						Hit Points +3 x3,  						Willpower +1 x2 				Level 18:  						Stamina +3 				Level 19:  						Strength +1,  						Ammo +2 				Level 20:  						Health +2,  						Willpower +2,  						Armor +2
Description: Dwarven magic is different from the techniques known among human wizards or elven druids. Dwarven spellcasters don't incinerate enemies with fireballs nor do they cause lightning to fall from a clear sky. Their art requires extensive training and a whole arsenal of tools, for it is based on the instant activation of an entire "chain" or "cascade" of rune spells, carefully and painstakingly recorded and cut before the fight. A runemaster dedicates his life to the study, preservation and improvement of his art and on the battlefield he is typically engaged in combat support and the repair of machines and golems. These spellcasters are often of respectable age and not often seen in the front lines of dwarven armies. They are protected by superior enchanted armor, allowing them to virtually ignore the missiles and blows of those who manage to get close enough. With experience a runemaster not only learns to repair and improve the siege engines of their own army, but also to sabotage the siege engines of the opposing forces. A veteran runemaster may even be able to take control over an enemy catapult - which can turn out to be a deadly surprise on the battlefield.

Name: Earthshaker
Abilities: Level 0:  						Armor Piercing Shot,  						Siege (8),  						Siege +4 x7,  						Mechanical,  						Immobilized,  						Bombardment 				Level 1:  						Ranged Attack +2 x5,  						Ranged Defense +2 x6 				Level 2:  						Hit Points +2 x7 				Level 3:  						Resistance +1 x4 				Level 5:  						Ammo +1 x3 				Level 8:  						Defense +1 x3,  						Range +1 x2 				Level 10:  						Change Ammo 				Level 11:  						Ranged Attack +3 x4 				Level 15:  						Hit Points +3 x3 				Level 16:  						Hit Points +4
Description: Dwarves all too eagerly and recklessly sell their catapults to anyone willing to pay. Do they not realize that many rulers are all too willing to turn their own weapons against them in an instant, using them to relieve the Dwarven people of their gems and gold? No, the dwarves are not that naive. They are aware of the risk... but they don't care, believing themselves well protected by the mountain strongholds of their people. The earthshaker is vastly superior to a conventional catapult in both range and damage. By means of a complex system of levers and counterweights it is able to throw stones and metal pellets at incredible distances. The most talented rune craftsmen are needed to build an earthshaker. Enchantments are not limited to the siege engine itself. Often, even projectiles are enchanted for increased accuracy and damage. In short, the earthshaker has only one serious drawback: Due to its enormous weight it is very difficult to transport to the frontlines or move on the battlefield. It cannot move on its own and requires a fair amount of manpower to reposition.

Name: Pathfinder
Similar units: Shape Shifter, Forest Keeper, Medium, Elven Mistress
Ways to get: Elven Garrison (building), fortifications in the province of the race Elves, mercenary hiring
Abilities: Level 0:  					Path of the Warrior or  					Path of the Hunter 				Level 0:  						First Aid +1 x5,  						Precise Shot 2,  						Change Ammo,  						Forest Knowledge +2 				Level 1:  						Hit Points +1 x7,  						Morale +2 x3,  						Ranged Attack +1 x3,  						Precise Shot +1 x3 				Level 2:  						Stamina +1 x8,  						Resistance +1 x6,  						Attack +1 x5 				Level 3:  						Defense +1 x4,  						Counterattack +1 x5,  						Forest Knowledge +1 x2 				Level 5:  						Ranged Defense +1 x3,  						Range +1 x2 				Level 6:  						Ammo +1 x4 				Level 10:  						Elven Marksmanship x4,  						Sniper Shot 				Level 11:  						Upkeep -40% [Path of the Hunter] 				Level 13:  						Morale +3 				Level 14:  						Resistance +2 x3 				Level 15:  						Hit Points +2 x3 				Level 17:  						Willpower +1 x2 				Level 18:  						Stamina +2 x2 				Level 20:  						Willpower +2,  						Armor +1
Description: The very best Elven warriors, who have no equal in bowmanship, secretly patrol the frontiers of Elven territory. Even on their own (they rarely assemble), these skillful trackers are a very formidable force. The gorgeous Elven bow, crafted by the most skilled bow smiths, is improved and refined individually by each Pathfinder, uniquely customized to their own battle style. Even seemingly ordinary arrows can suddenly pierce any armor. Strong armor or magical protection alone cannot guarantee the security of a Pathfinder's target. Only both steel and magic together provide a small chance of survival.

Name: Shape Shifter
Ways to get: Elven Garrison (building), fortifications in the province of the race Elves
Abilities: Level 0:  					Path of Power or  					Path of Agility 				Level 0:  						First Aid +1 x4,  						Forest Knowledge +2 x3,  						Shape Shifter 				Level 1:  						Hit Points +1 x4,  						Ranged Defense +1 x3,  						Precise Strike +1 x4 				Level 2:  						Stamina +1 x3,  						Counterattack +1 x3 				Level 3:  						Morale +2 x3,  						Defense +1 x4 				Level 4:  						Attack +1 x3,  						Resistance +1 x4 				Level 5:  						Vigilance 				Level 8:  						Stamina +2 x4,  						Round Attack (4) 				Level 9:  						Hit Points +2 x3,  						Entanglement Immunity 				Level 10:  						Upkeep -20% 				Level 11:  						Health +1 				Level 12:  						Web Immunity 				Level 13:  						Morale +3 x2 				Level 14:  						Strength +1 x2,  						Armor +1 				Level 15:  						Willpower +1 x2 				Level 16:  						Stamina +3 x3,  						Counterattack +2 				Level 17:  						Health +2 x2 				Level 18:  						Attack +2,  						Ranged Defense +2 				Level 20:  						Defense +2
Description: Elves typically prefer their trusty bow and great distance from the enemy in order to fully exploit their incomparable bow mastery. But among the forest warriors, there are some who, in battle, prefer to look the enemy in the eye. It might seem as if Elves are not the most powerful warriors, due to their natural grace, lightness, and, as a result, fragility - but Elven magic does help somewhat. Shape Shifters are able to transform in battle into their preferred mighty beast. Make no mistake, shifters can use the power of magical beasts to their full extent, and woe to those who underestimate these cunning warriors!

Name: Forest Keeper
Ways to get: Elven Grove (building), fortifications in the province of the race Elves
Abilities: Level 0:  					Path of Water or  					Path of Earth 				Level 0:  						Forest Knowledge +4,  						First Aid +1 x4,  						Life Breath 				Level 1:  						Hit Points +1 x6,  						Ranged Attack +1 x5 [Path of Water],  						Resistance +1 x4,  						Energy Control +2 x5 [Path of Water] 				Level 2:  						Stamina +1 x4,  						Ammo +1 x5,  						Morale +2 x3,  						Magic Strike,  						First Aid +3 				Level 3:  						Counterattack +1 x3,  						Magic Shield [Path of Earth],  						Spellpower +1 x2 				Level 4:  						Ranged Defense +1 x3,  						Enchanted Fang [Path of Earth] 				Level 5:  						Summoning Power +4 x3 [Path of Earth],  						Summon Eagle [Path of Earth] 				Level 6:  						Attack +1 x3,  						Summon Wasp Swarm [Path of Earth] 				Level 7:  						Summon Huorn [Path of Earth] 				Level 8:  						Defense +1 x2,  						Spell Duration +1 x2 [Path of Earth] 				Level 9:  						Meditation +1 				Level 10:  						Stamina +2 x6,  						Upkeep -20% 				Level 11:  						Ranged Attack +2 x5 [Path of Water] 				Level 13:  						Hit Points +2 x4,  						Resistance +2 x2,  						Summon Dire Bear [Path of Earth] 				Level 14:  						Willpower +1 x2 				Level 15:  						Summon Wasp Cloud [Path of Earth],  						Double Shot [Path of Water] 				Level 16:  						Bear Form [Path of Earth] 				Level 20:  						Willpower +2
Description: Some Elves devote their lives to worship Nature, and study its wisdom, becoming servants of the forest. They rarely leave their sacred groves, but when danger lurks near, they respond. Ill-suited for melee combat, Forest Keepers are however able to stop enemies from the distance - those who choose the Path of Water become deadly from long range, while those who prefer the Path of Earth can summon various beasts for protection. Forest Keepers are able to use the power of Nature to heal their allies' wounds, and neutralize poisons. As their experience grows, followers of the Path of Water learn to use their power much more effectively, while followers of the Path of Earth learn new spells.

Name: Huorn
Abilities: Level 0:  						Huorn,  						Poison Immunity,  						Tireless,  						Immunity to Bleeding 				Level 1:  						Hit Points +3 x4,  						Attack +1 x4,  						Ranged Defense +1 x5,  						Stamina +2 x5 				Level 2:  						Counterattack +1 x5,  						Defense +1 x5 				Level 3:  						Morale +2 x2,  						Stunning Blow +1 x2 				Level 4:  						First Aid +1 x4 				Level 5:  						Health +1 x3 				Level 6:  						Resistance +1 x3 				Level 9:  						Strength +1 x4 				Level 11:  						Attack +2 x2 				Level 12:  						Stamina +3 x3 				Level 13:  						Hit Points +4 x3 				Level 14:  						Health +2 x3,  						Counterattack +2 x3 				Level 16:  						Attack +3 x2,  						Armor +1 				Level 17:  						Ranged Defense +2 x2 				Level 20:  						Defense +2
Description: Semi-intelligent beings, the huorn are tree-like creatures similar to treants. Huorns are typically the result of a specific ritual conducted by druids. However, some of the old trees, especially in the ancient forests, seem to be falling asleep, with their number constantly dwindling. They are able to reproduce, but they are unable to walk. They are more like plants than like animals. A tree that is transformed into a huorn represents an insurmountable obstacle for all flightless creatures. All attempts to cut down a huorn are quickly and ruthlessly opposed - its great strength and tirelessness allows it to fight off an entire horde of "woodcutters" and the hardness and inherent strength of this magical tree makes it a hard enemy to defeat.

Name: Ghost Whisperer
Ways to get: Stone Idol (building), fortifications in the province of the race Orcs, mercenary hiring
Abilities: Level 0:  						First Aid +1,  						Soothe Spirits,  						Earth Totem,  						Vitality +20 x2 				Level 1:  						Hit Points +1 x5,  						Attack +1 x7,  						Resistance +1 x7,  						Summoning Power +4 x6 				Level 2:  						Stamina +1 x8,  						Counterattack +1 x5,  						Magic Strike 				Level 3:  						Defense +1 x4,  						Ranged Defense +1 x4,  						Elemental Strength 				Level 4:  						Ammo +1 x4 				Level 5:  						Morale +2 x3 				Level 8:  						Rage Totem 				Level 11:  						Hit Points +2 x4,  						Meditation +1 				Level 18:  						Stamina +2 				Level 19:  						Hit Points +3 				Level 20:  						Health +1,  						Willpower +1
Description: Orcs don't practice what Human or Elven wizards would consider magic. They conjure lesser spirits, summoning them briefly from astral realms with special rituals and binding to primitive artifacts that are their totems. But Orc shamans - Ghost Whisperers - look nothing like the shamans of barbaric human tribes. Because totem spellcasting is so slow, Ghost Whisperers are expected to fight alongside the other orcs, should the need arise. That's why they wield massive staves as useful for skull cleaving as they are for spirit binding.

Name: Spirit Conjurer
Ways to get: Stone Idol (building), fortifications in the province of the race Orcs
Abilities: Level 0:  						Magic Strike,  						First Aid +1,  						Soothe Spirits,  						Elemental Strength,  						Rage Totem,  						Summoning Power +4 x5,  						Vitality +20 x3 				Level 1:  						Hit Points +1 x5,  						Resistance +1 x4,  						Morale +2 x3 				Level 2:  						Stamina +1 x4,  						Ammo +1 x5 				Level 3:  						Attack +1 x7,  						Counterattack +1 x6,  						Defense +1 x3 				Level 4:  						Ranged Defense +1 x4 				Level 5:  						Meditation +1 				Level 7:  						Blood Totem 				Level 10:  						Stamina +2 x6 				Level 11:  						Hit Points +2 x5,  						Fire Totem 				Level 12:  						Willpower +1 x2 				Level 15:  						Resistance +2 x2 				Level 20:  						Willpower +2
Description: Spirit Conjurers are shamans of extraordinary power. Such a magical gift is extremely rare for Orcs, even though Ghost Whisperers often use special "mind expansion" and "magic enhancing" techniques. Usually, these involve internal and external application of various roots, weeds and mushrooms, mostly toxic, even fatal in some cases. However, experienced Spirit Conjurers are able to summon and bind powerful Astral entities, whose sheer force allows the Orcs to win the most hopeless of battles.
