It should also be noted that most Conjurers are not frail elderlies, but mighty Orcs able to surprise the enemy in melee. Conjurers sit on the Tribal Council alongside chieftains, and no significant raid, nevermind a war, is conducted without them.

Name: Chieftain
Ways to get: Warcamp (building), fortifications in the province of the race Orcs
Abilities: Level 0:  						Forced March,  						Hills Knowledge +1 x2,  						Chieftain Order,  						Evasion Strategy,  						Charge,  						Orcish Fury,  						Orc Commander,  						Vitality 30 				Level 1:  						Hit Points +3 x4,  						Attack +1 x4,  						Ranged Defense +1 x5,  						Stamina +2 x5 				Level 2:  						Counterattack +1 x5,  						Defense +1 x5,  						Orcish Fury +1 x4 				Level 3:  						Morale +2 x2,  						Crippling Strike (2),  						Vitality +20 x2 				Level 5:  						Health +1 x3,  						Bloodlust +1 x2 				Level 6:  						Resistance +1 x3,  						Charge +1 x3 				Level 7:  						Ammo +1 x2 				Level 9:  						Strength +1 x4,  						Web Immunity,  						Forest Knowledge +1 				Level 10:  						Crippling Strike +1 x2 				Level 11:  						Attack +2 x2 				Level 12:  						Stamina +3 x3 				Level 13:  						Hit Points +4 x3,  						Hills Knowledge +2 				Level 14:  						Health +2 x3,  						Counterattack +2 x3 				Level 16:  						Attack +3 x2,  						Armor +1 				Level 17:  						Ranged Defense +2 x2,  						Entanglement Immunity 				Level 20:  						Defense +2
Description: The brutal Orc society runs by the law of the jungle, and only the greatest of their kind become Chieftains, imposing their will upon ordinary tribe warriors, and accepting the best warriors into their personal guard. A true Orc Chieftain must constantly prove his superiority on a daily basis, because at the first sign of weakness, a strong, fierce, and skilled warrior is already waiting to take his place. But on the battlefield, with a single word from their leader, exhausted warriors find the strength to follow orders. In battle, Orc Chieftains usually gauge the enemy while riding huge and mighty animals called Karnafs, reminiscent of a cross between a bull and a rhinoceros. Few enemies would risk standing in the way of a furious Karnaf, and even fewer live to talk about it.

Name: Bandit

Description: Even an unskilled thief may be useful to the guild, for instance to establish control over a gang of robbers in the army, if they managed to get recruited. Especially fortunate gangs of rogue thieves may receive an offer to return to the guild, and even become a member of the Brotherhood. Bandits are quite valuable to the Twilight Brotherhood, so they try as much as possible to keep them alive. That's why they recruit experienced - and very expensive - teachers of light combat and the art of assassination, which makes bandits into very dangerous opponents - and the poison on their blades even more so. Bandits are usually sponsored by the thieves guild, so they're not as greedy as common thieves.

Name: Beater
Ways to get: Lizardmen Quarter (building), fortifications in the province of the race Lizardmen, mercenary hiring
Abilities: Level 0:  						Poison Attack (2),  						Regeneration +1 x3,  						Swamp Knowledge +2 x3,  						Lizardman 1 				Level 1:  						Hit Points +1 x2,  						Stamina +1 x3,  						Ranged Attack +1 x3,  						Counterattack +1 x3,  						Ammo +1 x2 				Level 2:  						Ranged Defense +1 x6,  						Morale +2 x3,  						Defense +1 x5 				Level 3:  						Hit Points +2 x7 				Level 4:  						Attack +1 x2,  						Recuperation +1 x2 				Level 6:  						Resistance +1 x5 				Level 8:  						Stamina +2 x3,  						Black Blood 				Level 9:  						Swamp Rage +1 				Level 10:  						Health +1 x3 				Level 12:  						Ammo +2 x2 				Level 13:  						Range +1 				Level 14:  						Ranged Attack +2 x2 				Level 16:  						Attack +2,  						Willpower +1 x2 				Level 17:  						Hit Points +3 x2,  						Strength +1 x2 				Level 18:  						Stamina +3
Description: Beaters, lizards armed with ranged weapons, are elite hunters roaming the boundless swamps in their territory. They are intelligent, observant creatures who maneuver through the murky environment of the swamps with ease. Their equipment far outclasses that of the common fighters, and they take care of preserving it. In combat, these archers provide invaluable support to the tribe's warriors. While lizardman-archers aren't particularly honed in melee combat, attackers often forget their venomous fangs.

Name: Whisperer
Ways to get: Bone Idol (building), fortifications in the province of the race Lizardmen
Abilities: Level 0:  						Magic Shot,  						Regeneration +1,  						Swamp Knowledge +2 x5,  						Quagmire,  						Lizardman 1,  						Summon Naiad 				Level 1:  						Hit Points +1 x7,  						Ranged Attack +1 x5,  						Counterattack +1 x5,  						Morale +2 x3 				Level 2:  						Stamina +1 x6,  						Resistance +1 x5,  						Defense +1 x5 				Level 3:  						Ammo +2 x3,  						Attack +1 x5,  						Spell Duration +1 x2 				Level 4:  						Ranged Defense +1 x5 				Level 5:  						Weakness 				Level 6:  						Thaumaturgy +1 				Level 7:  						Magic Strike 				Level 10:  						Range +1 				Level 11:  						Armor Break 				Level 12:  						Swamp Rage +1 				Level 14:  						Stamina +2 x4 				Level 15:  						Hit Points +2 x3 				Level 16:  						Ranged Attack +2 x2 				Level 17:  						Resistance +2 x2
Description: Within the deeply religious lizardman society, shamans are highly respected. Whisperers, as they are called, believe that they are in direct communication with their deities, but in actuality the Gods rarely deal with shamans - reserving their attention for the elite spellcasters. In battle, Lizards rally around Whisperers, as they weaken enemies in every possible way, preventing them from reaching warriors and archers. Though the Whisperers' arsenal is not spectacular, it is very effective.

Name: Bog Warrior
Ways to get: Bone Idol (building), fortifications in the province of the race Lizardmen, mercenary hiring
Abilities: Level 0:  						Regeneration +1 x5,  						Swamp Knowledge +2 x3,  						Lizardman 1 				Level 1:  						Hit Points +1,  						Attack +1 x4,  						Counterattack +1 x5,  						Defense +1 x5 				Level 2:  						Stamina +1,  						Hit Points +2 x6 				Level 3:  						Forced March 				Level 4:  						Stamina +2 x4,  						Ranged Defense +1 x4 				Level 5:  						Morale +2 x2 				Level 6:  						Health +1 x5 				Level 7:  						Swamp Rage +1 x3 				Level 8:  						Resistance +1 x2 				Level 11:  						First Strike,  						Armorpiercing Strike 				Level 13:  						Strength +1 x3 				Level 15:  						Counterattack +2 				Level 16:  						Stamina +3 				Level 17:  						Hit Points +3 x2 				Level 18:  						Attack +2 				Level 19:  						Vigilance 				Level 20:  						Health +2,  						Counterattack +3,  						Armor +1
Description: As with many societies, lizardmen employ their own form of protection throughout their territory. These lizards clearly stand out. Stronger and bolder, Bog Warriors also use sharp metal weapons, which makes them a formidable force. Despite the weight of their equipment, they move confidently in the swamps. Like other Lizards, Bog Warriors quickly learn how to heal their wounds, and skilfully protect their allies in battle. As their experience grows, their prowess with a battle axe can reach great heights.

Name: Bog Champion
Ways to get: Eternal Spring (building), fortifications in the province of the race Lizardmen
Abilities: Level 0:  						Regeneration (2),  						Swamp Knowledge +2 x3,  						Lizardman 2 				Level 1:  						Hit Points +2 x4,  						Attack +1 x4,  						Defense +1 x6,  						Morale +2 x4 				Level 2:  						Stamina +2 x4,  						Counterattack +1 x4,  						Resistance +1 x3,  						Regeneration +1 x4 				Level 3:  						Ranged Defense +1 x6,  						Stunning Blow +1 x4 				Level 4:  						Damage Armor x2 				Level 5:  						Health +1 x3,  						Swamp Rage +1 x3 				Level 6:  						Forced March 				Level 9:  						Strength +1 x4 				Level 10:  						Counterattack +2 x4 				Level 11:  						Attack +2 x2 				Level 12:  						Stamina +3 x3,  						Willpower +1 x2 				Level 13:  						Hit Points +3 x3,  						Poison Immunity 				Level 14:  						Health +2 x3,  						Armorpiercing Strike 				Level 15:  						Morale +3 x3 				Level 16:  						Attack +3 x2 				Level 18:  						Resistance +2,  						Crippling Strike (2) 				Level 19:  						Ranged Defense +2 				Level 20:  						Armor +2
Description: There are various castes among lizardman society, based on skin color. Commoners have various shades of green and rarely hold a significant position of power. Yellow-scaled lizardmen belong to the warrior caste, and are called Bog Champions. Those from this caste who prove their worth are regarded as leaders and champions of the lizardfolk. These bastions of the swamps fight valiantly to preserve their land and can often be found at the head of large groups. In battle, Champions protect their allies very skillfully, helping them in every possible way. Like most lizardmen, their excellent health allows them to recover even from severe wounds, and their natural abilities allow them free movement through the swamp.

Name: Hisser
Ways to get: Temple of Strength (building), fortifications in the province of the race Lizardmen
Abilities: Level 0:  						Magic Shot,  						Regeneration +1,  						Lizardman 2,  						Geyser,  						Summon Water Elemental,  						Swamp Knowledge +2 x4 				Level 1:  						Hit Points +1 x4,  						Ranged Attack +1 x4,  						Resistance +1 x3,  						Ammo +1 x4,  						Energy Control +1 x7 				Level 2:  						Stamina +1 x3,  						Morale +2 x3,  						Magic Strike 				Level 3:  						Counterattack +1 x2,  						Meditation +1 x3,  						Power Word - Pain 				Level 4:  						Ranged Defense +1 x3 				Level 5:  						Swamp Rage +1 x2,  						Spellpower +1 x3 				Level 6:  						Attack +1 x4,  						Power Word - Curse 				Level 7:  						Resistance +2 x3 				Level 8:  						Stamina +2 x7,  						Defense +1 x2,  						Spell Duration +1 x2 				Level 9:  						Hit Points +2 x6,  						Ranged Attack +2 x5 				Level 10:  						Power Word - Hold 				Level 12:  						Range +1 				Level 14:  						Ammo +2 x2,  						Willpower +1 x2 				Level 18:  						Thaumaturgy +1 				Level 19:  						Ranged Attack +3 				Level 20:  						Willpower +2
Description: Another caste in lizardman society bears red or purple scales, representing the apex of lizardman hierarchy. These powerful practitioners of magic are usually the leaders of large cities and armies. Particularly a red-scaled lizardman is destined to become the supreme ruler of the lizardfolk. Their authority is absolute, and in addition to being excellent mages, spellcasters are in fact in direct contact with their deities, thus strengthening their established seat of power through divine rule. It is said that the gods speak to the shamans, and they don't hesitate to abuse that notion of course, and manipulate their society as they see fit, presenting their own desires as the will of the gods. Spellcasters reluctantly join in battle, yet they do not fear it and they don't show their enemies any mercy, nor their own soldiers.

Name: Water Elemental
Similar units: Air Elemental, Earth Elemental, Fire Elemental
Abilities: Level 0:  						Elemental,  						Magic Shot,  						Water Elemental,  						Healing (7),  						Incorporeality 				Level 1:  						Hit Points +1 x7,  						Ranged Attack +1 x5,  						Counterattack +1 x5,  						Healing +1 x5 				Level 2:  						Stamina +1 x6,  						Resistance +1 x5,  						Defense +1 x5 				Level 3:  						Ammo +1 x6,  						Attack +1 x5,  						Spellpower +1 x3 				Level 4:  						Ranged Defense +1 x5 				Level 6:  						Range +1 x2 				Level 7:  						Thaumaturgy +1 x2 				Level 14:  						Stamina +2 x4 				Level 15:  						Hit Points +2 x3 				Level 16:  						Ranged Attack +2 x2 				Level 17:  						Resistance +2 x2
Description: Elemental spirits live on their own Planes, and usually do not leave them voluntarily. Some powerful spellcasters are able to summon them to the Material Plane for a short time. The spirits materialize in a "body" composed of their element - this is the only way they can withstand hostile environment. The elemental spirit of water crushes its enemies under thick, conjured blocks of ice. In addition, a water elemental can heal wounds. One option to combat elementals is to banish them back to their plane - a difficult task, but not impossible. Weapons often struggle to pierce the water elemental, and strong magic is required to afflict its glowing presence.

Name: Veteran Slinger
Abilities: Level 0:  						Collect Ammo,  						Recuperation +2,  						Stunning Shot +2 				Level 1:  						Hit Points +1 x5,  						Stamina +1 x4 				Level 2:  						Defense +1 x2,  						Recuperation +1 x3 				Level 3:  						Ranged Attack +1 x5,  						Armor Piercing Shot 				Level 4:  						Resistance +1 x3,  						Counterattack +1 x4 				Level 5:  						Attack +1 x2 				Level 6:  						Morale +2 x3,  						Ranged Defense +1 x2 				Level 8:  						Ammo +1 x2,  						Range +1 				Level 9:  						Stunning Shot +1 x2 				Level 10:  						Crippling Shot (2) 				Level 12:  						Hit Points +2 x3 				Level 17:  						Stamina +2 				Level 19:  						Health +1 				Level 20:  						Health +2
Description: After spending a certain time in service, inexperienced youths can become veteran slingers. These young men are provided small bucklers to help them survive the battlefield without hindering their ability to hurl their projectiles at the enemy. Besides their light leather armor and helmet, this significantly increases their chances of staying alive. Experienced veteran slingers are capable of quickly shooting down their targets, as long as they're not forced into melee.

Name: Sentinel
Abilities: Level 0:  						First Strike,  						Recuperation +1 x3,  						Agility,  						Forced March,  						First Aid +1 x5,  						Armorpiercing Strike,  						Evasion Strategy,  						Pike Wall,  						Keep Running! 				Level 1:  						Hit Points +1 x3,  						Resistance +1 x4,  						Morale +2 x4 				Level 2:  						Counterattack +1 x6,  						Stamina +1 x3,  						Damage Armor 				Level 3:  						Ranged Defense +1 x4 				Level 6:  						Defense +1 x3 				Level 7:  						Hit Points +2 x3 				Level 8:  						Stamina +2 x4,  						Attack +1 x2 				Level 13:  						Hit Points +3 x3 				Level 15:  						Morale +3 x2 				Level 16:  						Health +1 				Level 17:  						Willpower +1,  						Armor +1 				Level 18:  						Stamina +3,  						Counterattack +2 				Level 19:  						Health +2 x2 				Level 20:  						Strength +1
Description: While pikemen are tasked with facing enemies of one particular city, sentinels are seasoned veterans who ensure the safety of the people with their oaths to prevent any bloodshed. Adding chain mail and plate armor, armed with lances, these fighters are able to tightly block any passage, holding it as long as necessary. Their long reach can strike a foe before he can even approach. Sentinels also wear strong platemail to prevent grave injuries. Armed with well-forged weapons and suited in superior armor, sentinels are trained to withstand blows that would ordinarily cripple a man. Enemy forces will have to put in a lot of effort to merely budge these combatants.

Name: Grand Healer
Abilities: Level 0:  						Healing (7),  						Meditation +1,  						First Aid +3 				Level 1:  						Hit Points +1 x6,  						Morale +2 x5,  						Resistance +1 x6 				Level 2:  						Stamina +1 x6,  						Counterattack +1 x3 				Level 4:  						Ranged Defense +1 x3,  						First Aid +1 x2 				Level 5:  						Ammo +1 x3 				Level 6:  						Healing +1 x3 				Level 7:  						Attack +1 				Level 8:  						Defense +1 x4 				Level 13:  						Hit Points +2 x4 				Level 14:  						Stamina +2 x2 				Level 17:  						Willpower +1 x2 				Level 18:  						Health +1 x2
Description: After receiving the blessing of the Eagle God, a healer can be promoted to grand healer. Their healing capacity increases as a result, both in quality and in reach over distance. Like ordinary healers, however, their vulnerability is evident and they need outside protection.

Name: Wind Seekers
Similar units: Wind Runner, Wind Eclipser, Wind Roar
Ways to get: Centaur Tents (building), fortifications in the province of the race Centaurs
Abilities: Level 0:  						Forest Knowledge +2,  						Surge of Strength +1 x2,  						Ranged Support 				Level 1:  						Stamina +1 x2,  						Morale +2 x4,  						Attack +1 x4,  						Ammo +1 x6 				Level 2:  						Hit Points +1 x5,  						Ranged Defense +1 x5,  						Resistance +1 x3,  						Ranged Attack +1 x5 				Level 3:  						Counterattack +1 x3,  						Tribe Marksmanship 				Level 4:  						Defense +1 x5,  						Forest Knowledge +1 x2 				Level 5:  						Stamina +2 x4,  						Forager x2 				Level 7:  						Health +1 x4 				Level 8:  						Improved Support 				Level 12:  						Hit Points +2 x5 				Level 13:  						Willpower +1 x2 				Level 15:  						Strength +1 x2 				Level 17:  						Attack +2 				Level 18:  						Powerful Shot
Description: Young centaurs are expected by their parents to learn on the job and accompany the adult warriors and hunters of their tribe. Often times, this results in casualties, which enforces the notion that centaurs must learn from the mistakes of their fallen companions in order to survive the hardships of life. Although - by Centaur standards - these young centaurs (or "Wind Seekers" as they are called) are weak and inexperienced, they are no weaker than humans. To accommodate a young centaur's still developing muscles, they are provided bows and quivers in order to stay out of danger. Nevertheless, due to their inherent strength and endurance, these archers are able to compete with any human infantry, especially in forests, where their instincts allow them to effortlessly move through the most impenetrable jungle.

Name: Wind Eclipser
Ways to get: Centaur Camp (building), fortifications in the province of the race Centaurs, mercenary hiring
Abilities: Level 0:  						Recuperation +1 x5,  						Damage Armor,  						Forest Knowledge +2,  						Surge of Strength +1 x3,  						Strength in Unity,  						Tribe Power 				Level 1:  						Defense +1 x7,  						Stamina +1 x2,  						Morale +2 x5,  						Attack +1 x4 				Level 2:  						Hit Points +2 x7,  						Ranged Defense +1 x7,  						Resistance +1 x3 				Level 3:  						Counterattack +1 x4,  						Tribe Resilience 				Level 4:  						Charge 				Level 5:  						Stamina +2 x4 				Level 7:  						Health +1 x4,  						Forest Knowledge +1 x2 				Level 8:  						Stunning Blow +1 x2 				Level 9:  						Speed +1 				Level 13:  						Attack +2 x3,  						Willpower +1 x2 				Level 15:  						Strength +1 x2 				Level 16:  						Hit Points +3 x3,  						Counterattack +2 x2,  						Armorpiercing Strike
Description: Most people believe that all centaurs are archers. This is definitely far from the truth, and this false assumption may be due to the fact that for their raids centaurs tend to use cavalry with ranged weapons. Such beliefs often lead to a cruel joke being played on commanders that want to seize land the tribe considers theirs. They would encounter an unexpected foe - the Centaur-warrior, or Wind Eclipser. A powerful fighter who lacks neither speed nor muscular strength, allowing him to wield heavy melee weapons. This combination is certain to impress almost any enemy stupid enough to attack a settlement of centaurs. Besides that, these warriors spend all their spare time training and exercising for combat, which means they are experienced and have reached the pinnacle of melee combat skills.

Name: Spirit Talker
Ways to get: Sacred Flame (building), fortifications in the province of the race Centaurs, mercenary hiring
Abilities: Level 0:  						Magic Shot,  						Forest Knowledge +2,  						Overwhelming Force,  						Enchanted Arrow,  						Tribe Wisdom +1 x2 				Level 1:  						Hit Points +1 x6,  						Ranged Attack +1 x3,  						Resistance +1 x3,  						Armor Piercing Shot 				Level 2:  						Stamina +1 x4,  						Ammo +1 x5,  						Morale +2 x3,  						Magic Strike 				Level 3:  						Counterattack +1 x3,  						Spellpower +1 x3 				Level 4:  						Ranged Defense +1 x3,  						Meditation +1 				Level 5:  						Double Shot 				Level 6:  						Attack +1 x3,  						Forest Knowledge +1 x2 				Level 7:  						Spell Duration +1 x2 				Level 8:  						Defense +1 x2 				Level 10:  						Stamina +2 x6,  						Thick Fog 				Level 11:  						Ranged Attack +2 x3,  						Range +1 				Level 13:  						Hit Points +2 x4,  						Resistance +2 x2 				Level 14:  						Willpower +1 x2,  						Summon Air Elemental 				Level 20:  						Willpower +2
Description: When a centaur is born, they have a light brown skin. As they age, this color shifts to a red and darker brown. In their elder years, the color fades into an albino state. These wise elder centaurs share their wisdom and experience with their tribes. Among them there are those who possess extraordinary powers. They become shamans - known as spirit talkers - who communicate with the ethereal realm. Younger centaurs care for their elders and respect the shamans, protecting them on the battlefield at all cost. Given their declining strength, spirit talkers use spellcasting in battle, rather than melee combat. They call upon the souls of their ancestors to assist them.

Name: Wind Roar
Ways to get: Centaur Stables (building), fortifications in the province of the race Centaurs
Abilities: Level 0:  						Recuperation +1,  						Forest Knowledge +2,  						Ancestral Rage,  						Surge of Strength +1 x3,  						Strength in Unity,  						Tribe Might x2 				Level 1:  						Hit Points +3 x4,  						Attack +1 x4,  						Ranged Defense +1 x5,  						Stamina +2 x5 				Level 2:  						Counterattack +1 x5,  						Defense +1 x5 				Level 3:  						Morale +2 x2,  						Forest Knowledge +1 x2 				Level 5:  						Health +1 x3,  						Ammo +1 x2 				Level 6:  						Resistance +1 x3 				Level 7:  						Spell Duration +1 x2 				Level 8:  						Ancestral Shield 				Level 9:  						Strength +1 x4 				Level 11:  						Attack +2 x2 				Level 12:  						Stamina +3 x3 				Level 13:  						Hit Points +4 x3 				Level 14:  						Health +2 x3,  						Counterattack +2 x3 				Level 16:  						Attack +3 x2,  						Armor +1 				Level 17:  						Ranged Defense +2 x2 				Level 20:  						Defense +2
Description: These centaurs are the leaders of their tribes and are markedly different from the others. In the language of the centaurs, these leaders are called "Abar-na-ming" which translates as "Heaven is Might". Like human monarchs, the role of centaur-chief is hereditary. Some believe that the blood of a centaur-chief transcends mortal aptitude. Each generation's centaur-chief is provided the sword and armor of the previous ruler in order to maintain the image of their clan. With unquestioned authority, the Wind Rumble cares for his tribe like a father cares for his children, and is an example of courage and strength. He wields enormous power, to protect his large "family", and does not hesitate to use it, including - although this happens extremely rarely and is very sad - against other Centaurs. In addition to his excellent fighting skills, he is able, like shamans, of calling on his ancestors to request their blessing.

Name: Medium
Ways to get: Elven Grove (building), fortifications in the province of the race Elves, mercenary hiring
Abilities: Level 0:  					Path of Life or  					Path of Tenacity 				Level 0:  						First Aid +1 x5,  						Dispel,  						Forest Knowledge +2,  						Forest Protection,  						Keep Running! 				Level 1:  						Hit Points +1 x6,  						Morale +2 x4,  						Resistance +1 x5 				Level 2:  						Stamina +1 x6,  						Counterattack +1 x3 				Level 3:  						Spiritual Link [Path of Tenacity] 				Level 4:  						Ranged Defense +1 x3,  						Life Bond [Path of Life] 				Level 5:  						Ammo +1 x3 				Level 6:  						Forest Might 				Level 7:  						Attack +1,  						Meditation +1 				Level 8:  						Defense +1 x4 				Level 9:  						Spell Duration +1,  						Astral Energy [Path of Tenacity] 				Level 10:  						Upkeep -20% 				Level 11:  						Spellpower +1 				Level 12:  						Recovery [Path of Life] 				Level 13:  						Hit Points +2 x4 				Level 14:  						Stamina +2 x2 				Level 15:  						Morale +3,  						Forest Blessing [Forest Might Spell] 				Level 17:  						Willpower +1 x2 				Level 18:  						Health +1 x2
Description: Elven servants of the Great Forest often escort other warriors on campaigns, patrols, or battles. Able to channel the healing power of the ancient Elven forests, Mediums turn their bodies into a vessel to strengthen the body and mind of their kin, and unfortunately their gift does not affect them. All mediums are able to fight using offensive magic. Mediums are protected, preventing enemies from coming close, because, like all Elves, they are fragile and vulnerable.

Name: Elven Mistress
Ways to get: Great Tree (building), fortifications in the province of the race Elves
Abilities: Level 0:  					Path of the Stars or  					Path of the Sun 				Level 0:  						Forest Knowledge +4,  						First Aid +1,  						Magic Damage,  						Improved Charm 				Level 1:  						Hit Points +1 x4,  						Ranged Attack +2 x10 [Path of the Sun],  						Resistance +1 x3,  						Ammo +1 x3,  						Spellpower +1 x4 [Path of the Stars] 				Level 2:  						Stamina +1 x3,  						Morale +2 x3,  						Ranged Attack +1 x3 [Path of the Stars],  						Attack +1 x4 				Level 3:  						Counterattack +1 x5,  						Electric Shock [Path of the Stars] 				Level 4:  						Ranged Defense +1 x3,  						Energy Control +1 x6,  						Forest Knowledge +2 x3 				Level 5:  						Meditation +1 				Level 8:  						Stamina +2 x7,  						Defense +1 x2,  						Storm [Path of the Stars] 				Level 9:  						Hit Points +2 x6,  						Range +1 [Path of the Sun] 				Level 10:  						Resistance +2 x3,  						Upkeep -20% 				Level 13:  						Arrow Shower [Path of the Stars],  						Solar Blast [Path of the Sun] 				Level 14:  						Ammo +2 x2,  						Ranged Attack +2 x2 [Path of the Stars],  						Willpower +1 x2 				Level 15:  						Range +1,  						Mass Improved Charm [Path of the Stars] 				Level 18:  						Explosive Weapon [Path of the Sun] 				Level 20:  						Willpower +2
Description: Elven women rarely step onto a battlefield, but their presence cannot be underestimated. Despite her fragility and grace, an Elven Mistress who follows the Path of the Sun is a formidable adversary, able to wield her tremendous power to crush enemies from very long range. An Elven Mistress who follows the Path of the Stars can hurl the rage of air elements upon her enemies, and as she gains experience, the deadlier her spells become.

Name: Gang Leader
Abilities: Level 0:  						Forest Knowledge +2,  						Intimidation +1 x3,  						Crippling Strike (2) 				Level 1:  						Hit Points +1 x4,  						Stamina +1 x6,  						Attack +1 x5,  						Defense +1 x4 				Level 2:  						Ranged Defense +1 x3 				Level 3:  						Counterattack +1 x4 				Level 5:  						Resistance +1 x3 				Level 6:  						Morale +2 x2 				Level 7:  						Forest Knowledge +1 x2 				Level 9:  						Hit Points +2 x4 				Level 12:  						Stamina +2 x2 				Level 16:  						Health +1 x2 				Level 17:  						Hit Points +3 x2 				Level 19:  						Armor +1 				Level 20:  						Health +2,  						Strength +1
Description: The strongest of brigands, should they prove cunning and daring enough to survive that long, often become leaders of their own gangs. Due to the lawless, undisciplined nature of brigands, they tend to only follow a boss who can "take care of business". Given the amount of battle experience most gang leaders endure, expectations are usually met, along with filled pockets.

Name: Trapper
Ways to get: Goblin Hut (building), fortifications in the province of the race Goblins
Abilities: Level 0:  						Poison Attack (2),  						Parry (4),  						Set Snare,  						Pathfinder +1,  						Panic,  						Summoning Range +1 				Level 1:  						Hit Points +1 x4,  						Attack +1 x7,  						Ranged Defense +1 x6,  						Set Trap 				Level 2:  						Stamina +1 x3,  						Counterattack +1 x5,  						Resistance +1 x5,  						Summoning Power +1 x3 				Level 3:  						Ammo +1 x2,  						Poison +1 x5 				Level 4:  						Defense +1 x5,  						Precise Strike +1 x3,  						Set Hive 				Level 5:  						Parry (2) 				Level 7:  						Morale +2,  						Agility 				Level 8:  						Stamina +2 x5 				Level 9:  						Hit Points +2 x4 				Level 11:  						Health +1 x4 				Level 12:  						Subdue Beast 				Level 14:  						Strength +1 x2 				Level 15:  						Attack +2 x3,  						Armorpiercing Strike
Description: As experienced trackers, trappers are very skilled at hunting down prey. They prefer light, concealable knives, along with ranged weaponry to take out the bigger game. Their ability to maneuver through even the most dense of jungles allows them to anticipate enemy movements and act accordingly through the use of traps. Although goblin traps are not too dangerous, they can be very unpleasant a surprise.

Name: Beast Master
Ways to get: Goblin Ward (building), fortifications in the province of the race Goblins, mercenary hiring
Abilities: Level 0:  						First Aid +6,  						Poison Attack (3),  						Hornet swarm,  						Poison Claw,  						Pathfinder +1,  						Panic 				Level 1:  						Hit Points +1 x6,  						Resistance +1 x4,  						Spell Duration +1 x6,  						Magic Strike 				Level 2:  						Stamina +1 x4,  						Ammo +1 x5,  						Morale +2 x3,  						Voracity 				Level 3:  						Counterattack +1 x3,  						Swamp Blood 				Level 4:  						Ranged Defense +1 x3 				Level 5:  						Swamp Knowledge +2 x2 				Level 6:  						Attack +1 x3,  						Prod 				Level 7:  						Subdue Beast 				Level 8:  						Defense +1 x2 				Level 9:  						Meditation +1 				Level 10:  						Stamina +2 x6 				Level 13:  						Hit Points +2 x4,  						Resistance +2 x2,  						Summon Wyvern 				Level 16:  						Willpower +1 x2 				Level 20:  						Willpower +2
Description: When magic powers begin to manifest in a goblin, he almost always focuses on the control of swamp fauna. Some die torn to shreds by monsters when their control slips at the wrong time, but if their talent is strong enough, the little green runt lives to become a serious threat to anyone who crosses them. Beast Masters, as they call themselves, are tough opponents to face, having many ways to weaken their enemies. And let's not forget they usually bring large pets along...

Name: Ericuba
Abilities: Level 0:  						Agility,  						Swamp Knowledge +4,  						Poison Attack (2),  						Devour,  						Regeneration (2),  						Frenzy (10),  						Crippling Shot (2) 				Level 1:  						Hit Points +3 x4,  						Attack +1 x4,  						Poison Shot (2),  						Stamina +2 x5 				Level 2:  						Counterattack +1 x5,  						Defense +1 x5,  						Ranged Defense +1 x5 				Level 3:  						Morale +2 x2,  						Necrophagy x2 				Level 4:  						Regeneration +1 x4 				Level 5:  						Health +1 x3,  						Poison +1 x3 				Level 6:  						Resistance +1 x3,  						Poison Shot +1 x3 				Level 7:  						Swamp Knowledge +2 				Level 9:  						Strength +1 x4,  						Ammo +1 x2,  						Frenzy +5 x2 				Level 10:  						Crippling Shot +1 				Level 11:  						Attack +2 x2 				Level 12:  						Stamina +3 x3 				Level 13:  						Hit Points +4 x3 				Level 14:  						Health +2 x3,  						Counterattack +2 x3,  						Intimidation (3) 				Level 16:  						Attack +3 x2,  						Armor +1 				Level 17:  						Ranged Defense +2 x2 				Level 20:  						Defense +2
Description: In the swamps, there are many dangerous creatures. Some of them can even be tamed. One of these monsters is the Ericuba - a swamp creature. Goblins sometimes manage to sneak an egg out of one's lair, and even get away with it, except when the angry mother catches up with the thief. When such an egg is carefully stored in a warm and damp place, a small worm soon hatches. It grows very quickly, already taller than a goblin after a few days. In battle, the Ericuba can spit out its long, needle-like, poisonous teeth, causing significant damage and maiming the victim. She has nothing to worry about - they grow back very quickly, constantly renewing themselves in this way. Its poisonous teeth can shred a man to pieces, and the ferocity of its attack shocks enemies so much they freeze in horror. If necessary, an Ericuba may devour an ally to restore its own health. Of course, Ericubas feel at home in even the most impenetrable quagmire - they like to lurk, waiting until "dinner" comes too close. For the egg to be turned into a unit for a hero's party it is necessary to build the Monstrologists Guild.

Name: Halfling Rogue
Ways to get: Halfling Post (building), fortifications in the province of the race Halflings
Abilities: Level 0:  						Collect Ammo,  						Agility,  						Stunning Blow +1 x4,  						Parry (2),  						Halfling Rogue 				Level 1:  						Hit Points +1 x4,  						Attack +1 x5,  						Ranged Defense +1 x6,  						Ranged Attack +1 x6 				Level 2:  						Stamina +1 x3,  						Counterattack +1 x5,  						Resistance +1 x5,  						Hills Knowledge +1 				Level 3:  						Ammo +1 x2,  						Scavenger +10 x2 				Level 4:  						Defense +1 x5,  						Parry +2 x4 				Level 5:  						Forest Knowledge +1 				Level 7:  						Morale +2 x2,  						Web Immunity 				Level 8:  						Stamina +2 x5,  						Swamp Knowledge +1 				Level 9:  						Hit Points +2 x4 				Level 10:  						First Strike 				Level 11:  						Health +1 x4 				Level 13:  						Vigilance 				Level 14:  						Strength +1 x2 				Level 17:  						Attack +2 x2
Description: Halflings, by their nature, are an untrustworthy lot. Some neighboring villages have outright banned their kind from entering due to the occurrence of countless thefts. A fair generalization, given the legendary history of their exploits. They are as adventurous as they are greedy for treasure. Given the amount of trouble they get into, many of the more experienced halflings have taken up learning how to defend themselves, despite their natural aversion to violence. The weapon of choice for the halfling rogue are short swords. As a backup, they usually carry a lead-weighted cudgel in the sleeve of their shirt. The high level of agility natural to all halflings allows them to successfully dodge most blows and arrows aimed at them. They are highly adept at finding hiding places like double bottoms in chests or coins sewn into clothes.

Name: Border Sentinel
Abilities: Level 0:  						Forced March,  						Parry (4),  						Pathfinder +1 				Level 1:  						Hit Points +1 x9,  						Attack +1 x7,  						Defense +1 x5,  						Counterattack +1 x5 				Level 2:  						Attack +2 x2,  						Ranged Defense +1 x5,  						Parry +2 x5 				Level 3:  						Health +1 x4,  						Strength +1 x5,  						Stamina +1 x3 				Level 4:  						Recuperation +1 x4 				Level 5:  						Resistance +1,  						Armor +1 x3,  						Morale +2 x3 				Level 7:  						Precise Strike +1 x2 				Level 8:  						Stamina +2 x2 				Level 10:  						Resistance +2,  						First Strike 				Level 12:  						Willpower +1 x2 				Level 13:  						Hit Points +2 x3 				Level 15:  						Counterattack +2 x2 				Level 20:  						Ranged Defense +2,  						Defense +2
Description: Halflings usually settle far away from other people's borders, and tend to keep to themselves. Sometimes they do have to deal with various types of "adventurers", and occasionally they must protect their land from hostile neighbours. Halflings aren't cut out for this activity, but they make enough money to hire people who can hold a sword. Highly experienced and skilled warriors, border guards tirelessly protect the outskirts of halfling villages, lurking in seemingly impenetrable thickets. Masters of solitary battles, these rangers are able to strike from a seemingly safe distance, and retreat just as quickly.

Name: White Mage
Abilities: Level 0:  						Magic Shot,  						Word of Life,  						Resurrection,  						Energy Control +1 x5,  						Summoning Power +8 x2,  						Cure Wounds 				Level 1:  						Hit Points +1 x4,  						Ranged Attack +1 x3,  						Resistance +1 x2,  						Ammo +1 x4,  						Spell Duration +1 x5 				Level 2:  						Stamina +1 x3,  						Morale +2 x3,  						Magic Strike 				Level 3:  						Counterattack +1 x3 				Level 4:  						Ranged Defense +1 x3,  						Mass Healing,  						Spellpower +1 x4 				Level 6:  						Attack +1 x3 				Level 7:  						Ranged Attack +2 x5 				Level 8:  						Stamina +2 x7,  						Defense +1 x2,  						Resistance +2 x3 				Level 9:  						Hit Points +2 x6,  						Meditation +1 				Level 10:  						Range +1,  						Summon Living Armor 				Level 11:  						Mass Defense 				Level 14:  						Ammo +2 x2,  						Willpower +1 x2 				Level 15:  						White Magic 				Level 16:  						Summoning Power +4 x2 				Level 17:  						Ranged Attack +3 x2 				Level 20:  						Willpower +2
Description: Few people know the reason why these practitioners of magic are often found near halfling settlements. Their motivation to protect their undersized friends is heightened by their disdain towards those who would seek to plunder their settlements. Armed with the power of light, they take comfort in their earned privacy. White Mages tend to venture near the borders, lending their credence to the local hunters as companions. Weak in melee, these wizards are eminently capable of hitting the enemy from a distance and are thus of great help to their allies. For the contract to be turned into a unit for a hero's party it is necessary to build the Tower of Knowledge.

Name: Battle Gryphon
Abilities: Level 0:  						Flying,  						Charge,  						Stunning Blow +1 				Level 1:  						Hit Points +2 x4,  						Attack +1 x4,  						Defense +1 x6,  						Morale +2 x5 				Level 2:  						Stamina +2 x4,  						Counterattack +1 x5,  						Resistance +1 x3 				Level 3:  						Ranged Defense +1 x6 				Level 5:  						Health +1 x3 				Level 9:  						Strength +1 x4 				Level 11:  						Attack +2 x2 				Level 12:  						Stamina +3 x3,  						Willpower +1 x2 				Level 13:  						Hit Points +3 x3 				Level 14:  						Health +2 x3,  						Counterattack +2 x3 				Level 15:  						Morale +3 x3 				Level 16:  						Attack +3 x2 				Level 18:  						Resistance +2 				Level 19:  						Ranged Defense +2 				Level 20:  						Armor +2
Description: Occasionally, a gryphon may form a bond with an individual who takes care of it. It is fairly rare, and highly valued, because such a gryphon can offer incredible capabilities. Their trust in their acquired companions allow for the attachment of protective equipment - something that an untamed gryphon would never tolerate. The equipment attached to the gryphons is forged from durable alloy steel and mithril for minimal encumbrance, making them more fierce than their naked kin. Because their vulnerable parts are covered, the strikes of their foes won't cut as deep, thus granting greater longevity. The added value of a battle gryphon comes at a price, however, in the costs of upkeep - their quality is well worth the price though.

Name: Punisher
Abilities: Level 0:  						Crippling Strike (2),  						Round Attack (4),  						Soul Stealing (5) 				Level 1:  						Hit Points +2 x4,  						Attack +1 x4,  						Ranged Defense +1 x5,  						Stamina +2 x5 				Level 2:  						Counterattack +1 x5,  						Defense +1 x5 				Level 3:  						Resistance +1 x3,  						Dark Dominion 1 x2 				Level 5:  						Health +1 x3 				Level 6:  						Morale +2 x2 				Level 9:  						Strength +1 x4 				Level 11:  						Attack +2 x2 				Level 12:  						Stamina +3 x3 				Level 13:  						Hit Points +3 x3 				Level 14:  						Health +2 x3,  						Counterattack +2 x3 				Level 16:  						Attack +3 x2,  						Armor +1 				Level 17:  						Ranged Defense +2 x2 				Level 20:  						Defense +2
Description: These experienced executioners are a force to be reckoned with in direct combat. Clad in a durable shell, their role in battle can be likened to that of a sickle in a field of wheat - with the stalks being replaced by rows of potential corpses. They strike with punitive ferocity, leaving victims with painful and fatal wounds, if the terrible blows don't slay them outright. Despite all this tenacious power, the punisher may still feel the brunt of the impact from equally-skilled opponents, while their meager companions are busy fleeing in terror.

Name: Faith Devotee
Abilities: Level 0:  						Faith Devotee,  						Faith Devotee ablities,  						Bless,  						Restoration 				Level 1:  						Hit Points +1 x6,  						Resistance +1 x5,  						Healing +1 x5,  						Counterattack +1 x4 				Level 2:  						Stamina +1 x5,  						Morale +2 x4,  						First Aid +1 x4 				Level 3:  						Attack +1 x7,  						Ammo +1 x3 				Level 4:  						Defense +1 x2 				Level 5:  						Spellpower +1 x3 				Level 8:  						Ranged Defense +1 x2,  						Resistance to Fear 				Level 9:  						Strength +1 x2 				Level 12:  						Stamina +2 x5 				Level 13:  						Hit Points +2 x4,  						Counterattack +2 x2 				Level 14:  						Willpower +1 x3 				Level 16:  						Attack +2 x2 				Level 18:  						Resistance +2
Description: While monks often keep away from the front line in battle, there are those who have perfected the discipline necessary to step into the fray. And while experienced combatants often mock monks for their lack of grit, these trained zealots invariably surprise them. Divine power arms and guides these devoted servants of the Eagle - and this power never leaves them, healing their allies' wounds.. Their durable armor is concealed beneath their large robes, leaving unprepared enemies shocked when their strikes only cause wincing instead of crushing dismay - only to feel the crushing blow of the faith devotee's consecrated hammer.

Name: Keshik
Abilities: Level 0:  						Charge,  						Recuperation +1 x2,  						Mobility 				Level 1:  						Stamina +1 x2,  						Attack +1 x3,  						Ranged Attack +1 x5 				Level 2:  						Hit Points +2 x10,  						Ranged Defense +1 x5,  						Resistance +1 x4 				Level 3:  						Counterattack +1 x3,  						Morale +2 x2 				Level 4:  						Defense +1 x5 				Level 5:  						Stamina +2 x4,  						Ammo +1 x3 				Level 7:  						Health +1 x4 				Level 12:  						Morale +3 x2 				Level 13:  						Attack +2 x2,  						Willpower +1 x2 				Level 15:  						Strength +1 x2 				Level 20:  						Ranged Attack +2
Description: The Keshiks are the Khan's elite nomadic guards - revered for their devotion to protect the tribal lands. These agile and swift archers notch their bows with impeccable speed, capable of showering the battlefield with feathered arrows before the opponent draws near. While most archers dread the inevitable clash with melee combatants, keshiks are not only prepared to face their foes with determination: they actually welcome the opportunity to display their uncanny skill at swordplay.

Name: Witchhunter
Abilities: Level 0:  					Bane of Undead or  					Bane of Demons 				Level 0:  						Smite Evil +1 x2,  						Armor Piercing Shot 				Level 1:  						Hit Points +1 x2,  						Counterattack +1 x4,  						Ranged Defense +1 x3,  						Resistance +1 				Level 2:  						Ranged Attack +1 x3,  						Stamina +1 x3,  						Precise Strike +1 x3 				Level 3:  						Defense +1 x3,  						Morale +2 x3,  						Hunter of Demons +1 x2 				Level 4:  						Attack +1 x3,  						Resistance +2 x5 				Level 5:  						Hit Points +2 x3,  						Ammo +1 x3 				Level 6:  						Hunter of Undead +1 x2 				Level 7:  						Crippling Shot (2) 				Level 8:  						Stamina +2 x4,  						Agility 				Level 11:  						Health +1 				Level 12:  						Forced March 				Level 13:  						Hit Points +3 x2,  						Ranged Attack +2 x2,  						Morale +3 x2 				Level 14:  						Strength +1 x2,  						Armor +1 x2 				Level 15:  						Range +1,  						Willpower +1 x2 				Level 16:  						Counterattack +2,  						Stamina +3 x3,  						Crippling Shot +1 				Level 17:  						Health +2 x2 				Level 18:  						Attack +2,  						Ranged Defense +2 				Level 19:  						Defense +2 				Level 20:  						Resistance to Fear
Description: Revered by believers and dangerous to all heretics, the Holy Inquisition has long been faced with the need to have their own fighters, rather than relying on assistance from hired guards or mercenaries. The bulk of the Inquisition armed forces is made up of witchhunters - graduates of special church schools where tuition consists of continuous combat exercises, punctuated by long days of fasting and prayer. The graduates complete their combat training in steel and blood - their own and others - to prove that they are worthy to join the holy army. Witchhunters accompany inquisitors on their travels, protect their monastery, and many of them secretly live among ordinary people, vigilantly watching for signs of heresy and witchcraft. Representing the greatest threat to magicians of all schools, these inquisition hunters are trained to track, prosecute and purge those who even attempt any form of witchery.

Name: Inquisitor
Abilities: Level 0:  						Magic Shot,  						Healing (7),  						Meditation +1,  						Dispel Magic,  						Armor of Faith +25 				Level 1:  						Hit Points +1 x6,  						Resistance +1 x5,  						Morale +2 x4,  						Healing +1 x6,  						Counterattack +1 x5 				Level 2:  						Stamina +1 x5,  						First Aid +1 x5,  						Spell Duration +1 x4 				Level 3:  						Attack +1 x4,  						Grace 				Level 4:  						Defense +1 x2,  						Ammo +1 x3 				Level 6:  						Ranged Attack +1 x2,  						Armor of Faith 				Level 8:  						Ranged Defense +1 x2 				Level 10:  						Sanctuary 				Level 12:  						Stamina +2 x5 				Level 13:  						Hit Points +2 x4,  						Reincarnation 				Level 14:  						Willpower +1 x3 				Level 18:  						Resistance +2,  						Ammo +2 				Level 19:  						Strength +1 				Level 20:  						Ranged Attack +2
Description: Harsh and rigid, these holy men confine themselves to small monasteries in dedication to the Church of the Great Eagle, tempered in spirit through long vigils and prayer. The strength of their spiritual discipline surpasses that of most men, and only few are able to withstand their piercing eyes, penetrating into the darkest corners of one's soul. An inquisitor knows no bounds when confronting the "enemies of mankind": Witches, demons and the undead. Their indisputable ability to heal the wounds of their brethren makes them indispensable in the battle against the spawns of Chaos. In combat, inquisitors direct their ability to protect their brothers in the faith, novices and senior hierarchs to avoid losses and remain invincible.

Name: Grand Inquisitor
Abilities: Level 0:  						Magic Shot,  						Meditation +1,  						Demon Slayer,  						Energy Control (2),  						Break spell x4,  						Armor of Faith +25 				Level 1:  						Hit Points +1 x4,  						Morale +2 x3,  						Energy Control +1 x7,  						Resistance +1 x3 				Level 2:  						Stamina +1 x4,  						Ranged Defense +1 x5,  						Divine Warp 				Level 3:  						Defense +1 x5,  						Spell Duration +1 x3 				Level 4:  						Ammo +1 x4,  						Exorcism 				Level 5:  						Magic Strike 				Level 6:  						Spellpower +1 x3 				Level 7:  						Smite Evil +2 				Level 8:  						Divine Seal 				Level 9:  						Hit Points +2 x6 				Level 10:  						Stamina +2 x4 				Level 11:  						Divine Vengeance 				Level 13:  						Resistance +2 				Level 14:  						Hunter of Demons +2 				Level 15:  						Divine Light 				Level 16:  						Health +1 x2,  						Morale +3,  						Willpower +1 x2 				Level 19:  						Ammo +2,  						Hunter of Undead +2 				Level 20:  						Willpower +2
Description: When the time is right, the Eagle-God chooses one mortal, bearing a righteous, unquenchable flame within his devoted heart, to step forth as the Father of a particular monastery. A selected abbot will personally accompany this mortal to the Chapter of the Order, where the Grand Inquisition Tribunal gladly receives him, knowing that he will soon serve as the bosom of the clergy. Once the mortal awakens the true strength of his faith, the Lord of Light instructs his servants to forge weapons made from purified ingots in order for the Grand Inquisitor to eradicate heresy. The extensive training a Grand Inquisitor must endure is relentless and daunting, yet inspiring to the morale of those who follow him. If the founding fathers of the Inquisition are known as the Shield of the Church, the Grand Inquisitor is, without a doubt, its Sword.

Name: Guardian of Souls
Abilities: Level 0:  						Smite Evil +2,  						Hunter of Undead +2,  						First Strike,  						Armorpiercing Strike,  						Damage Weapon (3),  						First Aid +3,  						Parry (4),  						Recuperation +3,  						Heavy Armor 1 				Level 1:  						Hit Points +2 x4,  						Defense +1 x3,  						Morale +2 x4 				Level 2:  						Stamina +2 x4,  						Counterattack +1 x5,  						Ranged Defense +1 x2,  						Parry +2 x4 				Level 3:  						Attack +1 x3,  						Resistance +1 x3 				Level 4:  						Recuperation +1 x3 				Level 5:  						Health +1 x3,  						Armor +1 x3,  						Hunter of Undead +1 x2 				Level 6:  						Change Weapon 				Level 9:  						Strength +1 x4 				Level 11:  						Attack +2 x2,  						Ranged Defense +2 x2,  						Forced March 				Level 12:  						Stamina +3 x3,  						Willpower +1 x2,  						Resistance to Fear 				Level 13:  						Hit Points +3 x3,  						Defense +2 x2,  						Morale +3 x4 				Level 14:  						Health +2 x3,  						Counterattack +2 x3 				Level 15:  						Willpower +2 				Level 16:  						Attack +3 x2,  						Armor +2 x2
Description: Sometimes a really good swordmaster, the most talented or lucky one, is invited to change specialization and join the ranks of "guardians of souls", elite warriors whose sole purpose it is to destroy the undead. They get special equipment and special training allowing them to successfully fight not only against living, but also against dead enemies. A Guardian of Souls can often be found in the ranks of inquisitors who oppose necromancers: they are able to successfully deter zombies, mummies and ghouls, not letting them get to the shooters and healers, and their weapons can strike even ghosts.

Name: Zealot
Abilities: Level 0:  					Hunter of Undead +2 or  					Hunter of Demons +2 				Level 0:  						First Strike,  						Smite Evil +3,  						Hunter of Undead +1,  						Hunter of Demons +1,  						Armor of Faith +25,  						Resistance to Fear 				Level 1:  						Hit Points +2 x7,  						Attack +1 x3,  						Defense +1 x3,  						Morale +3 x6 				Level 2:  						Stamina +2 x4,  						Counterattack +1 x3,  						Ranged Defense +1 x2,  						Hunter of Undead +1 x3 				Level 3:  						Resistance +1 x2,  						Hunter of Demons +1 x3 				Level 4:  						Smite Evil +1 				Level 5:  						Health +1 x3,  						Armor +1 x3 				Level 6:  						Forced March 				Level 7:  						Attack +2 x3 				Level 8:  						Counterattack +2 x5 				Level 9:  						Strength +1 x4,  						Resistance +2 				Level 10:  						Armorpiercing Strike 				Level 11:  						Ranged Defense +2 x2 				Level 12:  						Stamina +3 x3,  						Willpower +1 x2 				Level 13:  						Defense +2 x2 				Level 14:  						Health +2 x3,  						Vigilance 				Level 15:  						Willpower +2 				Level 16:  						Attack +3 x2,  						Armor +2 x2
Description: The greatest warriors of the clergy are selected and known as zealots by the inquisition. Zealots are armed with golden hilted swords that have been plunged in holy water, as well as holy relics blessed by the founding fathers. These men are disciplined to sweep away the enemies of the Church the way the wind sweeps away autumn leaves. Empowered and blessed by the Grand Inquisition Tribunal, these servants of light have defenses that are near-impossible to penetrate, conventional or magic. They are determined to purge the minions of Chaos, as well as those whose souls are black as coal.

Name: Necromancer
Abilities: Level 0:  						Necromancer ablities,  						Summoning Power +4 x4,  						Undead Summoning Power +2 x2,  						Fear,  						Raise Skeleton 				Level 1:  						Hit Points +1 x7,  						Ranged Attack +1 x6,  						Counterattack +1 x5,  						Morale +2 x3,  						Raise Zombie 				Level 2:  						Defense +1 x5,  						Resistance +1 x5,  						Stamina +1 x6 				Level 3:  						Ammo +1 x6,  						Attack +1 x5,  						Energy Control +1 x4,  						Undead Regeneration 				Level 4:  						Ranged Defense +1 x5,  						Undead Summoning Power +1 x3 				Level 5:  						Spell Duration +1 				Level 6:  						Range +1 				Level 7:  						Raise Ghoul 				Level 8:  						Intimidating Shot +1 x2 				Level 12:  						Thaumaturgy +1 				Level 13:  						Dissolve Armor 				Level 14:  						Stamina +2 x4 				Level 15:  						Hit Points +2 x3 				Level 16:  						Summon Hnara 				Level 17:  						Resistance +2 x2 				Level 19:  						Ranged Attack +2
Description: Practitioners of magic may dabble in the mysteries of a forbidden school: Necromancy. These dark mages are able to conjure obedient undead minions of various levels of decay, even dating back to those who fell many years ago.

Name: Springald
Abilities: Level 0:  						Mechanical,  						Siege (4),  						Collect Ammo,  						Springald 				Level 1:  						Heavy Ammo (3),  						Ranged Attack +1 x4 				Level 2:  						Hit Points +1 x3,  						Defense +1 x5 				Level 3:  						Ammo +1 x3,  						Siege +2 x4 				Level 5:  						Ranged Defense +2 x2 				Level 7:  						Resistance +1 x3 				Level 8:  						Hit Points +2 x7 				Level 9:  						Range +1 				Level 13:  						Ranged Attack +2 x3 				Level 16:  						Siege +4 x2 				Level 17:  						Resistance +2,  						Ranged Defense +3 				Level 18:  						Ammo +2
Description: At first glance it may seem that all war machines are created equal, but some are better than others - and often they are significantly improved. These siege engines can only be made by dwarves of the renowned Engineering Guild. Thanks to its sturdy base, durable chamber mechanism and the use of a dense and light kind of wood, a Springald is capable of mayhem at grievous rates, thanks to the serrated tips of its projectiles. As with most siege weaponry, it is best kept tucked away at the back of one's army.

Name: Smiting Hand
Abilities: Level 0:  					Hunter of Undead +2 or  					Hunter of Demons +2 				Level 0:  						Armorpiercing Strike,  						Recuperation +1 x3,  						First Strike,  						Forced March,  						Evasion Strategy,  						Vigilance 				Level 1:  						Hit Points +1 x3,  						Counterattack +1 x5,  						Ranged Defense +1 x5,  						Morale +2 x2 				Level 2:  						Attack +1 x5,  						Resistance +1 x4,  						Stamina +1 x2,  						Hunter of Undead +1 x3 				Level 3:  						Hunter of Demons +1 x3 				Level 4:  						Defense +1 x4 				Level 6:  						Stamina +2 x4 				Level 7:  						Hit Points +2 x4 				Level 11:  						Strength +1 x3,  						Armor +1 x3,  						Morale +3 x3 				Level 12:  						Health +1 x4,  						Counterattack +2 x3,  						Ranged Defense +2 x3 				Level 13:  						Attack +2 x3,  						Defense +2 x3 				Level 17:  						Hit Points +3 				Level 18:  						Resistance +2 				Level 19:  						Stamina +3,  						Willpower +1 				Level 20:  						Health +2,  						Strength +2,  						Armor +2,  						Resistance to Fear
Description: Some guardsmen who have served out their time and have accumulated enough gold to spend the remainder of their life in comfort, decide to retire and end their military career. Some serve as a mentor to young men aspiring to become mercenaries. And some - the particularly pious and devout - draw the attention of the Church and receive an offer to continue their military career in service to the Church. They are given the special ecclesiastical title of "Smiting Hand". Their high numbers allow them to maintain the Order as a vessel of the Inquisition. The excellent skills of the Smiting Hand allow them to successfully protect their patrons both from bandits and from various monsters summoned by evil sorcerers - and they have no shortage of combat experience. Additional power against evil spirits is provided by the special weapon they carry: a long-handled hammer. The way these weapons are used is very similar to the technique used with a halberd, which is why the Inquisition is particularly keen to attract former guardsmen, who are experts with this weapon.

Name: Trebuchet
Abilities: Level 0:  						Armor Piercing Shot,  						Collect Ammo,  						Siege (6),  						Mechanical,  						Bombardment 				Level 1:  						Hit Points +2 x7,  						Ranged Attack +1 x5,  						Resistance +1 x4 				Level 2:  						Ranged Defense +2 x5 				Level 3:  						Siege +2 x2 				Level 5:  						Ammo +1 x3 				Level 8:  						Defense +1 x2 				Level 9:  						Siege +4 x4 				Level 10:  						Range +1 				Level 11:  						Ranged Attack +2 x5 				Level 15:  						Hit Points +3 x3
Description: It is a known fact that the Dwarves invented most siege engines used across Eador. And although their creations - catapults and ballistae - have been copied for a long time, the Dwarves remain the best builders. So if someone needs to turn a catapult into a work of art - one must contract the Dwarves. This upgraded catapult has the capability to throw heavier rocks over longer distances while also being equipped with a reinforced frame to better withstand damage. A special feature of this machine is the ability to throw a bunch of metal balls which, due to their weight and attached spikes, can pierce the thickest armor and wreak undiscriminating havoc.

Name: High Mage
Abilities: Level 0:  						Energy Control (2),  						Magic Damage,  						Archmage ablities,  						Air Shield,  						Head Wind,  						Blast,  						Word of Power 				Level 1:  						Hit Points +1 x6,  						Ranged Attack +1 x5,  						Resistance +1 x4,  						Energy Control +1 x5 				Level 2:  						Stamina +1 x3,  						Ammo +1 x5,  						Morale +2 x3 				Level 3:  						Counterattack +1 x3 				Level 4:  						Ranged Defense +1 x3 				Level 6:  						Attack +1 x3,  						Fire Storm,  						Mass Slow 				Level 8:  						Defense +1 x2,  						Spellpower +1 				Level 9:  						Order 				Level 10:  						Stamina +2 x6,  						Spell Duration +1 				Level 11:  						Ranged Attack +2 x5 				Level 12:  						Mind Control Immunity 				Level 13:  						Hit Points +2 x4,  						Resistance +2 x2,  						Thaumaturgy +1 				Level 14:  						Willpower +1 x2 				Level 15:  						Range +1 				Level 20:  						Willpower +2
Description: Once a magician has studied enough to surpass his other arcane colleagues beyond a comprehensible level, this mage is respectfully called "high". The destructive power of a High Mage on the battlefield is almost unequaled. He is able to effortlessly and single-handedly wipe out a small army, as long as he is well-protected.

Name: Patriarch
Abilities: Level 0:  						Healing (10),  						Patriarch ablities,  						Dispel,  						Exorcism,  						Resurrection,  						Spellpower +1 x2 				Level 1:  						Hit Points +1 x4,  						Healing +1 x6,  						Resistance +1 x3 				Level 2:  						Stamina +1 x4,  						Ranged Attack +1 x5,  						Ranged Defense +1 x5 				Level 3:  						Defense +1 x5,  						Thaumaturgy +1 				Level 4:  						Morale +2 x3,  						Ammo +1 				Level 8:  						Miracle 				Level 9:  						Hit Points +2 x6 				Level 10:  						Stamina +2 x4 				Level 12:  						Ammo +2 x2 				Level 13:  						Resistance +2 				Level 16:  						Health +1 x2,  						Morale +3,  						Willpower +1 x2 				Level 17:  						Ranged Attack +2 x2 				Level 20:  						Willpower +2
Description: Healers talented enough to surpass others can be elevated in standing and become patriarchs. Other healers, priests and monks turn to these Patriarchs for help, advice and a kind word. A patriarch's higher wisdom allows him to use a vast array of prayers and rites. In combat, a patriarch is able to revive fallen allies - an ability much appreciated by his companions.

Name: Wyvern
Abilities: Level 0:  						Flying,  						Poison Attack (2),  						Poison Attack (4),  						Necrophagy +10 				Level 1:  						Hit Points +2 x4,  						Attack +1 x4,  						Defense +1 x6,  						Morale +2 x5 				Level 2:  						Stamina +2 x4,  						Counterattack +1 x5,  						Resistance +1 x3,  						Necrophagy +5 x3 				Level 3:  						Ranged Defense +1 x6,  						Poison +1 x5 				Level 5:  						Health +1 x3,  						Poison Flesh +1 x2 				Level 6:  						Crippling Strike (2) 				Level 9:  						Strength +1 x4 				Level 10:  						Stunning Blow +1 x2 				Level 11:  						Attack +2 x2 				Level 12:  						Stamina +3 x3,  						Willpower +1 x2,  						Speed +1 				Level 13:  						Hit Points +3 x3 				Level 14:  						Health +2 x3,  						Counterattack +2 x3 				Level 16:  						Attack +3 x2 				Level 18:  						Resistance +2 				Level 19:  						Ranged Defense +2 				Level 20:  						Armor +2
Description: This thoroughly poisonous, huge winged swamp lizard - a distant relative of dragons - is a dangerous creature, primarily due to its poison. Although the Wyvern is lazy and loves to lie in warm swamp water, it, like a dragon, has a keen hearing and an excellent sense of smell, thanks to which it is able to smell its prey from afar, when the latter is not even aware of its presence. Wyverns can smell fresh blood from far away, and it drives them crazy. When enraged, the Wyvern attacks any creature nearby. Goblins often use this... The main shortcoming of Wyverns is their slowness. Though, some say it’s a flaw, others say it’s a chance to stay alive. For the egg to be turned into a unit for a hero's party it is necessary to build the Trappers Guild.

Name: Swamp Dragonfly
Abilities: Level 0:  						Floating,  						Poison Attack +1 				Level 1:  						Hit Points +2 x4,  						Attack +1 x4,  						Defense +1 x6,  						Morale +2 x4 				Level 2:  						Stamina +2 x4,  						Counterattack +1 x5,  						Resistance +1 x4,  						Agility 				Level 3:  						Ranged Defense +1 x6,  						Hex 				Level 4:  						Mobility 				Level 5:  						Health +1 x3,  						Poison +1 x3 				Level 6:  						Speed +1 x2 				Level 9:  						Strength +1 x4,  						Necrophagy +5 x2 				Level 10:  						Mass Attack (2) 				Level 11:  						Attack +2 x2 				Level 12:  						Stamina +3 x3,  						Willpower +1 x2 				Level 13:  						Hit Points +3 x3 				Level 14:  						Health +2 x3,  						Counterattack +2 x3 				Level 16:  						Attack +3 x2 				Level 19:  						Ranged Defense +2 				Level 20:  						Armor +2
Description: Goblins are very well acquainted with the capabilities of these venomous, hovering creatures. It is for good reason that goblins refer to them as "snake-dragons". One bite from a swamp dragonfly can send a young man to an early grave. The strength and speed of the venom's effect is dependent on the swamp dragonfly's age. To tame and breed these creatures is a dangerous and difficult task, especially since one must get hold of the eggs. Not to mention the fact that these creatures are quite rare. For the egg to be turned into a unit for a hero's party it is necessary to build the Pathfinders Guild.

Name: Bodyguard
Abilities: Level 0:  						Stunning Blow +1,  						Crushing Blow 				Level 1:  						Hit Points +1,  						Attack +1 x5,  						Counterattack +1 x4,  						Defense +1 x5 				Level 2:  						Stamina +1,  						Hit Points +2 x6 				Level 4:  						Stamina +2 x4,  						Ranged Defense +1 x4 				Level 6:  						Health +1 x5 				Level 8:  						Resistance +1 x2 				Level 11:  						Morale +2 x2 				Level 13:  						Strength +1 x3 				Level 15:  						Attack +2 x2 				Level 16:  						Stamina +3 				Level 17:  						Hit Points +3 x2 				Level 20:  						Health +2,  						Attack +3,  						Armor +1
Description: Eventually, the most skillful thugs - or perhaps just those lucky enough to stay alive - are noticed by their leader. These men are singled out, given better gear, and assigned more complex tasks. Some are promoted to personal bodyguards. While these brutes are no smarter than the wretched thugs they started out as, they understand that "the boss" must be protected - because whoever comes to take his place might confiscate their new "toys" - strong armor and high-quality warhammers.

Name: Air Elemental
Similar units: Water Elemental, Earth Elemental, Fire Elemental
Abilities: Level 0:  						Floating,  						Elemental,  						Steal Ammo,  						Air Elemental,  						Incorporeality 				Level 1:  						Hit Points +1 x7,  						Attack +1 x10,  						Counterattack +1 x5 				Level 2:  						Stamina +1 x6,  						Resistance +1 x5,  						Defense +1 x5 				Level 3:  						Ammo +1 x6 				Level 4:  						Ranged Defense +1 x5 				Level 6:  						Spellpower +1 x3 				Level 7:  						Speed +1 x2 				Level 10:  						Thaumaturgy +1 x2 				Level 14:  						Stamina +2 x4 				Level 15:  						Hit Points +2 x3 				Level 16:  						Attack +2 x2 				Level 17:  						Resistance +2 x2
Description: Elemental spirits live on their own Planes, and usually do not leave them voluntarily. Some powerful spellcasters are able to summon them to the Material Plane for a short time. The spirits materialize in a "body" composed of their element - this is the only way they can withstand hostile environment. An air elemental is able to use the power of the air to blast enemies with lightning and prevent them from firing their missiles.  Ammunition is simply blown out of their hands by of a powerful flow of air. One option to combat elementals is to banish them back to their plane - a difficult task, but not impossible. Weapons often struggle to pierce the air elemental, and strong magic is required to afflict its ephemeral presence.

Name: Earth Elemental
Similar units: Water Elemental, Air Elemental, Fire Elemental
Abilities: Level 0:  						Elemental,  						Tireless,  						Feels No Pain,  						Earth Elemental 				Level 1:  						Hit Points +1 x3,  						Attack +1 x9,  						Counterattack +2 x4 				Level 2:  						Resistance +1 x5,  						Defense +1 x5,  						Petrification Immunity 				Level 3:  						Ammo +1 x6 				Level 4:  						Ranged Defense +1 x5,  						Spell Duration +1 x3 				Level 6:  						Stunning Blow +1 x2 				Level 7:  						Hit Points +2 x4,  						Crushing Blow 				Level 8:  						Spellpower +1 x3 				Level 12:  						Web Immunity 				Level 13:  						Attack +2 x2 				Level 15:  						Hit Points +3 x3,  						Speed +1 				Level 17:  						Resistance +2 x2,  						Counterattack +3 x2 				Level 19:  						Attack +3
Description: Elemental spirits live on their own Planes, and usually do not leave them voluntarily. Some powerful spellcasters are able to summon them to the Material Plane for a short time. The spirits materialize in a "body" composed of their element - this is the only way they can withstand hostile environment. The earth elemental is a strong, nearly indestructible monstrosity. Because of its high density, the elemental's movement is slow. Its form is so heavy that each step it takes makes the earth tremble with such force that nearby foes are brought to their knees. Engagement from a distance is heavily advised to battle the earth elemental. One option to combat elementals is to banish them back to their plane - a difficult task, but not impossible. Weapons often struggle to pierce the earth elemental, and strong magic is required to afflict its presence.

Name: Fire Elemental
Similar units: Water Elemental, Air Elemental, Earth Elemental
Abilities: Level 0:  						Elemental,  						Fire Elemental,  						Fire Immunity,  						Magic Strike,  						Incorporeality 				Level 1:  						Hit Points +1 x7,  						Attack +1 x10,  						Counterattack +1 x5,  						Spellpower +1 x5 				Level 2:  						Stamina +1 x6,  						Resistance +1 x5,  						Defense +1 x5 				Level 3:  						Ammo +1 x6,  						Scorching +1 x3 				Level 4:  						Ranged Defense +1 x5 				Level 7:  						Thaumaturgy +1 x3 				Level 14:  						Stamina +2 x4 				Level 15:  						Hit Points +2 x3 				Level 16:  						Attack +2 x2 				Level 17:  						Resistance +2 x2
Description: Elemental spirits live on their own Planes, and usually do not leave them voluntarily. Some powerful spellcasters are able to summon them to the Material Plane for a short time. The spirits materialize in a "body" composed of their element - this is the only way they can withstand hostile environment. The fire elemental burns its enemies with destructive ferocity. Its sizzling grasp can extinguish even the most durable warrior. Safety is never assured when such a spirit looms over the battlefield, with its fiery gaze fixed on its potential victims. Not only can molten droplets litter the battlefield in the presence of the spirit, but upon its defeat, the elemental can summon the last of its concentration to detonate itself like a bomb. One option to combat elementals is to banish them back to their plane - a difficult task, but not impossible. Weapons often struggle to pierce the fire elemental, and strong magic is required to afflict its glowing presence.

Name: Runesmith
Ways to get: Rune Workshop (building), fortifications in the province of the race Dwarves
Abilities: Level 0:  						Hills Knowledge +2 x2,  						Rune Weapon,  						Fix (5) 				Level 1:  						Hit Points +1 x4,  						Stamina +1 x4,  						Resistance +1 x5,  						Counterattack +1 x6 				Level 2:  						Defense +1 x2,  						Attack +1 x6,  						Ammo +1 x3,  						Fix +1 x5 				Level 3:  						Ranged Defense +1 x2,  						Morale +2 x2,  						Petrification Immunity 				Level 4:  						Spellpower +1 x4 				Level 6:  						Rune Armor 				Level 8:  						Stamina +2 x3,  						Defense +2 x2 				Level 9:  						Hit Points +2 x3,  						Ranged Defense +2 x2,  						Forced March,  						Poison Immunity 				Level 10:  						Health +1 x2,  						Rune Amulet 				Level 13:  						Crushing Blow 				Level 14:  						Armor +1 x2 				Level 15:  						Hit Points +3 x3,  						Willpower +1 x2 				Level 16:  						Morale +3 				Level 18:  						Stamina +3 				Level 19:  						Strength +1,  						Summon Earth Elemental 				Level 20:  						Health +2,  						Willpower +2,  						Armor +2
Description: Dwarven Master Blacksmiths make the best tools, weapons and armor in Eador. Their work looks strange to the uninitiated: strange cries of the dwarves in their language, rough and untreated rock, the jingle of metal, accompanied by the seemingly erratic blows of sledgehammers. Their handiwork is often decorated with intricate patterns and unusual characters. But those are not just the creative expressions of an individual artist and they're not merely decorative patterns. The secret of their art, which is ancient and carefully transferred among dwarves from teacher to student, is the creation of magical runes, which changes the essence of the metal, making it lighter or heavier, harder or softer, stronger and sharper. The skills of these runesmiths is demonstrated during combat, when swords and armor covered in runes reveal their true power: to give iron armor the strength of diamond and a conventional blade the ability to cut stone.

Name: Seraphim
Abilities: Level 0:  						Flying,  						Magic Strike,  						True Resurrection,  						Smite Evil +2,  						Hunter of Undead +2,  						Hunter of Demons +2 				Level 1:  						Hit Points +2 x4,  						Attack +1 x3,  						Defense +1 x3,  						Morale +2 x5 				Level 2:  						Stamina +2 x4,  						Counterattack +1 x3,  						Ranged Defense +1 x2,  						Healing 				Level 3:  						Resistance +1 x2 				Level 4:  						Healing +1 x8 				Level 5:  						Health +1 x3,  						Armor +1 x3 				Level 6:  						First Strike 				Level 7:  						Attack +2 x3 				Level 8:  						Counterattack +2 x5 				Level 9:  						Strength +1 x4,  						Resistance +2 				Level 11:  						Ranged Defense +2 x2,  						Morale +3 x5 				Level 12:  						Stamina +3 x3,  						Willpower +1 x2 				Level 13:  						Hit Points +3 x3,  						Defense +2 x2 				Level 14:  						Health +2 x3 				Level 15:  						Willpower +2 				Level 16:  						Attack +3 x2,  						Armor +2 x2
Description: Seraphim are transcended beings of light who coexist in the material realm. This metaphysical process of coexistence has led to the emergence of controversial theories among lorekeepers. Some have made broad claims that these beings are actual projections of the Lord of Light. Others claim these are His messengers. It is clear, at least, that the seraphim are connected to God-like powers beyond mortal comprehension. The presence of seraphim on a battlefield doesn't bode well for the followers of Chaos and Undeath. The seraphim's unprecedented and unforgiving hunt for ghastly abominations makes it the ultimate champion of light. For the holy relic to be turned into a unit for a hero's party it is necessary to build the Tower of Restoration.

Name: Duelist
Abilities: Level 0:  						Agility,  						Parry (4) 				Level 1:  						Hit Points +1 x4,  						Attack +1 x7,  						Ranged Defense +1 x6 				Level 2:  						Stamina +1 x3,  						Counterattack +1 x3,  						Resistance +1 x5 				Level 3:  						Precise Strike +1 x5 				Level 4:  						Defense +1 x5,  						Parry +2 x3 				Level 7:  						Morale +2 x2 				Level 8:  						Stamina +2 x5 				Level 9:  						Hit Points +2 x4 				Level 11:  						Health +1 x4 				Level 13:  						Vigilance 				Level 14:  						Strength +1 x2 				Level 15:  						Attack +2 x3
Description: Duelists tend to move about as wandering adventurers, usually of highborn descent. They are restless opportunists, always prepared to meet any challenge in defense of their family name. As they often come from noble backgrounds, they are well-educated and versed in martial combat, yet their refusal to commit to any military organization has led them to become wandering duelists... free of being commanded unless they choose to lend their sword... for a price of course. The finest of duelists confine themselves to melee. They are nimble and agile, which keeps them out of retaliatory strikes from their foe. Their quickness also allows them to avoid lethal blows. For the contract to be turned into a unit for a hero's party it is necessary to build the Merchant Court.

Name: Living Armor
Abilities: Level 0:  						Intrepid,  						Poison Immunity,  						Tireless,  						Spell Immunity,  						Feels No Pain 				Level 1:  						Hit Points +3 x4,  						Attack +1 x4,  						Ranged Defense +1 x5 				Level 2:  						Counterattack +1 x5,  						Defense +1 x5 				Level 4:  						Armor +1 x5 				Level 5:  						Hit Points +4 x8 				Level 6:  						Resistance +1 x3,  						Crushing Blow 				Level 9:  						Strength +1 x4 				Level 11:  						Attack +2 x2 				Level 14:  						Counterattack +2 x3 				Level 16:  						Attack +3 x2 				Level 17:  						Ranged Defense +2 x2 				Level 18:  						Armor +2 x2 				Level 20:  						Defense +2
Description: A seemingly metaphysical construct, living armor appears to be the result of unmaintained magical threads - the potential result of a careless magician's spell-flinging leaving tears in the material realm. Because living armor holds no mortal flaws, its strength and durability reflects the metal that comprises its structure, allowing itself to ignore magic, as well as most other crippling blows.

Name: Acheron
Abilities: Level 0:  						Magic Shot,  						Armorpiercing Strike,  						Intimidation (3),  						Fire Immunity,  						Archdemon,  						Bloodlust +1 x3 				Level 1:  						Hit Points +3 x4,  						Attack +1 x4,  						Ranged Defense +1 x5,  						Stamina +2 x5,  						Chaos Surge 				Level 2:  						Counterattack +1 x5,  						Defense +1 x5,  						Ranged Attack +2 x4 				Level 3:  						Resistance +1 x3,  						Dark Dominion 1 x3 				Level 4:  						Soul Stealing +3 x3 				Level 5:  						Health +1 x3 				Level 6:  						Ammo +2 x2,  						Intimidation +2 x2 				Level 7:  						Summon Demon 				Level 9:  						Strength +1 x4,  						Morale +2 x2 				Level 10:  						Summon Lord of Abyss 				Level 11:  						Attack +2 x2 				Level 12:  						Stamina +3 x3,  						Resistance +2 x3,  						Anthem Of The Damned 				Level 13:  						Hit Points +4 x3 				Level 14:  						Health +2 x3,  						Counterattack +2 x3 				Level 16:  						Attack +3 x2,  						Armor +1,  						Armageddon 				Level 17:  						Ranged Defense +2 x2 				Level 20:  						Defense +2
Description: A true force to be reckoned with, the acheron stand high above the lesser demons as fierce Archlords of darkness, forged by concentrated negative energy. To their great regret - and to the great delight of all living beings -  Acheron cannot pass through the gates of Chaos like other demons. Should their near-unpronounceable name be uttered, along with the possession of ancient relics bearing their mark, they can be summoned into the material realm. The presence of an acheron on the battlefield spells doom for most mortals who are unfortunate enough to stand before this tool of Chaos. Most mortal weapons cannot withstand this creature's near-invincible flesh, only to have the favor returned with what can only be described as a sword forged by Hell itself. The acheron strikes with such violence that the material realm tears and weeps with black trails. Acheron are also able to temporarily summon their pets, the Cerberi, directly from the Underworld. For the cursed relic to be turned into a unit for a hero's party it is necessary to build the Tower of Chaos.

Name: Elemental Mistress
Abilities: Level 0:  						Magic Damage,  						Meditation +1,  						Elementalist Tome,  						Energy Control (2),  						Summoning Power +4 x5 				Level 1:  						Hit Points +1 x6,  						Ranged Attack +1 x5,  						Resistance +1 x4,  						Energy Control +1 x5 				Level 2:  						Stamina +1 x4,  						Ammo +1 x5,  						Morale +2 x3 				Level 3:  						Counterattack +1 x3 				Level 4:  						Ranged Defense +1 x3 				Level 6:  						Attack +1 x3 				Level 8:  						Defense +1 x2 				Level 10:  						Stamina +2 x6,  						Range +1 				Level 11:  						Ranged Attack +2 x5 				Level 13:  						Hit Points +2 x4,  						Resistance +2 x2 				Level 14:  						Willpower +1 x2 				Level 20:  						Willpower +2
Description: Wizards studying anomalies in magic are not uncommon. Fireballs, falling rocks, lightning - the majority of these spells are not that complicated for mages. Only a few practitioners of magic have the capacity to elevate their studies to the higher elements. And from those few, only a select amount of gifted mages manage to grasp the heights, previously noted as unreachable in terms of manipulating the primordial elements. These gifted few are exclusively women, as the intense magical integration flowing within their bodies can only be contained within their delicate structure - fitting, considering the delicacy of this specialized form of arcane arts. Such an integration works both ways, as the woman contains the magic, the magic fuels the woman. Elemental mistresses, as they are known, are able to conjure a crowd of elemental spirits - creatures from other planes of existence. These elementals may coexist in this world for a brief period - a time most suitable for sending a bunch of arrogant men to their early graves. For the contract to be turned into a unit for a hero's party it is necessary to build the Sphere of Ice.

Name: Faerie Dragon
