Abilities: Level 0:  						Magic Shot,  						Hex +2 x3,  						Summon Imp [Vulnerability Spell] 				Level 1:  						Hit Points +1 x7,  						Ranged Attack +1 x5,  						Counterattack +1 x5,  						Morale +2 x3 				Level 2:  						Stamina +1 x6,  						Resistance +1 x5,  						Defense +1 x5,  						Fear 				Level 3:  						Ammo +1 x6,  						Attack +1 x5,  						Summon Hnara 				Level 4:  						Ranged Defense +1 x5 				Level 6:  						Magic Strike 				Level 7:  						Raise Skeleton 				Level 8:  						Energy Control +1 x3 				Level 9:  						Undead Summoning Power +1 x3 				Level 11:  						Spell Duration +1 				Level 14:  						Stamina +2 x4 				Level 15:  						Hit Points +2 x3 				Level 16:  						Ranged Attack +2 x2,  						Thaumaturgy +1 				Level 17:  						Resistance +2 x2 				Level 19:  						Undead Summoning Power +2
Description: Those who've devoted their lives to magic and sorcery are often forced to join the army to make a living. Battle sorcerers are highly valued by their commanders, although ordinary warriors dislike them for the dark deeds most of them usually engage in. Sorcerers are able to strike their enemies with magic and weaken them, but they are rather weak in melee. More experienced sorcerers often learn other kinds of spells, preferring the school of Necromancy.

Name: Icarus
Ways to get: Alkari Quarter (building), Summon Icarus (ritual), fortifications in the province of the race Alkaryl
Abilities: Level 0:  						Alkaryl 				Level 1:  						Hit Points +1 x5,  						Attack +1 x10,  						Ranged Defense +1 x5 				Level 2:  						Counterattack +1 x3,  						Resistance +1 x3,  						Stamina +1 x10 				Level 3:  						Defense +1 x2,  						Morale +2 x5 				Level 4:  						Smite Evil +1 x2 				Level 8:  						Charge,  						Speed +1 x2 				Level 14:  						Willpower +1 x2 				Level 16:  						Hit Points +2 x2
Description: The warrior caste of the Icari is dedicated to the obliteration of Chaos in all its forms. Every one of them is willing to do anything to secure victory. The mind of an Icarus is clear and his will is strong. The mental link with their brothers in arms allows them to renounce any thought not directly related to warfare, for the battlefield is no place for personal impulses and desires. Common warriors live fast and short lives, but some of the Icari are not willing to rest in the afterlife of the Trees, but instead look for an opportunity to arise and return to the world of the living to fight the Enemy once more.

Name: Luminary
Ways to get: White Tower (building), fortifications in the province of the race Alkaryl
Abilities: Level 0:  						Alkaryl,  						Smite Evil +1 x4,  						Summon Icarus 				Level 1:  						Hit Points +1 x4,  						Attack +1 x10,  						Ranged Defense +1 x4 				Level 2:  						Counterattack +1,  						Resistance +1 x3,  						Stamina +1 x10 				Level 3:  						Defense +1 x3,  						Morale +2 x3 				Level 6:  						Summoning Power +4 x2 				Level 8:  						Charge 				Level 9:  						Ammo +2 x2,  						Strength +1 x2 				Level 10:  						Speed +1 				Level 13:  						Hit Points +2 x3 				Level 14:  						Willpower +1 x3 				Level 15:  						Armor +1 x2 				Level 19:  						Morale +3 				Level 20:  						Ranged Defense +2
Description: Luminaries are those Alkari, whose mental connection to the Trees of the Departed is particularly strong. Only those illustrious warriors are capable of leading winged troops into battle, using their mental powers to coordinate lightning-fast attacks. They are not called Luminaries, the guiding lights, for nothing: in the heat of battle, being virtually on the brink between life and death, they can call on their ancestors for aid. For a brief moment an ancient oath breaks the shackles of death, and an Icarus arises under the banner of his commander to rejoin the battle against the forces of Chaos. Although they are not as powerful as truly Arisen, and do not linger for long in the world of the living, these Icari can join the battle anywhere at any time, rushing to the guiding light of a Luminary's mind.

Name: Stalker
Ways to get: White Tower (building), fortifications in the province of the race Alkaryl
Abilities: Level 0:  						Alkaryl,  						Hunter's Net,  						Enchanted Arrows 6 				Level 1:  						Hit Points +1 x5,  						Stamina +1 x9,  						Morale +2 x5 				Level 2:  						Ranged Defense +1 x5,  						Ammo +1 x3,  						Stalker Shot +1 x5 				Level 3:  						Attack +1 x5,  						Smite Evil +1 x2 				Level 4:  						Resistance +1 x4 				Level 8:  						Defense +1 x2,  						Thaumaturgy +1 x2 				Level 9:  						Speed +1 x2 				Level 16:  						Hit Points +2 x2 				Level 19:  						Willpower +1 				Level 20:  						Strength +1
Description: Every manifestation of the Enemy should be obliterated, but any wicked man suspected of collaborating with the Enemy must be taken alive. Stalkers are trained especially for both of these tasks. These fighters armed with shining spears are capable of striking the enemy down before they approach, and for targets of special interest Stalkers have their nets, capable of catching even the most sneaky enemy.

Name: Witness
Ways to get: Celestial Eye (building), fortifications in the province of the race Alkaryl
Abilities: Level 0:  						Alkaryl,  						Smite Evil +1 x3,  						Meditation +1 x2,  						Test of Faith,  						Mental Support 				Level 1:  						Hit Points +1 x8,  						Attack +1 x7,  						Stamina +1 x8,  						Willpower +1 x5 				Level 2:  						Ranged Defense +1 x5,  						Ammo +1 x6 				Level 3:  						Morale +2 x3 				Level 5:  						First Aid +1 x4 				Level 6:  						Spell Duration +1 x2 				Level 7:  						Recuperation +1 x2 				Level 8:  						Defense +1 x2 				Level 9:  						Speed +1 x2 				Level 10:  						Mental Duel 				Level 11:  						Strength +1 x2 				Level 13:  						Mind Control Immunity 				Level 17:  						Morale +3 				Level 18:  						Stamina +2 x2
Description: The eyes and ears of the Children of Heaven, it is their duty to represent the Mentors and the Lord of Heaven wherever a shadow of Alkari wings falls. They channel their mental power to reach out and transmit their thoughts over great distances, for even the outermost scouts must never lose contact with the Mentors and the Departed. In combat, Witnesses, proficient in the joining of minds, can support their allies by strengthening their spirit and healing their body or disrupt the concentration of enemy spellcasters.

Name: Trapped Soul
Abilities: Level 0:  						Flying,  						Lesser Undead,  						Trapped Soul,  						Incorporeality 				Level 1:  						Defense +1 x14,  						Resistance +1 x13,  						Spellpower +1 x4 				Level 2:  						Ranged Defense +2 x13 				Level 5:  						Enhanced Trapped Soul x2 				Level 6:  						Strike of Pain 				Level 10:  						Necrosurge
Description: Mortal warriors die on the battlefield all the time, but only recently had necromancers learned to use the terrible suffering experienced by the soul parting with the body. Through a special ritual they can delay the departing soul for a brief moment. Although the spell is too weak to completely stop the transition and thus create a ghost, the spirit finds its uses, be it weakening the enemy or recovering the necromancer's own energy.

Name: Lycan
Abilities: Level 0:  						Intimidation +1 x3,  						Forest Knowledge +1 x3,  						First Aid +5,  						Regeneration (2) 				Level 1:  						Hit Points +1 x3,  						Attack +1 x4,  						Ranged Defense +1 x4,  						First Strike 				Level 2:  						Counterattack +1 x5,  						Defense +1 x5,  						Stamina +1 x2 				Level 3:  						Resistance +1 x4,  						Morale +2 x2 				Level 4:  						Recuperation +2 x3 				Level 5:  						Battle Frenzy (5) 				Level 6:  						Agility,  						Regeneration +1 x3 				Level 8:  						Entanglement Immunity 				Level 9:  						Attack +2 x4,  						Speed +1,  						Health +1 x2 				Level 10:  						Hit Points +2 x3,  						Web Immunity 				Level 11:  						Strength +1 x2 				Level 12:  						Stamina +2 x3 				Level 13:  						Ranged Defense +2 x3 				Level 14:  						Vigilance 				Level 17:  						Attack +3 x2,  						Defense +2 x2,  						Armor +1 x2 				Level 18:  						Health +2 				Level 19:  						Hit Points +3,  						Strength +2 				Level 20:  						Morale +3
Description: Half man, half wolf - this is a rare creature indeed. The mortal races of Eador have made up the most bizarre and unbelievable tales about the origin of these creatures. And although most of them are no more than fancy fairy tales, the humans' fantasies surpassed all. It has been called by many names, which have taken root even among the other races - turnskin, werewolf, lycanthrope, the names alone speak volumes, despite the fact that Lycans can't turn into anything and always remain in their chimeric form of wolf-man. They are aggressive beasts and attack almost everyone they consider weaker than themselves. Moreover, they are quite smart and able to adhere to certain tactics, such as prioritizing the squishy wizards, especially when hunting in a pack. Killing a Lycan is no easy feat - they are amazingly quick and slender, and can dodge swords and arrows, literally flowing through the air - such is its speed. Minor scratches and cuts heal immediately, and Lycans can lick off more serious wounds in a few minutes. For the contract to be turned into a unit for a hero's party it is necessary to build the Handler's Guild.

Name: Mephit
Abilities: Level 0:  						Floating,  						Elemental,  						Steal Ammo,  						Air Immunity,  						Incorporeality 				Level 1:  						Hit Points +1 x10,  						Attack +1 x10,  						Counterattack +1 x5,  						Speed +1 x3 				Level 2:  						Stamina +1 x6,  						Resistance +1 x5,  						Steal Ammo +2 x4 				Level 3:  						Defense +1 x5 				Level 4:  						Ranged Defense +1 x5 				Level 10:  						Hit and Run 				Level 14:  						Stamina +2 x4 				Level 16:  						Attack +2 x2 				Level 17:  						Resistance +2 x2 				Level 18:  						Mass Grounding
Description: Elemental spirits live on their own Planes, and usually do not leave them voluntarily. Some powerful spellcasters are able to summon them to the Material Plane for a short time. The spirits materialize in a "body" composed of their element - this is the only way they can withstand hostile environment. Mephits are lesser spirits of the Elemental Plane of Air. Mephits are rather weak creatures, usually summoned by a Sorcerer's Apprentice, learning the wisdom and subtleties of summoning - if the student gets it wrong, there is no need to fear for their lives. The worst mephits could do is leave a room in a horrible mess by stirring up strong gusts of wind.

Name: Renegade
Abilities: Level 0:  						Marauder 10,  						Forest Knowledge +2 				Level 1:  						Hit Points +1 x7,  						Morale +2 x4,  						Forager x3,  						Ammo +1 x4,  						Stamina +1 x8 				Level 2:  						Counterattack +1 x3,  						Precise Shot +1 x3 				Level 3:  						Ranged Attack +1 x4 				Level 4:  						Attack +1 x3,  						Forest Knowledge +1 x2 				Level 5:  						Ranged Defense +1 x3,  						Double Shot 				Level 6:  						Defense +1 x2 				Level 8:  						Resistance +1 x3 				Level 9:  						Range +1 x2 				Level 14:  						Marauder -5 				Level 15:  						Hit Points +2 x2 				Level 16:  						Stamina +2 x3 				Level 17:  						Ammo +2 				Level 19:  						Hit Points +3,  						Ranged Attack +2
Description: Certain "gentleman" outlaws prefer shooting over melee combat. Deftly hiding in trees, under bushes and behind thick trunks, they wait until their quarry has come within reach of their long distance shot, and then suddenly they will let loose. A melee attack by their comrades is typically preceded by a volley that can do a lot of damage. The primary objective of shooters is killing enemy spellcasters, their secondary is eliminating other shooters, from whom they are completely safe, hiding as they are among the trees. To take out a "deadeye", as they call themselves, is extremely difficult. As with other characters of dubious persuasion, a renegade will never deny himself the pleasure of pocketing some of the trophies, but only if they're absolutely sure they can get away with it.

Name: Black Unicorn
Abilities: Level 0:  						Magic Strike,  						Forest Knowledge +4,  						Battle Frenzy (5) 				Level 1:  						Hit Points +2 x4,  						Attack +1 x4,  						Defense +1 x6,  						Morale +2 x5 				Level 2:  						Stamina +2 x4,  						Counterattack +1 x5,  						Resistance +1 x3,  						Battle Frenzy +1 x4 				Level 3:  						Ranged Defense +1 x6,  						Dark Dominion 2 				Level 5:  						Health +1 x3 				Level 6:  						Smite Evil +2 				Level 8:  						Overwhelming Force 				Level 9:  						Strength +1 x4,  						Resistance +2 x4 				Level 10:  						Stunning Blow +1 				Level 11:  						Attack +2 x2 				Level 12:  						Stamina +3 x3,  						Willpower +1 x2,  						Speed +1 				Level 13:  						Hit Points +3 x3 				Level 14:  						Health +2 x3,  						Counterattack +2 x3 				Level 15:  						Morale +3 x3 				Level 16:  						Attack +3 x2 				Level 19:  						Ranged Defense +2 				Level 20:  						Armor +2
Description: The black unicorn is a great example of how dark magic and relentless hate are able to corrupt the very essence, defiling even a creature as majestic as a unicorn. The result is a monster, terrifying, aggressive and dangerous, making short work of the mortal creatures reckless enough to wander into its territory. Like its "ancestor", the black unicorn can pierce any armor with its horn, while the remains of the black witchcraft forever scarring the mutilated soul of the noble creature, fills it with incredible ferocity at the slightest injury. For the contract to be turned into a unit for a hero's party it is necessary to build Stonehenge.

Name: Ratman
Similar units: Plague Warrior, Shadow Claw, Plague Shooter, Plague Master, Grey Overlord
Ways to get: Ratman Lair (building), Ratman Burrow (site), fortifications in the province of the race Ratmen
Abilities: Level 0:  						Ratman,  						Tolerance 				Level 1:  						Hit Points +1 x8,  						Stamina +1 x6,  						Attack +1 x7 				Level 2:  						Defense +1 x5 				Level 3:  						Counterattack +1 x3,  						Hunger +5 				Level 4:  						Resistance +1 x3 				Level 5:  						Ranged Defense +1 x3 				Level 6:  						Forest Knowledge +1,  						Summon Rat 				Level 8:  						Severe Hunger 				Level 9:  						Morale +2 				Level 13:  						Ammo +2 x2 				Level 14:  						Cause Fever 				Level 15:  						First Strike 				Level 17:  						Hit Points +2 x2 				Level 20:  						Health +1
Description: As they rely on numbers, rather than skill, ordinary Skreet soldiers are neither very adept nor very resilient. However, they should not be underestimated: First of all, only the largest and strongest Ratmen become warriors, and everyone in Eador marvels at their unsurpassed ability for quick and furtive movement on any terrain. Skreet armies easily outmaneuver and surround unexpecting enemies, before letting their giant rats loose. Surprisingly, it is not in combat that Ratman warriors display their main advantage. It is well known that, in war, supplies are paramount, and none are more self-sufficient than Ratmen, except the Undead. Mobile, staid, and immune to disease, Ratmen are the bane of Human and Dwarven armies, and they feast on fallen enemies right on the battlefield.

Name: Giant Rat
Abilities: Level 0:  						Ratman,  						Pathfinder +1,  						Poison Attack +1 				Level 1:  						Hit Points +1 x3,  						Stamina +1 x2,  						Attack +1 x2,  						Counterattack +1 x7 				Level 2:  						Resistance +1 x2,  						Severe Hunger x2 				Level 3:  						Hit Points +2 x7,  						Poison +1 x3 				Level 4:  						Ranged Defense +1 x2 				Level 5:  						Health +1 x3,  						Defense +1 x2,  						Hunger +5 				Level 6:  						Hills Knowledge +2 				Level 7:  						Morale +2 x2 				Level 8:  						Intimidation +1 				Level 9:  						Attack +2 x3,  						Speed +1 				Level 16:  						Crippling Strike (2) 				Level 20:  						Hit Points +3,  						Resistance +2
Description: Grown to the size of large dogs under the influence of Death Crystals, Giant Rats are very different from regular rats, and not just in size. Above the ever-sniffing snout of these brazen and audacious creatures, two eyes peer into you with an intelligence no regular animal possesses. Their most noticeable feature are their teeth - the sharp incisors and canines of a predator, as these rats are even more voracious than their smaller cousins. There is no food they refuse, and they often eat such filth that the bite of a giant rat is almost guaranteed to cause blood poisoning. Ratmen breed giant rats for many purposes - as beasts of burden, as guard dogs, as pets, and occasionally for food. And of course, they are also used in battle. Faced with an endless horde of rats pouring from underground burrows, all hope is lost, for they leave nothing, not even bones, in their wake.

Name: Plague Warrior
Similar units: Shadow Claw, Plague Master, Grey Overlord
Ways to get: Ratman Barracks (building), Plague Temple (site), fortifications in the province of the race Ratmen
Abilities: Level 0:  						Ratman,  						Swamp Knowledge +2,  						Plague Warrior,  						Recover Ammo +1 x3 				Level 1:  						Hit Points +1 x8,  						Attack +1 x6,  						Morale +2 x3 				Level 2:  						Counterattack +1 x6,  						Stamina +1 x4,  						Poison +1 x3 				Level 3:  						Ranged Defense +1 x2,  						Ammo +1 x4 				Level 4:  						Resistance +1 x4,  						Severe Hunger x2 				Level 5:  						Spell Duration +1 x2 				Level 6:  						Defense +1 x2,  						Poison Immunity 				Level 7:  						Atrophy Carrier 				Level 11:  						Speed +1 				Level 16:  						Attack +2 x2 				Level 17:  						Hit Points +2 x2 				Level 18:  						Counterattack +2,  						Stamina +2 				Level 20:  						Health +1,  						Willpower +1
Description: Rumors about Ratmen spreading disease are absolutely true. But few know how it happens. Very often, it involves the giant rats they're known to breed. The Ratmen directing the rats on the battlefield usually carry whips instead of swords, and proudly call themselves "Plague Warriors". At these skilled trainers' command, giant rats pounce on the enemy, sowing chaos in their ranks, exhausting and bleeding them out before the main Ratmen force attacks. Should the enemy miraculously survive the onslaught of giant rats, they will be unpleasantly surprised to realize that Plague Warriors can hold their own in melee. Outstanding combat skills are exceedingly rare in Ratmen, due to their anatomy, but they are never an easy target.

Name: Magic Crystal
Abilities: Level 0:  						Mechanical,  						Immobilized,  						Mind Control Immunity,  						Sparks on Contact 				Level 1:  						Hit Points +2 x5,  						Defense +1 x4,  						Spellpower +1 x5 				Level 2:  						Ranged Defense +1 x3,  						Resistance +1 x7 				Level 8:  						Ranged Defense +2 x3 				Level 9:  						Defense +2 x3 				Level 11:  						Hit Points +3 x5 				Level 14:  						Armor +1 x7 				Level 16:  						Resistance +2 x3
Description: Conjuring a magic crystal is one of the oldest battle spells in Eador. They were first created by a mysterious race of Ancients. Facing the hordes of Chaos for the first time and running low on offensive spells, the mages of the Conclave attempted to wall themselves off from their enemies, by creating entire glittering walls of enormous crystals. The harmony present in the mathematically perfect structure of these crystal barriers was designed to repel the spawns of Hell... but it didn't work. So the mages repurposed the structures into defensive weapons. In this day and age, the secret of creating magic crystals is known to many wizards from different races of Eador. The crystals are used to fill gaps in defense lines or shape the battlefield to the caster's advantage. It is capable of accumulating static charge, discharging when the opportunity arises. Even if the enemy is able to seriously damage a crystal, it bursts and cuts them down with razor-sharp diamond splinters.

Name: Shadow Claw
Similar units: Plague Warrior, Plague Master, Grey Overlord
Ways to get: Toxic Tent (building), Ratman Barracks (site), fortifications in the province of the race Ratmen
Abilities: Level 0:  						Ratman,  						Forest Knowledge +2,  						Shadow Claw,  						Precise Shot 2,  						Parry (2),  						Backstab +4,  						Mobility 				Level 1:  						Hit Points +1 x5,  						Attack +1 x6,  						Ranged Defense +1 x6,  						Backstab +2 x4 				Level 2:  						Stamina +1 x6,  						Counterattack +1 x3,  						Resistance +1 x5,  						Hunger +5 				Level 3:  						Parry +2 x2 				Level 4:  						Defense +1 x3,  						Precise Strike +1 x3 				Level 6:  						Severe Hunger x2 				Level 7:  						Thaumaturgy +1 x2 				Level 8:  						Morale +2 x2 				Level 11:  						Health +1 x4 				Level 13:  						Hit Points +2 x3 				Level 14:  						Strength +1 x2 				Level 15:  						Stamina +2 x2 				Level 19:  						Attack +2
Description: Constantly sniffing for something is the very nature of the rat. Moreover, Skreets are masters of disguise without equal. Unsurprisingly, the best spies and assassins in Eador are Ratmen. Human assassins are slow, clumsy and conspicuous compared to Shadow Claws, as these Ratmen call themselves. Every Claw has mastered an impressive array of moves and techniques, which compensates for their lack of raw strength. Their greatest pride are their weapons - shadow swords. These special blades are forged with tiny pieces of Death Crystals, and imbued with a virulent poison. A blow from such a weapon immediately turns steel to rust, and even a tiny cut can be fatal. Rumor has it that resourceful Ratmen "borrowed" the idea for the swords along with the Shadow Claws' fighting style from their subterranean neighbors, the Drow, which would explain the similar names.

Name: Plague Shooter
Similar units: Ratman, Plague Warrior, Shadow Claw, Plague Master, Grey Overlord
Ways to get: Ratman Lair (building), fortifications in the province of the race Ratmen
Abilities: Level 0:  						Necrophagy +5,  						Hills Knowledge +1,  						Cause Fever,  						Tolerance,  						Concoction 				Level 1:  						Hit Points +1 x6,  						Attack +1 x4,  						Stamina +1 x9 				Level 2:  						Counterattack +1 x4,  						Resistance +1 x4 				Level 3:  						Defense +1 x3,  						Ammo +1 x3 				Level 4:  						Ranged Defense +1 x3 				Level 5:  						Morale +2 x3,  						Thaumaturgy +1 x2 				Level 7:  						Poison Immunity 				Level 11:  						Range +1 				Level 13:  						Hit Points +2 x4,  						Hunger +5 				Level 14:  						Cause Atrophy 				Level 15:  						Health +1 x3 				Level 17:  						Willpower +1 x2 				Level 20:  						Armor +1
Description: For many years, Skreet armies lacked ranged troops. What was the point in underground tunnels? It was only when they started waging war on the surface that they realized it was a problem. While the fear of disease successfully detered incoming enemy forces, what were the Skreets to do if they needed to gain ground? Eventually, they found a way to lace sling ammo with poison. To this end, special shells filled with toxins were created. Today, poison shots are the Ratmen's crowning achievement. Should an enemy manage to reach a Plague Shooter, the latter might then guzzle another liquid, a nauseating but very effective Ratman brew, made from Lord-of-Light-knows-what, greatly increasing the willing victim's fighting prowess, despite strong side effects. It might seem impossible that anyone beside Ratmen would even think about drinking the putrid brew. However, there are stories of human rulers buying it to torture prisoners.

Name: Trap
Abilities: Level 0:  						Mechanical,  						Immobilized,  						Totem,  						Trap 				Level 1:  						Spellpower +1 x3 				Level 4:  						Hit Points +1 x17
Description: A primitive, but fairly effective mechanical trap. This oversized device can injure even large animals, let alone human-sized creatures. They are often used by Goblins on the "prowl", as they call their vicious raids. This trap is able to hinder any non-flying creature, on top of inflicting damage with sharp spikes.

Name: Hornet's Nest
Abilities: Level 0:  						Mechanical,  						Immobilized,  						Totem,  						Hornet's Nest 				Level 1:  						Spell Duration +1 x3 				Level 4:  						Hit Points +1 x17
Description: A primitive, but fairly effective mechanical trap. This oversized device can injure even large animals, let alone human-sized creatures. They are often used by Goblins on the "prowl", as they call their vicious raids. This trap is able to complicate the life of all living creatures, as angry hornets pounce on the reckless who come too close.

Name: Earth Totem
Abilities: Level 0:  						Mechanical,  						Immobilized,  						Totem,  						Lifeblood,  						Ghost Wrath,  						Stone Spikes 				Level 1:  						Hit Points +1 x20 				Level 2:  						Defense +1 x3 				Level 3:  						Hit Points +2 x4 				Level 4:  						Ranged Defense +1 x4 				Level 5:  						Earth Shield,  						Spellpower +1 x2,  						Spell Duration +1 x2 				Level 7:  						Resistance +1 x2 				Level 10:  						Lifeblood 				Level 15:  						Lifeblood [Lifeblood] 				Level 20:  						Lifeblood [Lifeblood]
Description: A pile of stones, twigs, bones, covered with obscure scribbles... In reality, this is a cunning trap, to chain Astral Spirits, and use the energy from their fierce attempts to break free to charge the signs engraved on the totem. When the spellcaster who created the totem considers the charge adequate, he releases the spirit, forcing it to follow his command. This totem holds captive an Earth Elemental. Once released, it is able to summon the power of his element either to protect the caster, or to tear the ground apart beneath the enemy's feet.

Name: Rage Totem
Abilities: Level 0:  						Mechanical,  						Immobilized,  						Totem,  						Mass Bloodlust,  						Ghost Wrath,  						Rage 				Level 1:  						Hit Points +1 x21 				Level 2:  						Defense +1 x3 				Level 3:  						Hit Points +2 x4 				Level 4:  						Ranged Defense +1 x4 				Level 5:  						Mass Bloodlust,  						Spell Duration +1 x2 				Level 7:  						Resistance +1 x2 				Level 10:  						Mass Bloodlust [Mass Bloodlust],  						Mass Rage 				Level 15:  						Mass Bloodlust [Mass Bloodlust]
Description: A pile of stones, twigs, bones, covered with obscure scribbles... In reality, this is a cunning trap, to chain Astral Spirits, and use the energy from their fierce attempts to break free to charge the signs engraved on the totem. When the spellcaster who created the totem considers the charge adequate, he releases the spirit, forcing it to follow his command. This totem holds captive an Astral Spirit. Once released, it is able to fill allies with courage and fearlessness, and strike fear and despair in the enemy's heart.

Name: Fire Totem
Abilities: Level 0:  						Mechanical,  						Immobilized,  						Totem,  						Mass Burning,  						Ghost Wrath,  						Fire Rage 				Level 1:  						Hit Points +1 x20 				Level 2:  						Defense +1 x3 				Level 3:  						Hit Points +2 x4 				Level 4:  						Ranged Defense +1 x4 				Level 5:  						Spellpower +1 x2,  						Summoning Power +4 x2 				Level 7:  						Resistance +1 x2 				Level 10:  						Mass Burning,  						Summon Fire Elemental 				Level 20:  						Mass Burning [Mass Combustion]
Description: A pile of stones, twigs, bones, covered with obscure scribbles... In reality, this is a cunning trap, to chain Astral Spirits, and use the energy from their fierce attempts to break free to charge the signs engraved on the totem. When the spellcaster who created the totem considers the charge adequate, he releases the spirit, forcing it to follow his command. This totem holds captive a Fire Elemental. Once released, it is able to unleash scorching flares upon the caster's enemies, and even materialize shortly as a pure flame.

Name: Plague Master
Ways to get: Plague Temple (building), fortifications in the province of the race Ratmen
Abilities: Level 0:  						Magic Strike,  						Ratman,  						Fever Carrier,  						Atrophy Carrier,  						Summon Rat,  						Plague Master,  						Recover Ammo 				Level 1:  						Hit Points +1 x6,  						Resistance +1 x2,  						Poison Shot +1 x5,  						Forest Knowledge +1 				Level 2:  						Stamina +1 x6,  						Ammo +1 x5,  						Morale +2 x3,  						Cause Leprosy 				Level 3:  						Counterattack +1 x3,  						Swamp Knowledge +2 				Level 4:  						Ranged Defense +1 x3,  						Hills Knowledge +2,  						Spell Duration +1 x3 				Level 5:  						Hunger +5 				Level 6:  						Attack +1 x3,  						Recover Ammo +1 x3 				Level 7:  						Poison Attack +1 x3,  						Poison Rain 				Level 8:  						Defense +1 x2,  						Fever Hotbed 				Level 11:  						Thaumaturgy +1 x2,  						Atrophy Hotbed 				Level 13:  						Hit Points +2 x4,  						Resistance +2 x2 				Level 14:  						Stamina +2 x4,  						Willpower +1 x2 				Level 18:  						Severe Hunger 				Level 19:  						Collect Ammo 				Level 20:  						Willpower +2
Description: Skreet fighters usually rally around strong, experienced and skilled individuals who have survived numerous battles. They are quite rare, but such Plague Warriors eventually become leaders and mentors for the next generation. Referred to as Plague Masters, they never travel alone. Other Ratmen vigilantly protect them at all times, and would not hesitate to throw themselves in the way of enemy swords or axes, should they threaten a Plague Master. Masters can infect their enemies by directing hordes of giant rats carrying horrible diseases. The stronger a Master becomes, the more sophisticated ways to kill he employs, eventually sending plagues down on enemy settlements, decimating tens or even hundreds.

Name: Grey Overlord
Ways to get: Grand Altar (building), fortifications in the province of the race Ratmen
Abilities: Level 0:  						Poison Attack (4),  						Ratman,  						Grey Overlord,  						Fever Hotbed,  						Necrophagy 				Level 1:  						Hit Points +2 x2,  						Attack +1 x4,  						Ranged Defense +1 x7,  						Forest Knowledge +1 				Level 2:  						Counterattack +1 x5,  						Defense +1 x5,  						Ammo +1 x2 				Level 3:  						Resistance +1 x3,  						Severe Hunger x3 				Level 4:  						Stamina +1 x2,  						Atrophy Hotbed 				Level 5:  						Health +1 x3,  						Summoning Power +4 x3 				Level 6:  						Morale +2 x2,  						Poison Attack (2) 				Level 7:  						Hit Points +3 x5,  						Spell Duration +1 x2 				Level 8:  						Recover Ammo x2 				Level 9:  						Strength +1 x4,  						Leprosy Hotbed,  						Summoning Range +1 x2 				Level 11:  						Attack +2 x2 				Level 12:  						Poison Attack (3) 				Level 14:  						Health +2 x3,  						Counterattack +2 x3,  						Ranged Defense +2 x3,  						Meditation +2 				Level 15:  						Plague 				Level 16:  						Defense +2 x2,  						Attack +3 x2,  						Armor +1 				Level 18:  						Stamina +2
Description: The apotheosis in a Plague Master's career is getting recognized by his kin as a Grey Overlord - leader of the tribe or the settlement, his reign blessed by the Grand Ratt. Unusually large among Ratmen, their enchanted blade and a helmet-mask crowned with a pair of long curved horns is the last thing seen by the few unlucky adventurers who glimpse a Grey Overlord, moments before they're devoured by hordes of giant rats appearing out of nowhere. Their past experience as Plague Masters allows them to crush their enemies under an avalanche of rats carrying deadly diseases. The Grey Overlord himself is also extremely dangerous - his blade soaked in deadly poison not even an experienced warrior can survive.

Name: Blood Totem
Abilities: Level 0:  						Mechanical,  						Immobilized,  						Totem,  						Mass Vampirism,  						Ghost Wrath,  						Vampiric Touch 				Level 1:  						Hit Points +1 x20 				Level 2:  						Defense +1 x3 				Level 3:  						Hit Points +2 x4 				Level 4:  						Ranged Defense +1 x4 				Level 5:  						Spellpower +1 x2,  						Spell Duration +1 x2 				Level 7:  						Resistance +1 x2 				Level 10:  						Mass Vampirism,  						Tribe's Blood 				Level 20:  						Mass Vampirism [Mass Vampirism]
Description: A pile of stones, twigs, bones, covered with obscure scribbles... In reality, this is a cunning trap, to chain Astral Spirits, and use the energy from their fierce attempts to break free to charge the signs engraved on the totem. When the spellcaster who created the totem considers the charge adequate, he releases the spirit, forcing it to follow his command. This totem holds captive a Spirit that controls the blood of sentient creatures. Once released, it is able to heal the caster's allies and provide them with tremendous strength.

Name: Daokon's Guardian
Abilities: Level 0:  						Charge,  						Battle Frenzy (5),  						Siege (8),  						Mind Control Immunity,  						Trample (20),  						Web Immunity 				Level 1:  						Attack +1 x4,  						Ranged Defense +1 x5,  						Stamina +2 x5,  						Trample +2 x4 				Level 2:  						Counterattack +1 x5,  						Defense +1 x5,  						Resistance +1 x5 				Level 3:  						Hit Points +3 x3,  						Morale +2 x2,  						Siege +4 x5 				Level 5:  						Health +1 x3 				Level 9:  						Strength +1 x4,  						Forced March 				Level 11:  						Attack +2 x2 				Level 12:  						Stamina +3 x3 				Level 13:  						Hit Points +4 x3 				Level 14:  						Health +2 x3,  						Counterattack +2 x3 				Level 16:  						Attack +3 x2,  						Armor +1 				Level 17:  						Ranged Defense +2 x2 				Level 20:  						Defense +2
Description: One of the mysteries of the secret Monstrologist Guild is the knowledge of breeding war elephants - a way to significantly enhance the combat capabilities of these huge animals. What is necessary for success, in addition to the fairly high cost of creating powerful equipment and a ritual using rare ingredients, is a really strong and mighty elephant. Obtained in case of success is a creature that only partly resembles a common elephant. In the days of the Daokon Empire the personal guardians of the Emperor were just such animals, on the one hand, as loyal to his master as a dog, and on the other, mad and unbridled, smashing everything in its path with tremendous force, fueled by a wild rage. Stopping such a colossus is incredibly difficult - only a really powerful or huge creature is capable of withstanding this monster, and even magic will have a hard time dealing with it.

Name: Paragon of Light
Abilities: Level 0:  						Paragon of Light,  						Smite Evil +3 x2,  						Healing,  						Vigilance,  						Mobility,  						Heavenly Armor,  						Resistance to Fear 				Level 1:  						Hit Points +2 x4,  						Attack +1 x3,  						Defense +1 x3,  						Morale +3 x8 				Level 2:  						Stamina +2 x4,  						Counterattack +1 x3,  						Ranged Defense +1 x2 				Level 3:  						Resistance +1 x2,  						Smite Evil +2 				Level 4:  						Healing +3 x3 				Level 5:  						Health +1 x3,  						Armor +1 x3 				Level 7:  						Attack +2 x3 				Level 8:  						Counterattack +2 x5,  						Speed +1 				Level 9:  						Strength +1 x4,  						Resistance +2 				Level 11:  						Ranged Defense +2 x2 				Level 12:  						Stamina +3 x3,  						Willpower +1 x3 				Level 13:  						Hit Points +3 x3,  						Defense +2 x2 				Level 14:  						Health +2 x3,  						Ammo +1 				Level 16:  						Attack +3 x2,  						Armor +2 x2
Description: Those paladins most greatly blessed are awarded with the brightest Light of the Lord - and from then onwards there will be few creatures of Darkness or Chaos capable of defeating such a Paragon of Light in open battle! His proficiency in warfare, combined with years of combat experience, makes this holy warrior almost invincible and even hordes of the most powerful enemies can only temporarily postpone their doom - a Paragon of Light does not die, slain by claw and fang, but is instantly revived by the miraculous power of his divine patron, spelling doom to foul creatures once more. In addition to the laying on of hands, healing the wounds of his allies, a Paragon of Light can also treat his own wounds, just by praying to the Lord of the Light.

Name: Maleficar
Abilities: Level 0:  						Maleficar,  						Lesser Undead,  						Undead Summoning Power +4 x2,  						Spellpower +1 x3,  						Spell Duration +1 x3,  						Maleficar Tome,  						Life Leech 25,  						Immunity to Bleeding,  						Lord of the Dead 				Level 1:  						Hit Points +2 x9,  						Undead Summoning Power +1 x2,  						Energy Control +1 x7 				Level 2:  						Ammo +1 x2,  						Resistance +1 x3,  						Mass Undead Restoration 				Level 3:  						Counterattack +1 x4,  						Ranged Defense +1 x4,  						Ranged Attack +2 x8 				Level 4:  						Attack +1 x4,  						Life Leech +25 				Level 6:  						Raise Ghost 				Level 8:  						Defense +1 x2,  						Undead Summoning Power +2 x3 				Level 9:  						Thaumaturgy +1 x2 				Level 10:  						Ammo +2 x3,  						Necromancer's Cry 				Level 11:  						Life Drain 				Level 13:  						Resistance +2 x3 				Level 16:  						Range +1 				Level 19:  						Ranged Attack +3 				Level 20:  						Raise Vampire
Description: For the most powerful warlocks a day will come when all the secrets of Darkness are revealed to them. With a rich repertoire of dark spells, these adepts of Death can simply crush their enemies under a mass of walking corpses, who until recently were living enemies or allies. The Maleficar, who in some ways is the quintessence of Darkness, is no longer subject to fear, poison, exhaustion or pain, just like the undead. Even the magic that can draw heat from the body is not able to harm this cold, almost heartless ruler of the Dark.

Name: Gates of Chaos
Abilities: Level 0:  						Gates of Chaos 1,  						Gates of Chaos 2,  						Summon Imp,  						Summon Spawn,  						Immunity to Bleeding,  						Lord of Demons 				Level 1:  						Hit Points +3 x7,  						Defense +2 x5 				Level 2:  						Defense +1 x4,  						Meditation +1 x7 				Level 3:  						Ammo +1 x3 				Level 4:  						Summoning Power +4 x3 				Level 5:  						Summon Fiend 				Level 6:  						Summon Hellhound 				Level 7:  						Summon Succubus 				Level 8:  						Summon Fiend Lord 				Level 9:  						Summon Cerberus 				Level 12:  						Summon Demon 				Level 13:  						Defense +3 x3 				Level 15:  						Hit Points +4 x3,  						Summon Destroyer 				Level 16:  						Ammo +2 x2 				Level 18:  						Summon Devil 				Level 20:  						Summoning Power +8
Description: This is the door through which the creatures of Chaos can get into the world of order, as simple as entering another room - by just taking a step. Unfortunately for demonic creatures, the Gates' "bandwidth" is limited - after each movement the energy of the gateway needs to be restored, and the costs of the move are directly proportional to the power of the spirit passing through it. Small creatures such as demons and spawn are able to pass through the gates almost without interruption, but after devils have moved through - the most powerful servants of Chaos - it takes a very long time to restore its energy. The most monstrous creations from the bowels of hell - the Acheron - generally cannot pass through them. Destroying such a structure is extremely difficult, especially since killing the defenders of the portal will not necessarily make things safe - while the passage is open, creatures of Chaos are able to pass through it. Therefore, a courageous hero's task is not an easy one - deciding what to destroy first, the gate itself or its defenders.

Name: Alchemist
Ways to get: Rune Workshop (building), fortifications in the province of the race Dwarves
Abilities: Level 0:  						Magic Shot,  						Overwhelming Force,  						Hills Knowledge +2 x3,  						Explosive Weapon,  						Healing Circle 				Level 1:  						Hit Points +1 x2,  						Ranged Attack +1 x3,  						Resistance +1 x5,  						Counterattack +1 x6 				Level 2:  						Stamina +1 x3,  						Defense +1 x4,  						Attack +1 x5,  						Ammo +1 x5 				Level 3:  						Ranged Defense +1 x4,  						Morale +2 x2,  						First Aid +1 x4 				Level 4:  						Ranged Attack +2 x2 				Level 5:  						Hit Points +2 x5 				Level 6:  						Fire Immunity 				Level 8:  						Stamina +2 x3 				Level 9:  						Poison Immunity,  						Caustic Mixture 				Level 10:  						Health +1 x2 				Level 11:  						Petrification Immunity 				Level 12:  						Range +1 				Level 13:  						Healing Circle 				Level 14:  						Armor +1 x2 				Level 15:  						Hit Points +3 x3,  						Morale +3 				Level 16:  						Willpower +1 x2 				Level 18:  						Stamina +3 				Level 19:  						Strength +1 				Level 20:  						Health +2,  						Willpower +2,  						Armor +2
Description: The dwarven society does not have a hierarchical structure, unlike the humans, alkari or lizards Each dwarf has a craft and is willing to pick up a weapon to defend his home. The choice of weapons depends on the talents and inclinations of each individual dwarf. In wartimes those who are used to swing mine picks pick up an axe, a blacksmith uses his skills to support siege engines and the magicians cast powerful runes. A dwarven alchemist enters the battlefield bringing the tools of his trade. In combat, alchemists throw enchanted flasks at enemy groups. Although the strong dwarves can throw the flasks exceptionally far in human terms, they still cannot match the range of an arrow. The content of these harmless-looking flasks can be very diverse - ranging from corrosive acids to exploding concoctions. The garments worn by alchemists provide little protection, but the enemy is usually severely weakened by acid burns and explosions when they reach the dwarven lines... if they manage to reach the Dwarven lines at all that is. Besides using their skills for combat, alchemists are also able to heal wounded Dwarven warriors.

Name: Dwarven Pavisier
Ways to get: Rune Workshop (building), fortifications in the province of the race Dwarves
Abilities: Level 0:  						Armor Piercing Shot,  						Hills Knowledge +2 x4,  						Siege Mode 				Level 1:  						Hit Points +1 x5,  						Ranged Attack +1 x6,  						Stamina +1 x7,  						Resistance +1 x4,  						Ammo +1 x4 				Level 2:  						Defense +1 x3,  						Siege +2 x4 				Level 3:  						Counterattack +1 x4 				Level 4:  						Ranged Defense +1 x3 				Level 5:  						Morale +2 x3 				Level 6:  						Attack +1 x3,  						First Aid +1 x3 				Level 7:  						Petrification Immunity 				Level 11:  						Hit Points +2 x5,  						Forced March 				Level 14:  						Stamina +2 x2 				Level 15:  						Poison Immunity 				Level 16:  						Strength +1 				Level 17:  						Morale +3,  						Willpower +1 x2,  						Ranged Attack +2 x2 				Level 18:  						Health +1 x2 				Level 20:  						Armor +1
Description: Few people are able to remain calm and collected when facing a line of Dwarven Pavisiers, armor-clad crossbowmen protected by a large convex shield - the pavise. The Dwarven crossbow deserves a special mention: this true work of art is much more powerful than the common crossbow, and optimized for firing behind the pavise. It is true that Dwarves are not the best marksmen of Eador, but in narrow and twisty underground corridors, accuracy is of minor importance: aware of their shortcomings, they let the enemy come close until they can't miss, and then finish him off with their axe. Why don't other races use pavisiers? Because the sheer weight of a pavisier's equipment is such that even the toughest Dwarves plod along with great difficulty.

Name: Avenger
Abilities: Level 0:  						Flying,  						Armorpiercing Strike,  						Hex,  						Intimidation +2,  						Fear,  						Fire Immunity,  						Dark Dominion 1 x3,  						Soul Stealing (5),  						Raise Demon,  						Wounding Spikes +1 x4 				Level 1:  						Hit Points +2 x4,  						Attack +2 x4,  						Resistance +1 x3 				Level 2:  						Stamina +2 x4,  						Counterattack +1 x3,  						Defense +1 x6 				Level 3:  						Attack +1,  						Ranged Defense +1 x6,  						Soul Stealing +1 x4 				Level 4:  						Stunning Blow +1 				Level 5:  						Health +1 x3,  						Morale +2 x3 				Level 6:  						Hex +2 				Level 8:  						Ammo +1 x3 				Level 9:  						Strength +1 x4 				Level 10:  						Counterattack +2 x4,  						Speed +1 				Level 12:  						Stamina +3 x3,  						Willpower +1 x2 				Level 13:  						Hit Points +3 x3 				Level 14:  						Health +2 x3 				Level 16:  						Attack +3 x2 				Level 18:  						Resistance +2 				Level 19:  						Ranged Defense +2,  						Morale +3 				Level 20:  						Armor +2
Description: Demons are a frightful horde of murderers, but they are not an army. Higher demons conspire against each other, jealously espying the Chaos Flame's latest favorite. Lower demons only respect brute force. At the first available opportunity they tend to go rogue and ignore the wishes of their demon lords. Infighting and bloody murder is usually the result. Lords of the Underworld use avengers to keep order in the ranks of their legions... and to dole out punishment. Avengers have been imbued with the Flame of Chaos - which is considered a blessing by some, a curse by others. The avenger is a rare and extremely dangerous kind of demon. It is cruel and unstoppable and moves with great speed and agility. Avengers are covered by a multitude of razor-sharp horns and spikes that can easily cut through even the thick hide of demons. Hardened by fire, they survive even the most serious injuries. After being defeated, the avenger rises again as the regular demon it once was.

Name: Colossus
Abilities: Level 0:  						Golem,  						Stunning Blow +1 x5,  						Spell Immunity 				Level 1:  						Hit Points +3 x10,  						Attack +1 x4,  						Ranged Defense +1 x2 				Level 2:  						Counterattack +1 x2,  						Defense +1 x2,  						Resistance +1 x4 				Level 5:  						Ranged Defense +2 x4 				Level 6:  						Counterattack +2 x4,  						Defense +2 x4 				Level 8:  						Armorpiercing Strike 				Level 9:  						Attack +2 x5 				Level 10:  						Strength +1 x2,  						Armor +1 x2 				Level 12:  						Crushing Blow 				Level 14:  						Trample (10) 				Level 15:  						Ranged Defense +3 x3 				Level 16:  						Counterattack +3 x2,  						Defense +3 x2 				Level 19:  						Attack +3
Description: Dwarves, being small of size, are fascinated by huge structures and gigantic constructs. This fascination is also mirrored in the design of military units. After encountering a golem once, they set out to repeat and surpass this amazing feat of magic. Their attempts to turn lifeless matter into an animated, battle-ready champion resulted in their first golem creation, the Colossus. It was... colossal! Since they encountered difficulties using stone to create a giant golem, they decided to use metal instead. Supporting a powerful offensive unit like the Colossus with long range missiles of the Earthshaker has turned the tides of battle in favor of the Dwarves many times. This Dwarven triumph of military genius has destroyed whole armies and razed fortifications. Aware of the machine's power, dwarves are hesitant to sell it to outsiders.

Name: Herbalist
Similar units: Halfling, Halfling Rogue, Border Guard, Bard
Ways to get: Halfling Quarter (building), fortifications in the province of the race Halflings
Abilities: Level 0:  						Agility,  						Healing (4),  						Collect Ammo,  						Skillful Healer +1 x3 				Level 1:  						Hit Points +1 x6,  						Morale +2 x5,  						Resistance +1 x5,  						First Aid +1 x5 				Level 2:  						Stamina +1 x6,  						Counterattack +1 x3 				Level 3:  						Healing +1 x6 				Level 4:  						Ranged Defense +1 x3 				Level 5:  						Ammo +1 x3 				Level 7:  						Attack +1 				Level 8:  						Defense +1 x4 				Level 13:  						Hit Points +2 x4 				Level 14:  						Stamina +2 x2 				Level 17:  						Willpower +1 x2 				Level 18:  						Health +1 x2
Description: Although halflings are a peaceful race and don't typically suffer battle wounds, they still need specialists to treat common injuries. They make medicine out of various herbs, roots, bark and other plants. Halflings who study the properties of herbs and put this knowledge to good use are called herbalists. Although unfit for combat, they are essential on the battle field, merrily looking after wounded soldiers. Their small size - compared to humans - allows them to nimbly sneak past enemies to do their job. However, their thin cape offers no real protection against the enemy's weapons.

Name: Mule
Abilities: Level 0:  						Does not fight,  						Ammo Bearer,  						Supplier 				Level 1:  						Hit Points +1 x3,  						Stamina +1 x2 				Level 2:  						Resistance +1 x3 				Level 3:  						Ranged Defense +1 x4 				Level 4:  						Supplier +1 x3 				Level 5:  						Health +1 x3,  						Defense +1 x2 				Level 6:  						First Aid +1 x3,  						Ammo Bearer +1 x2 				Level 7:  						Hit Points +2 x5 				Level 9:  						Morale +2 x2 				Level 20:  						Hit Points +3
Description: Because they are small and not much stronger than a human child, halflings are not able to carry heavy loads. Yet distant and long-lasting military campaigns require hauling stockpiles of food and equipment. (Halflings do love to eat!) They cope by using pack animals in large numbers, usually mules and ponies. Every halfling possesses two or three mules and one or two ponies, and carrying supplies onto the battlefield on the back of a mule is far from unusual. However, these "stallions" are no help in battle, unable to cause real harm, even to those who would attack them.

Name: Border Guard
Ways to get: Halfling's Suburb (building), fortifications in the province of the race Halflings
Abilities: Level 0:  						Forced March,  						Charge,  						Forest Knowledge +1,  						Hills Knowledge +1,  						Stunning Shot +1 x4,  						Workaholic +10 x2 				Level 1:  						Stamina +1 x2,  						Attack +1 x5,  						Counterattack +1 x4,  						Morale +2 x7 				Level 2:  						Hit Points +1 x5,  						Ranged Attack +1 x5 				Level 3:  						Ranged Defense +1 x4 				Level 4:  						Resistance +1 x3 				Level 5:  						Stamina +2 x4,  						Ammo +1 x3 				Level 6:  						Defense +1 x3 				Level 7:  						Health +1 x4 				Level 9:  						Workaholic +20 				Level 11:  						Charge +1 				Level 12:  						Hit Points +2 x5 				Level 15:  						Willpower +1 x2 				Level 16:  						Attack +2 x2,  						Counterattack +2 x2 				Level 17:  						Speed +1
Description: Halflings are excellent farmers and breeders. They love plants, and will look after them day and night. But when it comes to plowing, they are too small to use horses or oxen. Instead of ponies or mules, they use large boars. Boars are fairly clever animals, and they become very obedient when raised by caring hands. Often, plowing is made into a contest. The boars are lined up, side by side. At the judge's signal, the boars cheerfully rush forward, racing each other. The bolder halflings ride on the boar's back. Wild animals are no match for such "cavalry": The boar himself is a dangerous opponent on his own, and the rider is armed. Lone bandits tend to avoid border guards, as these halflings call themselves. Problems really start when bandits unite, but even then, border guards find ways to outsmart their opponents.

Name: Bard
Similar units: Halfling, Halfling Rogue, Herbalist, Border Guard
Ways to get: Halfling Market (building), fortifications in the province of the race Halflings
Abilities: Level 0:  						Agility,  						First Aid +1 x5,  						Inspiration,  						Meditation +1,  						Scavenger +10 x2 				Level 1:  						Morale +2 x5,  						Stamina +1 x7,  						Ammo +1 x4 				Level 2:  						Hit Points +1 x10,  						Resistance +1 x7,  						Attack +1 x5,  						Mockery 				Level 3:  						Ranged Defense +1 x6,  						Counterattack +1 x5 				Level 4:  						Defense +1 x5 				Level 5:  						Scorn 				Level 9:  						Web Immunity,  						Hero's Ballad 				Level 10:  						Dash 				Level 13:  						Forager
Description: Halflings usually avoid battle, as well as any other danger. But bards seek out extraordinary battles and adventure, because authenticity is the essence of epic ballads. Of course, bards are frail by human standards, and cannot survive melee combat, but they can convince yesterday's peasants they are true warriors. A never-ending (well, almost - even bards sometimes need to catch their breath) stream of taunts and sneers makes their enemies fly into a rage, and compels recruits to prove their bravery in battle. The experience of tavern fights, and dodging flying mugs doesn't help bards evade arrows, but they tend to quickly learn where not to stand.

Name: Arisen Luminary
Ways to get: Shining Spire (building), fortifications in the province of the race Alkaryl
Abilities: Level 0:  						Alkaryl,  						Smite Evil +3,  						Arisen Luminary 				Level 1:  						Hit Points +1 x5,  						Attack +1 x2,  						Ranged Defense +1 x3,  						Morale +2 x5 				Level 2:  						Counterattack +1 x3,  						Resistance +1,  						Stamina +1 x5 				Level 3:  						Defense +1 x2,  						Willpower +1 x5,  						Battle Frenzy +1 x4 				Level 4:  						Smite Evil +1 x3 				Level 5:  						Attack +2 x3 				Level 6:  						Regeneration +1 x2 				Level 8:  						Mind Control Immunity 				Level 11:  						Strength +1 x3 				Level 12:  						Stamina +2 x5,  						Speed +1 				Level 13:  						Hit Points +2 x3 				Level 15:  						Armor +1 x2
Description: When most of the souls of the Children of Heaven transition to the spiritual collective of the afterlife, they leave their memory and knowledge to it, and merge together, thinning, dissolving in it and falling asleep. However, there are alkari who cannot be turned even by death from their path of fighting the forces of Chaos. Having once dwelled among the Departed, the Arisen returns to finish his mission, rehatched in the body of a nestling. Now the nestling has grown and is ready for duty. An Arisen focuses all the mental power he received from the Tree on keeping himself alive in the heart of the battle. His duty leads him, and the righteous wrath of the Departed time and again opens the wings of a noble warrior.

Name: Memory Keeper
Ways to get: Mentorium (building), fortifications in the province of the race Alkaryl
Abilities: Level 0:  						Alkaryl,  						Smite Evil +1 x3,  						Meditation +1 x2,  						Summon Stalker,  						Mental Duel,  						Mental Sermon 				Level 1:  						Hit Points +1 x5,  						Attack +1 x7,  						Stamina +2 x9,  						Willpower +1 x6 				Level 2:  						Ranged Defense +1 x5,  						Ammo +1 x6,  						Recuperation +1 x3 				Level 3:  						Morale +2 x3 				Level 4:  						Summoning Power +4 x3 				Level 5:  						First Aid +1 x4 				Level 6:  						Spell Duration +1 x2 				Level 7:  						Mind Control Immunity 				Level 8:  						Defense +1 x3 				Level 9:  						Speed +1 x2 				Level 10:  						Order 				Level 11:  						Strength +1 x2 				Level 14:  						Strong Mind 				Level 16:  						Hit Points +2 x2
Description: Provident rulers of men who seek answers in history may find that human memory is quick to consign events of the recent past to oblivion. Such a situation is unimaginable for an alkari. Everything that the Children of Heaven have ever encountered is kept in their collective memory, and the ruling caste of mentors is there to store and interpret it. They value knowledge above all, but do not produce it like alchemists or dwarven engineers, but simply collect it, observing the life of others and memorizing what they see. Keepers are in a constant contact with the Trees of the Departed, which makes their mental power truly extraordinary: they are capable of healing whole armies, stopping enemies with no more than a glance, and calling forth Stalkers from the host of the Departed.

Name: Eternal Mentor
Ways to get: Crystal Pillars (building), fortifications in the province of the race Alkaryl
Abilities: Level 0:  						Alkaryl,  						Smite Evil +2,  						Meditation +2,  						Reincarnation,  						Eternal Mentor 				Level 1:  						Hit Points +1 x7,  						Attack +1 x7,  						Stamina +2 x10,  						Willpower +1 x6 				Level 2:  						Ranged Defense +1 x5,  						Ammo +1 x6,  						Recuperation +1 x3 				Level 3:  						Morale +2 x3,  						Smite Evil +1 x2 				Level 4:  						Summoning Power +4 x3 				Level 5:  						First Aid +1 x4 				Level 6:  						Spell Duration +1 x2 				Level 8:  						Defense +1 x2 				Level 9:  						Speed +1 x2,  						Mental Resonance 				Level 11:  						Strength +1 x2 				Level 13:  						Act of Faith 				Level 17:  						Meditation +1
Description: The high-ranking Mentors rarely participate in combat, relying on the warrior caste for the extermination of Chaos, and typically having lived three times longer than the usual 60-70 years through their magic, they die, never having once seen the Enemy firsthand. However, on rare occasions mentors, like some of the warriors, seek a different afterlife. An eternal mentor, arisen from the dead, considers his earthly duty fulfilled as leader and teacher to the people, and stands against the forces of Chaos in person. An Arisen Mentor, capable of dominating the will of his enemies by his incredible mental strength and endowing his allies with great power, will return to the world again and again, until the last of the Chaos spawn are no more.

Name: Tree of the Departed
Abilities: Level 0:  						Tree of the Departed,  						Poison Immunity,  						Mind Control Immunity,  						Tree Abilities,  						Immunity to Bleeding 				Level 1:  						Summon Stalker x2,  						Summon Luminary x2 				Level 3:  						Ammo +1 x16,  						Meditation +1 x3 				Level 4:  						Summoning Power +4 x12 				Level 9:  						Order 				Level 14:  						Summon Keeper x2 				Level 18:  						Summon Arisen x2
Description: The Alkari believe that there was a time when the souls of their dead came to present themselves before the Lord of Heaven to fight the eternal war with the Enemy, but when the Lord of Heaven fell in battle with the demons, the souls of the Departed lost their shelter. Trying to help their ancestors, mentors have found the solution in the memory of the deity - Children of Heaven, previously dwelling high in the mountains, migrated to the fertile plains, where they grew giant Trees of the Departed capable of hosting alkari souls. These trees have become, on the one hand, the home and the source of sustenance for the living, and on the other - the host of the souls of their ancestors, who can always aid their scions, be it with wise advice or mental power. And although the Tree is immobile, its magical powers are enormous, and each alkari, dead or alive, is ready to die again and again, protecting it from defilement.

Name: Grunas

Name: Na'ag
Abilities: Level 0:  						Magic Strike,  						Fire Immunity,  						Surge of Strength +1,  						Dark Replenishment +1 x2,  						Soul Sipping,  						Bane of Mortals 				Level 1:  						Hit Points +2 x6,  						Attack +1 x4,  						Ranged Defense +1 x5,  						Stamina +2 x5 				Level 2:  						Counterattack +1 x5,  						Defense +1 x5,  						Dark Dominion 1 x3 				Level 3:  						Morale +2 x2,  						Resistance +1 x3 				Level 5:  						Health +1 x3 				Level 7:  						Speed +1 				Level 8:  						Spellpower +1 x2 				Level 9:  						Strength +1 x4,  						Agility 				Level 11:  						Attack +2 x2,  						Ammo +1 				Level 12:  						Stamina +3 x3,  						Resistance +2 x3 				Level 13:  						Hit Points +4 x3 				Level 14:  						Health +2 x3,  						Counterattack +2 x3 				Level 16:  						Attack +3 x2,  						Armor +1 				Level 17:  						Ranged Defense +2 x2 				Level 20:  						Defense +2
Description: Nagas, or, as they call themselves, Na'ag - are beyond any doubt the strangest creatures of the Abyss. And it's not just their appearance, even if a face on a huge snake's body looks very strange - and scary. Nagas, unlike most demons, are sensible, inclined to make contact with mortals - though it rarely ends well for the latter, and do not get involved in a fight for the sake of fighting. Their motives are unknown, they do not answer even to greater Demons and Acherons, who don't even try to control them, which is amazing! - as if the Flame had expelled them for a special purpose. In any event, fighting these snake-like monsters is terrifying. Quick, agile, very resistant, they can annihilate a small army in a matter of minutes. The wounds they inflict upon mortal creatures are dreadful, taking extremely long to heal, when the victim is lucky enough to survive. Strong sorcerers, Najas can drain their victim's vitality, and restore their own.

Name: Squire
Abilities: Level 0:  						Armorpiercing Strike,  						Recuperation +1 x3,  						First Strike,  						Forced March,  						Evasion Strategy,  						Vigilance,  						Shield Wall 3 				Level 1:  						Hit Points +1 x3,  						Counterattack +1 x5,  						Ranged Defense +1 x5,  						Morale +2 x2 				Level 2:  						Attack +1 x5,  						Resistance +1 x4,  						Stamina +1 x2 				Level 4:  						Defense +1 x4,  						Shield Wall +1 x3 				Level 6:  						Stamina +2 x4 				Level 7:  						Hit Points +2 x4 				Level 9:  						Morale +3 x3 				Level 11:  						Strength +1 x3,  						Armor +1 x3 				Level 12:  						Health +1 x4,  						Counterattack +2 x3,  						Ranged Defense +2 x3 				Level 13:  						Attack +2 x3,  						Defense +2 x3 				Level 17:  						Hit Points +3 				Level 18:  						Resistance +2 				Level 19:  						Stamina +3,  						Willpower +1 				Level 20:  						Health +2,  						Strength +2,  						Armor +2
Description: Guardsmen rewarded for their dedication may earn the title of Squire - the first significant title on the way to nobility. Generally, along with the title, a lord offered the newly-made Squire their first serious property - a domain or village. And although many Knights chuckle at such "property", for a former Guardsman, it is a significant source of revenue for subsistence - or to buy new upgraded equipment and attire. A Squire's battle field equipment is significantly better than that of a Guardsman. Having realized the vital importance of protection, Squires often supplement their reinforced armor with large shields that protect well from stray arrows. Thanks to their training and combat skills developed as a Guardsman, they can hold their own against an entire enemy squad.

Name: Quasit
Abilities: Level 0:  						Elemental,  						Stunning Blow +1 x3,  						Damage Weapon (3),  						Regeneration +1 x4 				Level 1:  						Hit Points +1 x3,  						Attack +1 x9,  						Counterattack +2 x4,  						Petrification Immunity 				Level 2:  						Resistance +1 x5,  						Defense +1 x5 				Level 3:  						Stamina +2 x3 				Level 4:  						Ranged Defense +1 x5 				Level 7:  						Hit Points +2 x4 				Level 12:  						Web Immunity 				Level 13:  						Attack +2 x2 				Level 14:  						Stone Statue 				Level 15:  						Hit Points +3 x3 				Level 17:  						Resistance +2 x2,  						Counterattack +3 x2 				Level 18:  						Crushing Blow 				Level 19:  						Attack +3
Description: Elemental spirits live on their own Planes, and usually do not leave them voluntarily. Some powerful spellcasters are able to summon them to the Material Plane for a short time. The spirits materialize in a "body" composed of their element - this is the only way they can withstand hostile environment. Quasits are lesser spirits of the Elemental Plane of Earth. Quasits are rather weak creatures, usually summoned by a Sorcerer's Apprentice, learning the wisdom and subtleties of summoning - if the student gets it wrong, there is no need to fear for their lives. Quasits are slow, but they have fairly rugged skin, which is able to regenerate over time.

Name: Ifrit
Abilities: Level 0:  						Elemental,  						Ifrit,  						Scorching +1 x5,  						Flaming Blade +1 x4,  						Blast 				Level 1:  						Hit Points +1 x7,  						Attack +1 x10,  						Counterattack +1 x5 				Level 2:  						Stamina +1 x6,  						Resistance +1 x5,  						Defense +1 x5 				Level 4:  						Ranged Defense +1 x5 				Level 6:  						Thaumaturgy +1 x3 				Level 14:  						Stamina +2 x4 				Level 15:  						Hit Points +2 x3 				Level 16:  						Attack +2 x2,  						Reincarnation 				Level 17:  						Resistance +2 x2
Description: Elemental spirits live on their own Planes, and usually do not leave them voluntarily. Some powerful spellcasters are able to summon them to the Material Plane for a short time. The spirits materialize in a "body" composed of their element - this is the only way they can withstand hostile environment. Ifrits are lesser spirits of the Elemental Plane of Fire. Unlike other lesser elementals, usually summoned by Sorcerer's Apprentices learning the wisdom and subtleties of summoning, novice mages should reconsider before summoning a fire elemental: Fire is the most unfriendly element for living creatures. Ifrits set fire to everything they touch, only to return to their homeworld in a flash of searing flames.

Name: Naiad
Abilities: Level 0:  						Elemental,  						Ice Immunity,  						Healing (7),  						Incorporeality,  						Swamp Knowledge +1 				Level 1:  						Hit Points +1 x7,  						Counterattack +1 x5,  						Healing +1 x6 				Level 2:  						Stamina +1 x6,  						Resistance +1 x5,  						Defense +1 x5 				Level 3:  						Ammo +1 x6,  						Attack +1 x5 				Level 4:  						Ranged Defense +1 x5 				Level 10:  						Mass Cold Immunity 				Level 14:  						Stamina +2 x4 				Level 15:  						Hit Points +2 x3 				Level 17:  						Resistance +2 x2
Description: Elemental spirits live on their own Planes, and usually do not leave them voluntarily. Some powerful spellcasters are able to summon them to the Material Plane for a short time. The spirits materialize in a "body" composed of their element - this is the only way they can withstand hostile environment. Naiads are lesser spirits of the Elemental Plane of Water. Naiads are rather weak creatures, usually summoned by a Sorcerer's Apprentice, learning the wisdom and subtleties of summoning - if the student gets it wrong, there is no need to fear for their lives. On the contrary, with a rather friendly disposition, Naiads tend to protect and heal their master.
